As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Fe Marie

texts.en:
Fe Marie M. is from the village of Cutar Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Fe Marie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Fe Marie manages a business offering manicures and pedicures around their village. Fe Marie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe Marie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fe Marie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fe Marie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
This is Rosaline C., 35. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Arnel C., a driver, and is the mother of a college-aged young adult. By the grace of God, Rosaline has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level - a dream for most Filipino parents like Rosaline as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children. At this time, she is working hard to continue providing her child and her family enough to finance their everyday expenses. 

Rosaline operates an accessory business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sells it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 350 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php21,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Rosaline dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Apayi

texts.en: Apayi A.  is currently in the business of selling fish  and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and some tomatoes to sell.  Apayi is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con un hijo y con grado D. instrucción D. primaria completa.
Pastora trabaja con artesanía, elaborando todo tipo D. tejidos en miniatura, además del engorD. D. ganado. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Ahora  solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría.
texts.en:
Pastora is a member of the “Ciudad Nueva” community bank.  She is 45 years old and married with one child.  She completed her primary education.

Pastora is a craftswoman.  She makes all kinds of small knitted items.  She also fattens cattle.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and it enabled her to increase her business capital.

She is now requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to continue moving forward with her business.  What she likes about her community bank is sharing happiness.

loans.use: To increase the working capital of her craft business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Charán Coposo del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona ubicada en la región Piura que se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella realiza los pedidos de sus clientes a una empresa distribuidora, a más pedidos sus ganancias aumentan, por ello siempre se encuentra en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Adicionalmente cría ganado ovino para comercializarlo. Con los ingresos que ella obtiene de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria de su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio de venta de cosméticos instalando un pequeño establecimiento que cuente con un inventario fijo de productos, así sus vecinos no tendrán que esperar a que llegue el pedido sino que contarán con los productos que necesitan al alcance de la mano, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles..

María es una mujer responsable y hogareña, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old, has three children, and lives with her family in the village of Charán Coposo in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura region about four hours from the city of Chiclayo (capital of the Lambayeque region).

She sells beauty products from catalogs.  She places orders for her customers with a distribution business.  The more orders she places, the more income she earns, so she is always in search of new clients.  She also raises sheep to sell.  With the income she earns from these activities, she helps her husband with their family expenses.

She would like to expand her cosmetics sales business by opening a small establishment where she can have a set inventory of products.  This way, her neighbors won't have to wait for their orders to arrive, and they can count on having the products they need on hand.  In order to achieve this goal, she has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a responsible woman.  Her dream is to continue growing her business to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to start a home business

loans.name: Solidario Esfuerzo Con Vición Group

texts.es:
solidario Esfuerzos con visión.
La señora Edilma  Isabel L.  García,  tiene cuatro años de iniciar su negocio de venta de papas y pollo frito, al principio solo vendía las papas con el pasar del tiempo los clientes le pedían pollo frito, su carreta era pequeña y ahora ya tiene una carreta mas grande.  Su sueño es tener un pequeño local con mesas  donde pueda atender al cliente y darles un mejor servicio,  Al lado de sus dos hijos y su esposo seguirá luchando para salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para compra de productos comestibles para elaborar comida  También se une al grupo la señorita Claudia Jeaneth  M. quien con 30 años de edad desea seguir creciendo en su negocio para poder realizar sus sueños como vendedora, desea el crédito para comprar productos comestibles  aun tiene muchas metas para su vida y desea realizarlos.   El señor Anselmo L. G. quien viene de un lugar muy lejos para superarse cada día, solicita la oportunidad del crédito y así seguir luchando al lado de su familia, su venta de ropa variada está creciendo y en estas fechas navideñas desea aprovechar la demanda de los clientes para poder tener buenas ganancias y así tener un local muy grande donde pueda exhibir la ropa y no estar en la calle. Con el  crédito desea comprar mas variedad de ropa.
texts.en:
Esfuerzos con Visión (Efforts with Vision) Communal Bank

Mrs. Edilma  Isabel L.  García stated her fried potatoes and fried chicken business four years ago.  She used to just sell the potatoes.  As time went by customers would request fried chicken too.  Her cart was small but now she has a bigger one.  Her dream is to have a small locale with tables where she can take care of customers providing better service.  She will continue to struggle to get ahead alongside her husband and two children.  She is asking for the loan to by ingredients to prepare her food.

Miss Claudia Jeaneth  M., 30, joins the group hoping to continue to grow in her business in order to reach her dreams as a merchant.  She wants the loan to buy foodstuffs; she still has many unmet goals in life that she wants to accomplish.

Mr. Anselmo L. García who comes from very far away every day to get ahead is asking for the loan to continue struggling alongside his family.   His assorted clothing sales business is growing and he wants to take advantage of the Christmas season’s increased customer demand in order to have large profits to have a large locale where he can display and sell his clothes and not be in the street any longer.  He wants to use the loan to buy more assorted clothes.

loans.use: To buy edible products and to buy clothes.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago de 61 años de edad, casado con la Señora Myrian de 55 años  de edad, tienen  3 hijos, mayores que trabajan en el extranjero, el señor Santiago se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados, empezó realizando la venta llegando a entidades públicas y casas particulares, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación fue logrando salir adelante y gracias a la ayuda de su cónyuge ahora ya cuentan con un local en su casa y desde allí realiza su venta.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo y confianza, con este crédito otorgado realizara la compra de mas mercaderías de temporada como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas y calzados, de esa forma seguir ofreciendo a toda su clientela prendas variadas y al mejor precio.
texts.en: Santiago is 61 years old and married to 55 year-old Myrian.  They have three grown-up children who live abroad.  Santiago sells clothes and footwear.  He started in this business going to sell his products in public companies and private homes.  Through a lot of hard work and commitment he has managed to get ahead and, thanks to his wife's help, he now has a sales location in his home and he sells his products there.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for their support and trust.  He will use this loan to buy more seasonal merchandise such as blouses, dresses, pants, shirts and footwear.  In this way he hopes to continue offering his customers a variety of garments at the best possible price.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants and footwear

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica a la agricultura, la socia siembra verduras como papa, maíz y habas y también siembra frutas como platano, naranjas, uvas y manzanas, la socia las frutas y verduras lo vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras y frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor.  
         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marina is 58 years old, married and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She also works as a farmer.  She grows vegetables such as potatoes, corn and beans.  She also grows fruit such as bananas, oranges, grapes and apples.  She sells her fruit and vegetables as an itinerant street vendor.  She would like to expand her fruit and vegetables business.

Marina is requesting her loan to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Don  Luis Enrique B. es un señor de 49 años de edad quien labora como Vigilante en una empresa de impresiones desde hace 7 años. 

Don Luis vive en Ticuantepe desde hace 47 años, el es casado con una persona que depende de el.
El también tiene otros ingresos como son los que le genera la pulpería.

Este crédito es el primero y lo solicita para invertirlos en la compra de productos básicos de la pulpería de tal forma que le permitan diversificar la mercadería y poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Don  Luis Enrique B. is a 49 year old gentleman who has been working as a guard for a printing business for 7 years now.  He has lived in Ticuantepe for 47 years.  He is married and his wife is dependent on him.  He also has other income such as the income generated by a small general store.  This is his first loan.  He will use it to buy basic products for his store that will allow him to diversify his merchandise and grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other products for his general store.

loans.name: Mustopi

texts.en: Mustopi is a 35-year-old married man with six children, who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for the last three years, and the business is now at its boom stage. His vision is to become a wholesale businessman and educate the children. Mustopi needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, and posho to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and posho to sell

loans.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Claudia Q. R. tiene la edad de 27 años, estudio hasta el  tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor Victor Fabian con el cual tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y uno es hombre  a los cuales llamo Kenia y Kevin de 9 años que asisten a la primaria ellos son gemelos y Michelle de 2 años. Doña Claudia y su familia viven en a comunidad de  Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Claudia nos platica que desde hace tres años decidio iniciar su propio negocio de venta de refrescos y tacos, los tacos los vende los fines de semana(viernes, sabado y domingo) en un pequeño corredor de palma que le construyo su esposo. Ella decidio iniciar su propio negocio porque desea ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la escuela de sus pequeños. 

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de carnes, chiles, tomates, cebolla, tortillas, aceite, gas, refrescos, rabanos, col, servilletas, cebollines y limones.

Ella desea en un futuro seguir trabajando para con sus ganancias darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños y contruir un pequeño local en la parte de enfrente de su casa que da a la carretera ya que piensa que en ese espacio veran mas su negocio, sus clientes y sus ganancias aumentaran.

Ella se encuentra agradecida con la fundacion por llevar este tipo de creditos hasta su cominidad los cuales ayudan a las familias a seguir invirtiendo en sus negosios y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Claudia Q. R. is 27 years old.  She studied up to the third year of high school and is married to Victor Fabian with whom she has three children: two daughters and one son.  Her sons are called Kenia and Kevin.  They are 9 year-old twins and attend elementary school.  Her daughter Michelle is 2 years old.  Claudia and her family live in the community of Mata Naranjo which is thirty-five minutes from the town of Tierra Blanca, in the State of Veracruz. 

Claudia tells us that three years ago she decided to set up her own business selling soft drinks and tacos.  She sells her tacos on weekends (Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays) under a little palm-leaf porch that her husband built for her.  She decided to set up her own business because she wanted to help her husband cover their household expenses and their children's education.

Claudia needs this loan to invest in buying meat, chili peppers, tomatoes, onion, tortillas, oil, gas, soft drinks, radishes, cabbage, napkins, scallions and lemons.  In the future, she would like to continue working so that she can use her profits to provide her children with a better quality of life and build her own premises in the front part of her house that faces onto the street since she thinks that her business will be more visible from this space which means that her customers and profits will increase.

Claudia is grateful to Fundación Realidad for bringing this type of loan to her community as they help families to continue investing in their businesses and to provide a better quality of life to their children.

loans.use: To sell soft drinks and tacos

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido dos hijos, los dos son mayores pero su hija  vive con ella, su marido es chofer.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en un local que es de su suegra que le dio para que instale su negocio sin cobrarle arriendo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 14h00, solo preparar desayunos y almuerzos, su especialidad es el pescado apanado, nos cuenta que a sus clientes les encanta este plato tan delicioso, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, dice que ya son varios años y que le ha ido bien gracias a Dios.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que luego ella utiliza en la preparación de los alimentos. Como arroz, pescado, colas y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal hace 13 años y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.  Sus sueños son tener su propio local y un restaurante más grande.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida (Health and Life Communal Bank) meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto. This locality is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here, we become acquainted with señora Angela, age 54. She maintains a common law relationship in which she has had two children. Both are grown, but her daughter lives with her. Her husband works as a driver.

She has a small restaurant in a location belonging to her mother-in-law, who gave it to her without charging rent so that she could set up her business. She works every day from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. preparing breakfasts and lunches only. Her specialty is fried fish. She tells us that her customers love this delicious dish. Her daughter helps her with the business. She says that they have been in business for several years and are doing well thanks to God.

This loan is for the purchase of products that she will use in the preparation of meals, such as rice, fish, colas and other ingredients. This member was one of the founders of the communal bank 13 years ago. She likes it because it has helped her a lot. Her dreams are to have her own place of business and a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase rice, fish, colas and more ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Vilma, D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Usulután, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la administración D. una tienda, donD. ofrece productos D. consumo, el cual lo tiene desD. hace 5 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, ya que quiere reforzar el inventario comprando materiales que son demandados por los clientes y que espera le dé lo resultados el aumento del comercio.
Su objetivo es invertir en el negocio para fortalecerlo ya que D. él dependen económicamente ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Vilma, 43, lives in Usulután with her husband; she doesn’t have children.

She runs a grocery store selling consumables that she’s had for five years.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise because she wants to strengthen her inventory buying merchandise that’s requested by her customers hoping the result will be an increase in commerce.

Her goal is to invest in the business to strengthen it because she and her husband depend on it economically.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nueva Semilla Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”NUEVA SEMILLA”, está iniciando su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Adela. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos Tienda de barrio, macramé, costura, venta de frutas, taller de tejido de mantas y chalinas, venta de chuño, venta de verduras, repostería.

La presidenta, la señora Adela es una mujer de 40 años es soltera y tiene una hija. Este es su segundo año que trabaja con asociaciones comunales,  desarrollando un negocio sola. 

En la actualidad comercializa frutas, las que compra de la zona de El Tejar (de los carros); con el crédito que sacará pretende iniciar un negocio de tejido, los que venderá los días viernes en la ex tranca de 8:00 a 15:00..

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella respondió que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The  ”NUEVA SEMILLA” [New Seed] Communal Association is in its second cycle in the Regional Office of the Andes. This community association has the participation of eight members. The board of directors has Adela as president. 

The women's business' are different. Among them are: neighborhood store, macramé, sewing, fruit selling, a blanket and shawl weaving workshop, selling potato flour, selling vegetables, and pastries.  

The president, Adela, is a 40 year old woman. She is single and has a daughter. This is her second year working with community associations, developing a business by herself. 

At present, she sells fruit. She buys them in the area of El Tejar (from the trucks); with the loan she will take out, she plans on starting a weaving business. She will sell her product on Fridays at Extranca from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

When we asked her what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the trainings.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia C. lives in Pta. Miray, Baliangao and has three grown children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a general store and earns a monthly income of about PHP 2,800.

In 2004, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans and is applying for a new one, for PHP 30,000, to buy new items to sell to her customers. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like curtains, pants, shirts, etc.

Emelia has taken out and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear business for seven years and also earns income from transportation (tricycle--a three-wheeled transport vehicle).

Emelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José es un cliente de 68 años de edad, que vive en casa propia con su esposa. La casa está ubicada en la parte rural del distrito Tambogrande  en Piura. 

La actividad que desarrolla José es la crianza de ganado ovino y agricultura, cuenta con una experiencia de 10 años en este rubro. José comercializa a los ovinos, una vez que han alcanzado  tamaño y peso ideal, en el mercado local. Además, cuenta con una pacerla  donde cosecha limón semanalmente.

José solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles  que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado.

José es un cliente conocido para nuestra entidad cancelo puntual y responsablemente su crédito anterior que también fue  un préstamo KIVA.

José es un señor trabajador que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 68 years old and he lives in a house of his own together with his wife. The house is located in the rural region of the district of Tambogrande in Piura.

Jose's business activity to raise sheep and agriculture. He has 10 years' experience in the field. He sells his sheep once they have reached an ideal size and weight in the local market. Additionally, he also has a parcel of farm land where he harvests lemons weekly.

Jose requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

Jose is a known client to our organization and he has repaid his past loan, also acquired through Kiva, on time and in a responsible manner. 

Jose is a hardworking person who wants to improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his sheep.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is 51 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 24 and 28 years old. She takes care of five children. Sifa sells sacks of charcoal and has 1 year of experience. She employs two people to help her. She runs her business from 7am to 9pm every day. 

Sifa has requested a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the profits, she will be able to save money in order to expand her business and to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, de 56 años reside en el caserío de Antabamba, se caracteriza por ser un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Julia de 57 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes cuida con mucha dedicación. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Ignacio en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia, ya que junto a su esposa son los encargados de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando papa, arvejas, habas, maíz y hortalizas, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos, ya que sabe que unos productos sanos se venden a mejor precio. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros del poblado de Antabamba, que es donde tiene sus terrenos agrícolas. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la compra y venta de reses, donde los enseba para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Es por ello que para el futuro espera mejorar sus chacras y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ignacio de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, 20 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “yungay”, abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales.
texts.en:
Ignacio is 56 years old and lives in the small village of Antabamba.  He is noted for being a very simple and hard-working father.  He lives in his own home together with his wife, 57 year-old Julia, and his three dependent children who he looks after with a lot of dedication.

Ignacio's arduous workdays on his farm have helped him to improve his family's economic situation.  He and his wife are responsible for looking after their children's well-being and so they work as hard as they can, growing potatoes, peas, beans, corn and other vegetables.  They then take their produce to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

What Ignacio most enjoys about his work is caring for his crops since he knows that healthy produce fetches a better price.  He has been in this business for 12 years and he considers the hardest part of his work to be having to climb the steep hills of Antabamba which is where he has his farmland.

Ignacio has support from his wife who buys and sells cattle.  She fattens them up and then sells them on for a higher price.  In the future, Ignacio hopes to improve his farm and sow all of his land.

Ignacio is a member of the "Los Pinos de Antabamba" (The Pine Trees of Antabamba) community bank and this is his sixth loan from MFP.  He hopes for a small loan which will enable him to reach his goals.  For his part, he pledges once more to make his repayments on time, as he has done with his previous loans.  Ignacio enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Ignacio will invest the money he has requested in buying a bag of pea seeds, 20 sacks of Yungay potatoes, organic manure and natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds, 20 sacks of potato seeds, organic manure and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Cherel

texts.en: Cherel is 29 years old. She is married with three children. Cherel has a shop that sells rice, snacks, and some basic goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 to buy additional rice to sell and additional goods, like snacks, canned goods, oil, vinegar, and more. Cherel became a member of HSPFI this year, 2011. In the future, Cherel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and other stock to sell

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANANTIAL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra y venta de enaguas, tejido de mantas, elaboración de cereales, tejido de enaguas y polainas, tienda de barrio
 
La señora Juana,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora que visito su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de enaguas y chompas que viene trabajando hace treinta y seis años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus amigas.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana), este material lo compra de la calle la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto), posteriormente elaborado sus productos los venderá en el Desaguadero. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando le preguntamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella respondio que la capacitación y la atención medica
texts.en: The "Manantial" group is starting its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer and is from the community of Collpani. The group consists of eight members and is headed by Juana. The members have various businesses, including: buying and selling skirts, weaving blankets, harvesting grains, weaving skirts and garters, and running a neighborhood store. Juana says this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she was invited to join by a promoter who visited her home. She has had a business selling wool skirts and sweaters for 36 years, learning the trade from her friends. She plans to use the loan to increase her capital and buy more wool, which she purchases on La Ceja street, the commercial center of the city of El Alto. She will then make the products to sell. This job allows her to generate income to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has four children. When we asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied the training and the health care.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has three children. 

Rocel has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, shoes, sandals and blouses. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional stock of t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Rocel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Foussena

texts.fr:
Foussena est  une femme  âgée de 32ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Foussena travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle vend seule  des épices, des cadenats et divers au marché de NUKAFU. Elle achète les produits à ACCRA et Grand Marché. 
Foussena a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des épices, des cadenats et divers.
texts.en:
Foussena is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a merchant. She has two children.
Foussena has been working as a retailer since 1999. She works alone to sell spices, condiments and miscellaneous items on the market in Nufaku. She buys her products in Accra and in Grand Market.
Foussena has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy spices, condiments and various other items.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 34 years old and is a married man with 4 children. His oldest child is 10 years old.

Alex is a farmer who owns and tills a plot of land in Banga, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice to sell. Alex works hard to support his family. Since his wife was not working, he decided to put up a sari-sari store that his wife can manage. He said that the store will help with their daily needs.

Alex has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for their businesses to grow.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Angela Marilu

texts.es:
Angela Marilú tiene 28 años de edad es soltera, vive con los papás y con la hija de dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Angela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprarse un solar y poder hacer una casa para poder vivir con la fa,ilia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Ángela Marilú, 28, is single living with her parents and two-year-old daughter in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Heading toward the Future) communal bank which is located in Jesús de Gran Poder, Ventanas Canton, are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Ángela farms corn and rice.  She buys her supplies at the Marlín supply center and her sales are also there and in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizer to maintain her crops in good condition so that she can sell them later on for better prices.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  

She faces challenges like crop diseases and infestations.  Her dream is to buy a piece of land to build a house to live in with her family.  In her spare time she enjoys going on excursions and dedicating more time to work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Twitekumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Emile fait partie du groupe Twitekumurimo. Le nom du groupe signifie « avoir du courage au travail ». Il est célibataire avec 3 personnes en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est l’école primaire. 

Emile est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver une race améliorée de riz à moindre coût. Dans les prochaines années, Emile voudrait vendre à un grand nombre de consommateurs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses petits frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
Emile is a member of the loan group Twitekumurimo which means "working hard". He is single with 3 persons in charge. Emile stopped going to school after middle school and is now a rice farmer. It is his first loan cycle with ACB and will use it to purchase fertilizer and to pay workforce for his rice crop. 
To grow his business, his strategy is to cultivate a superior breed of rice at lower cost. In the next years, Emile would like to sell his production to a large number of consumers. With the benefits, he plans to give education to his younger brothers and sisters.

loans.use: He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the workforce to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a cafeteria since 2009 and has almost three years of experience working in the same occupation. With his requested loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase a coffee machine for his shop. He states that with this machine, he will be able to satisfy his customers' demand and allow them to enjoy their time while visiting his cafeteria. This will be his first Kiva loan and he hopes that it will help him achieve remarkable growth in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a coffee machine.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan, who is 25 years old, is a resident who comes from the Kompong Chhnang province. She is married with two children between the ages of 3 and 10.  Mrs. Chan has been working as a garment factory worker since the factory was created in the province. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a domestic rice farmer and fisherman. He fishes in the pond and river in his village. Mrs. Chan usually works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day. From her job, she is able earn an income of around $2 (USD) each day for supporting the family’s needs. Mrs. Chan would like to request a loan in order to buy a new net and other fishing materials to support her husband in his fishing activity. In the future, Mrs. Chan hopes she can increase her income to buy some vegetables, meats and a few fresh fish to sell in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy a new net and other fishing materials to support her husband in his fishing activity.

loans.name: Flor Delys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flor Delys; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende arroz,azúcar,leche,fideos y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Flor Delys, 24, belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores-Poroy” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a grocery store.  She sells rice, sugar, milk, noodles and cookies.  She works from 8am until 9pm.  Through this business she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with 4 school-going children. Her husband is an accountant who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Christine has operated a curio shop for the past 2 years; her potential clients are tourists and the locals around her shop. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; there are low sales in some months. She dreams of exporting her products in the future.  With her KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase more curios and renovate her stand. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more curios and renovate her stand.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thu supports her family by running an internet shop at her house. She started her business six months ago. She intends to take a loan to invest in her business by buying more computers and related appliances. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can set aside some savings for her family's future needs.

loans.use: to buy computers and related appliances for her internet shop.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is a business man who buys/sells copra (dried coconut meat) and bananas.  He lives in Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City. He is married to Maribel, age 23,  and they had one blessing that came in their life and that is his child. 

Jerry gets his source of living in his buy and sell copra/banana. He has been able to maintain his business successfully from a young age. As his 1st cycle of loan neared completion, Jerry was allowed to borrow PHP 50,000.00 to add his capital for his existing business.  The future income from his business will be used for his basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future of his family.

loans.use: have additional capital for buying/selling copra and bananas.

location.town: Tangub-Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene  67 años de edad, es viuda y tiene seis hijos.  La señora estudio hasta 2do de educación primaria.

Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de alfajores y otras golosinas.

En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra diez quintales de harina, tres bolsas de azúcar, cinco cajas de manteca, cuatro litros de leche y cinco bidones de gas, para la elaboración de los alfajores. En le negocio le ayudan sus hijos.

La señora desea continuar con el negocio y mejorar poco a poco sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión, la puntualidad, la ganancia del ahorro y los incentivos.
texts.en:
Ignacia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ahorro es Progreso” (Saving is Progress) which is located in the Province and Department of Puno. She is 67 years old, widowed, and has six children. Sra. Ignacia studied through the second grade.

Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling cookies and other types of sweets. She is currently requesting a new loan in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of 10 quintales (1 quintal = 46 kg) of flour, 3 bags of sugar, 5 cases of butter, 4 liters of milk, and 5 tanks of gas so that she can prepare her cookies. Her children help with her business.

Sra. Ignacia wants to continue with her business and gradually improve her earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the unity, the punctuality, the interest from her savings, and the incentives.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, milk, and gas.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Joyce has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Joyce rents a shop where she works from , by means of retail. 

Joyce has requested  for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids for the festive season.  Joyce's main business challenges include include thieves, defaulters, and the increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big, to own a fully stocked salon, also to educate her children up to university.  Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cream relaxers, weaves, and braids.

loans.name: Clara Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Clara es socia del banco comunal Mira, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, caracterizándose por la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población en especial la joven labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

La Señora. Clara tiene 28 años, es madre soltera ha concebido 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad y su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive con su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar, la casa de su mamá es propia.

Doña Clara trabaja en la agricultura y sus cosechas son solo para su consumo, también se dedica  a la ganadería y la leche que obtiene la vende, cría gallinas, cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en su comunidad. También realiza guaipe (trapos para limpiar).
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su cuñada, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros y en una vaca.
 
Su meta es criar más animales.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the communal bank Mira. She lives in the Zhimdad parish in Cuenca, which is characterized by its natural beauty. Its people are farmers and ranchers, and many, especially the young people, work in the city doing different kinds of work. Clara is a 28-year-old single mother and has two children, ages 7 and 3. Her first son is studying in elementary school in town. She does not have her own home; rather she lives with her mother, sharing the household expenses. Her mother owns the home. 

Clara is a farmer and her harvests are used only for the family’s consumption. She also raises cattle and sells the milk from the cows. She raises hens, guinea pigs that she sells to the community. She also makes rags (cloths used for cleaning). 

This is her first loan with the communal bank that she joined on invitation by a good friend. She will use the loan to invest in a cow and fertilizer to improve her fields. Her goal is to raise more animals.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and a cow

loans.name: Maritza Estella

texts.es: Maritza, quiere invertir en su negocio comprando leña y maíz por mayor cantidad, por eso solicita este nuevo préstamo para tener los insumos necesarios y continuar en el negocio; ella considera que estos préstamos le han dado giro distinto a su negocio, ya que tiene materia prima para su producción y poder generar ventas más estables con los clientes, sus ganancias han aumentado y su situación económica está mejorando.
texts.en: Maritza wants to invest in her business buying firewood and corn in large amounts and this is why she’s asking for a new loan to have the necessary ingredients to stay in business.  She feels that these loans have given her business a new spin because she has raw materials for production and she can generate more stable sales with her customers; her profits have increased and her economic situation is improving.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Gerson Manriquez

texts.es:
El señor Gerson esta casado, es padre de dos hijos, vive en la aldea el tular y se ha dedicado a la fabricacion y venta de hamancas, este tipo de producto es buscado por muchas personas, ya que sirve para descanzar y en algunas veces se utiliza para dormir en vez de una cama, esta zona es la mas caliente de Honduras y el calor hace que las personas no soporten estar acostadas en camas y busquen acostarse en hamacas. 
Gerson por la jornada de la noche trabaja como bombero en una camaronera.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las hamacas, en unos dos meses comienza la epoca de verano en Honduras y cada vez va aumentando el calor en esa zona, desea estar preparado para cuando las personas busquen este tipo de producto.
texts.en:
Gerson is married, the father of two children and lives in the village of El Tular. He makes a living making and selling hammocks. This type of product is sort after by many people as it is used to rest in and sometimes to sleep in, instead of a bed. This area is the hottest in Honduras and the heat means people can not bear to lay down on a bed and instead lie in hammocks.

Gerson works a night shift as a firefighter in a shrimp farm.

He will use this loan to buy materials to makes the hammocks. In a month or two the summer season starts in Honduras and the area gets hotter and hotter. He wants to be prepared for when people start looking for this type of product.

loans.use: to buy thick threads, hemp, and cabuya fibers..

loans.name: Andres Roberto

texts.es:
Andrés es un hombre de 59 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que siempre ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que él es padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, ya que se quedo huérfano a muy corta edad, Andrés no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios y tampoco pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Andrés trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de helados y deliciosos postres, como pasteles, alfajores y otros, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por la amabilidad que brinda a sus clientes.
Andrés se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir una pared de ladrillos y concreto que cerque la parte trasera de su hogar, de esta manera él podrá contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Andrés seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder tener una gran pastelería.
texts.en:
Andrés is a 59-year-old man and lives in the city of Cañete in the Imperial district with his son, who he loves and is his primary motivation for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has always dedicated all of his efforts to getting his son ahead, as he is both father and mother to his son. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and because of necessity he had to work from the time he was very young; he was orphaned at a young age. Andrés was not able to finish elementary school, nor was he able to study for a professional career. In his free time he likes to prepare delicious pastries to share with his family. 

Of his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Andrés works at his small business selling ice cream and delicious baked goods, like pastries, alfajores [cookies] and other things. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that his business is going well because of the friendliness he provides to his clients.

Andrés is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to improve his home. He wants to construct a wall of bricks and concrete around the back part of his house. In this way he will have greater security and well-being, and will thus be able to keep working and making an effort to achieve his great dream of being able to have a great bakery.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Yeredon 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe YEREDON 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  29 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJIDJENI, commune de FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz et l’arachide avec MINATA SALIFOU la personne au milieu sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Susan, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. She is 30 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 9 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya.  She is married and has 4 children.

Susan is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Susan says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2015, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Susan will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start dairy farming

loans.name: Mayunga

texts.en:
Mayunga is married with three children. He lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He sells vegetable and fruits near his residence. He buys fresh produce from nearby villages for resale at a small profit. The business has been the main source of livelihood for he and his family for the past five years. If his business is expanded, he will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for his two children. His business has had trouble growing because of limited capital.

The proposed loan will allow Mayunga to expand his business through adding new products. The amount need to expand his business is USD 550.

loans.use: Expand business selling fresh produce

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
My name is Jose M. and I sell sweets and 'churros' (doughnut like pastries). I have been doing this for a year and my sales are good as I am located near the national football stadium. My goal is to buy more ingredients so I can sell a wider variety of products. I would use the earnings to buy food for my new-born son.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Jose M. me dedico a la venta de dulces y churros, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mis ventas son buenas ya que estoy ubicado cerca del estadio nacional de futbol, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayor variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarle comida a mi hijo que esta recien nacido.

loans.use: To buy sweets, churros, chocolate and gum/compra de confites, churros, bombones, chocolates, chicles.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Julie M. is married and is the mother of seven children. With her husband’s meager salary and her inability to get a job because of lack of education and vocational training, she found a lot of difficulties paying school fees for her seven children. This motivated her to join GHAPE and she obtained a first loan of $30. Since then, she has successfully invested and repaid loans up to $200. With the money raised, she confesses that her children no longer suffer because she can afford their fees.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to buy a taxi to be driven by her son who has been trained in motor mechanics and driving. Motor taxi is a necessary means of transportation as the majority of the population has no personal cars. She plans to use the profit to continue paying school fees for her children and provide food for the family. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Julie would like to purchase a taxi for her son to drive to make money for the family and pay the children's school fees.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Ten years ago at the age of 27, this young man decided to start his own business.  He and his family live in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region. Saleh is married, and has one child. He needs a loan of $1200 to purchase pesticides so that he can improve his orchard farming and enjoy a rich harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Omowumin

texts.en: “LAPO has been a source of blessing for my business”, says O. who lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. O. is 50 years old, and has 3 children, and sells foodstuffs at her local market. She has been in this business since 1977, and needs the loan of $400 to purchase more foodstuffs for her sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Koim

texts.en:
Mrs. Koim P., 49, works with her husband on their plot of land growing rice crops and breeding ducks, earning collectively around $6 a day in revenue from selling duck eggs to a wholesaler at a market.

This couple has five children. Two are employed at a garment factory; one is a student and the remaining two are now unemployed.

Mrs. Koim P. hopes to use this loan to purchase more ducks and feed for her livestock and the use the remaining money to buy a motorcycle so that her husband can generate more income for her family by operating a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru:
Karima is Muslim, she was born in 1978 and she is married with 2 children. Her husband imports goods from Kyrgyzstan and she sells them together with her mother-in-law at the Korvon market in Dushanbe, capital of Tadjikistan. She deals in women's clothes: hijabs (covered women's garment - long sleeves, long skirt and a matching scarf which will cover everything but the eyes), knitted jackets and leather jackets. She has had a pretty stable business for the last 4 years. She attends to her customer's requests quickly and helps them choose their garments. She also has time to read her prayers five times a days and believes that the success of her business depends on the mercy of the Allah. She is requesting a loan from Kiva for the purpose of purchasing warm clothes for February.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Карима-мусульманка, 1978 года рождения,замужем имеет 2 детей.Муж привозит товары из Киргизии и она продает их вместе со свекровью на рынке "Корвон ",Душанбе,Таджикистан.Она торгует женской одеждой:Хиджабы(закрытая женская одежда-длинные рукава,длиный подол платья и имеет в комплекте платок скрывающийвсю голову и лицо кроме глаз),кофты и кожанные куртки-френч. Она имеет достаточно стабильный бизнес, налаженный ею в течении 4 лет.Она быстро обслуживает и так же помогает выбирать одежду своим клиенткам.Она так же успевает читать молитву 5 раз в день и считает, что успех её бизнеса зависит от милости бога. В данный момент она нуждается в финансированнии для закупки очередного товара на февраль месяц.

loans.use: Buying the warm assortment of women clothes.

loans.name: Elsen

texts.en: Elsen A. is a taxi driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 21 years old and has been working as a taxi driver for the last 3 years. He is currently looking for funding so he can make some much needed repairs and improvements to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his taxi cab

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita S. lives in Dhalko, Kathmandu. Most of the people in this region are engaged in business like grocery shops, utensil shops, etc. Mrs. S. lives with her husband and one son who is at primary school.

Mrs. S. and her husband Mr. Rakesh S. opened their grocery shop five years ago. They sell different types of grocery items in their shop like rice, maize, noodles, biscuits, and others items. Now they are facing financial problems because competition is very high, and in order to stay in business they need to add different varieties of goods to their shop. However, due to lack of funds they cannot do this, so Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan to buy different varieties of grocery goods for their shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
For Mr. Luis G., his general store business should be improved because every day new competitors emerge that obligate him to make changes in his business in order to keep offering his products. He is originally from the Somotillo neighborhood in Chinandega, where he works to support his wife and son, for whom he is responsibile.

Nowadays his business needs an immediate investment in merchandise like food and personal products. For this reason Ceprodel has helped him obtain a loan that gives him the opportunity to purchase these products to sell at his store. Through this loan, Mr. G. will be able to purchase the products that he needs to diversify his inventory and attract more customers to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Para el señor Luis G., su negocio de pulpería debe ser mejorado por el hecho de que cada día surgen nuevos competidores que obligan a efectuar cambios en los negocios para continuar ofertando sus productos. El es originario del municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega donde se esfuerza para mantener a su esposa e hijo que están bajo su responsabilidad

Hoy en día su negocio está necesitando la inversión inmediata de la mercadería como comestibles y productos personales. Por esto es que de manera personal ha asistido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le den la oportunidad de adquirir estos productos para comercializarlos en su negocio. Por medio de este préstamo se dará lugar a que al adquirir los productos el señor G. diversifique su inventario atrayendo mas clientes para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Stephano Mpims' Tujikwamue Uk E Group

texts.en:
Stephano M., age 40, is married with four children (ages 18, 11,7 and 1). He has a butcher shop which he began 10 years ago. His shop is open from 5am to 3pm daily and he is able to make a monthly profit of around $567.

Stephano has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to help support his butcher shop. He hopes for a new loan to open another butchery. Stephano will share this loan with his subgroup members selling charcoal, soap, vegetable, fruits, annd food.

In the picture Stephano is 1st from left standing in back row

loans.use: to open another butchery

loans.name: Vu

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Khéo, 72 years old, joined the fund in 1997. Although she is far along in her years, she is still quite healthy. She has single-handedly cared for and provided for her family because her husband passed away at an early age. She has three children – all of which have their own families. Currently, she is living with one of her children. Her family grows fruit-bearing trees, mainly banana.

Before joining the fund, Mrs. Vũ and her children combined their resources and put it towards starting a farm to rear animals and grow plants. Her family has been able to overcome many hardships with determination and hard work, such that the family’s financial situation has improved and her children are now established.

She is applying for a loan in the amount of 10,000,000 VND to invest in their farming business. Their average monthly income is 3,500,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Khéo 72 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997, mặc dù tuổi đã cao nhưng chị vẫn còn rất khỏe, chị có 3 người con đều đã xây dựng gia đình, hiện nay chị đang sống cùng vợ chồng 1 người con trai, gia đình chị có vườn trồng cây ăn quả và loài cây chính gia đình chị đầu tư vào là chuối. Chồng mất sớm nên mọi lo toan công việc trong gia đình đều do đôi bàn tay chị, khi tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn chị đã cùng các con đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi và làm vườn, với sự cố gắng và quyết tâm của chị và các con nên kinh moi khó khăn gia đình chị đều vượt qua, đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển, các con chị cũng đã trưởng thành. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm vườn. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raise animals and Growing plants (banana trees)

loans.name: Benkadi 3 (L’Entente Est Une Bonne Chose). Group

texts.fr:
The women of the Benkadi group are married and, on average, are 35 years old and have five children. They live in traditional families with their husbands, generally their husbands’ other wives, and their children in Djinina, a village in the Fana subprefecture, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali. They all have small businesses that consist of selling food items, clothing, charcoal, fruits and vegetables, etc. They are primarily united by the fact that they live in the same village. Benkadi has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for four years and has obtained eight group loans which were all repaid in full. The group members who sell charcoal generally buy it in other villages and then sell it for cash on market days to business clients from Bamako or Ségou. The other women buy their condiments in Fana and then sell them retail in the village. With this loan, the women of the Benkadi group from Djinina, Fana hope to each earn a monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs, which will be mostly used to pay off the interest on the loan and resolve some financial problems. The rest will be used for capital.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 35 ans et 5 enfants qui vivent dans de familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, généralement avec coépouses et des enfants dans le village de Djinina, un des villages de la sous préfecture de Fana, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. Elles exercent toutes le petit commerce : de denrées alimentaires, d’habillements, de charbon de bois, de fruits et légumes etc. Elles sont essentiellement liées par des relations de voisinage. Benkadi est en relation avec Soro Yirwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans et a obtenu 8 prêts solidaires, tous correctement remboursés. Pour celles qui vendent du charbon de bois, elles s’approvisionnent généralement dans les villages et effectuent leurs ventes au comptant les jours de foires à une clientèle de commerçant provenant d Bamako ou de Ségou. Par contre, les autres s’approvisionnent en condiment à Fana pour les revendre au village en détail. Avec ce prêt les femmes du groupe Benkadi de Djinina, Fana espèrent avoir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000 FCFA qui sera essentiellement utilisé à payer les intérêts du prêt, à résoudre certains problèmes sociaux et le reste incorporé au capital.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and fruit

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa S., born in 1963, is married and has six children and one other person in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Keur Khaly, in Thiès, for seven years. She wants to buy shoes, incense, and perfume, and to make clothing to sell. Awa wishes to bolster her business in order to better address the needs of her family and to ensure the schooling of her children. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Awa S., née en 1963 est mariée avec 06enfants et 01 autre personne en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Keur Khaly à Thiès depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des chaussures, de l’encens, des parfums et confectionner des habits pour vendre. Awa souhaite renforcer son commerce pour mieux faire face aux besoins de sa famille et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in shoes, clothing, parfume, and incense

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana inició su negocio, cuando vio una buena oportunidad ya que su casa esta ubicada en una avenida principal de la colonia, por lo que seria un buen punto de venta. Inicio hace 10 años con una tienda de abarrotes, pero se dio cuenta que la ropa le dejaba mas márgenes de ganancia, por lo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de esta.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquiriendo ropa nueva de temporada otoño que esta por empezar.
texts.en:
Juana started her business when she noticed a good opportunity, since her house is located on the residential zone’s main avenue, which would be an optimal sales location. She started out with a general store 10 years ago, but she later realized that clothing gave her greater profits, which is why she decided to sell this instead.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, so that she can purchase apparel for the imminent fall season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (fall fashions)

loans.name: Najeeb Allah

texts.en:
Najeeb Allah is married. He is educated. He worked in a government place in Afghanistan, but after 15 years working, he decided to open a retail shop. He has been working for more than 5 years and still he is making progress, but he has always wanted to expand this business. He was unable to do that until he found AFSG in Kabul and applied for a loan.

Therefore, he wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to complete his retail stock and enlarge his shop to become strong in his business to support his family better in the future.

Najeeb is happy with this loan that helps him in this business. He is sure that he can further his business with more success. Finally, he would like to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: To complete his retail stock and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina es socia del Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Guillermina es casada, tiene 63 años y 3 hijos D. 40, 38 y 32 años. Todos sus hijos  trabajan. 
Guillermina tiene su negocio D. crianza D. chanchos en el distrito D. Mala, Guillermina cría y venD. chanchos, ella viaja 3 veces al mes a Mala llevando la comida para sus animales, compra semanalmente 2 sacos D. comida, tiene personal en Mala que se encarga D. ver a sus animales .
Guillermina actualmente apoya a sus nietos , los está criando.
Guillermina necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. comida para los animales. 
Guillermina sueña con seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the San Gabriel Community Bank. She is married, 63 years old and mother of three children, ages 40, 38 and 32, all of whom work for a living. Guillermina's business raises pigs in the district of Mala, Peru. She raises the pigs and then sells them. She travels three times a month to Mala to take feed to her animals; she buys two sacks of feed a week. She has workers in Mala in charge of watching her livestock. Guillermina currently is raising her grandchildren. She's requesting a loan of 400 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of feed for her animals. Her dream is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Carina

texts.en: Carina is a member of the Covadonga Village Bank. She is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their child. She sells a variety of puddings made with purple corn, rice and pumpkin from a mobile cart each day in the Magdalena Market which is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho.  Carina is requesting a loan to buy a small cart to sell pudding from. Carina’s dreams are to have a stable job, to open her own store, and for her child to graduate from college with a professional degree.

loans.use: To buy a cart to sell pudding from

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo inició el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso que le permitiera apoyar a su casa con los gastos, ya que vive con sus padres  y junto con su hermano iniciaron el negocio, en un lote donde originalmente solo estaba el auto lavado. Ahora ya es una plaza donde los dueño son familiares, y acondicionaron el local acorde a los negocios dentro de la Plaza. Comenzó el negocio en mayo del 1994 por iniciativa de su hermano montaron el auto lavado donde son socios., ya que por la falta de estudio no les era posible colocarse en un empleo un poco mejor redituado. 
Desde que iniciamos les ha ido muy bien ya que a parte de que están  en una plaza Comercial, los  mismos clientes la han ido recomendando gracias al   excelente trabajo que realizan, ya que el auto lavado tiene mas afluencia de clientes

El necesita un préstamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 6 meses para  comprar una aspiradora para hacer un mejor trabajo, ya que ese es uno de sus servicios distintivos, porque desmontan el interior para hacer el aspirado a profundidad.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo started the business because he needed and income to support his household with the expenses since he lives with his parents. Together with his brother, they started the business at a lot where originally only the car wash was built. Now it is a square where his relatives are owners and they conditioned the lot according to the existing businessess inside the square. He started the business in May of 1994. At his brother's initiative, they established a car wash where they are partners and due to their lack of education it was impossible for them to get better compensated jobs.

Since they started, it has been going very good since besides that they are located at a commercial square, the same clients have been recommended them thanks to the excellent work that they do. The car wash has a good flow of clients.

He needs a $ 225 loan ($3,000 MXN) that he will pay back in 6 months. He will use the money to buy a vaccum cleaner to do a better job. This is one of their distinctive services because they unmount the interior to do a deeper vaccum.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a vaccum cleaner

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee cuenta con 29 años de edad, estuvo conviviendo por 9 años, pero hace 6 meses se ha casado, por el momento esta viviendo en la casa de sus suegra. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando arvejas y papas, pero lo que más le agrada es cultivar flores de gladiolo, aunque tienen un largo proceso; una vez listas las pepitas de semilla se procede a abrir los surcos, en seguida se colocan las semillas y se entierra, se espera a que germine, una ves que haya brotado la planta se procede con el fumigado hasta que maduren las flores. Lo más gratificante para ella es el precio en que los llega a vender en el mes de mayo y octubre por las festividades del día de la madre y de los muertos respectivamente, llegan a pagarle por el paqueta hasta 80 soles, pasada esta temporada baja hasta mitad el precio, pero igual no pierde, ya que lo que aun esta en la tierra, lo deja madurar para realizar el proceso de la semilla. En semilla cuesta mucho más, la vende a 150 soles el saco, por todo este beneficio es lo que le agrada sembrar gladiolos.
