Haydee es nueva en MFP, ella y otras amistades han formado un nuevo banco comunal con el compromiso de pagar todas las cuotas en el día indicado y seguir las instrucciones de su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para comprar 10 sacos de abono para su chacra de flores que va sembrar en estos días, tiene referencia que cada saco le costará 95 soles y con lo que le pueda sobrar comprará veneno contra las moscas.
texts.en:
Haydee is 29 years old and has been living with the man who is her husband for nine years, and they have been married for six. At the moment she is living with her mother-in-law. Ever since she was very young, she has been committed to agriculture, growing peas and potatoes. But what gives her the most pleasure is growing gladiolas, although the process for doing so is much more involved. When the seeds are ready to be planted, the rows must be tilled, then the seeds must be planted and buried. Then you must wait until they germintate, then once the plants get buds, you fumigate them until the flowers are mature. The most gratifying part for her is the price she is able to sell them for in the months of May and October, when the holidays of Mother's Day and the Day of the Dead occur, respectively, when a bouquet can be sold for 80 soles. When these seasons have passed, the price goes down to half of that, but the loss does not matter as long as she can be in the land--she could take or leave the mature flowers for the process of just growing the seeds. The seeds cost a lot and are sold for about 150 soles for a sack, but the benefit is being able to grwo gladiolas. Haydee is new to the lender, MFP, and she and others have formed a new comunnal bank with the commitment of paying all of the payments back by the time indicated and according to the instructions of the loan consultant. The money that she asks for will buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her flower farm, with the point of reference that a sack will cost 95 soles and with which she will have more than enough to also prevent flies.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina inició el negocio  por la necesidad de tener un ingreso que le permitiera salir adelante y de ser una mujer independiente, sin miedo a los retos y trascender como persona y como madre, realizando lo que le gusta que son las ventas y obteniendo un ingreso para sostener a sus hijas ya que quedo viuda. Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 1996 vendiendo un poco de todo, primeramente ropa, luego tuvo una tiendita, luego vendió también joyería de oro y cerámica y después abrió una papelería y hace cuatro años fue que comenzó a vender adornos rústicos, que es la única actividad que desempeña al día de hoy y en la cual le ha ido muy bien, ya que cada vez tengo mas clientes que compran sus productos y por lo mismo ha logrado incrementar sus ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas, con este dinero va a comprar más mercancía que le permita tener una mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina started her business out of the necessity to have an income that lets her move ahead, be an independent woman, not be afraid of challenges and improve as a person. As a mother, she likes to sell goods and obtain an income to support her daughters, now that she is a widow. She started her business in April of 1996, selling a little of everything. At first she sold clothes, then she had a small general store, then she also sold gold jewelry and ceramics. Then she opened a stationary shop and for 4 years ago she began selling country decorations, which is all she does now. This has been doing very well, and she is always getting new customers to buy her products. Her earnings have increased because of this.

She needs a loan of 4,000 Mexican pesos, and she will pay it in 8 2-week periods. With this money she is going to buy more merchandise that will let her have a larger variety of products for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby S. is engaged in rice farming. She is 28-years old and has three loving children. Her husband, Junifer S., is also a farmer. They work together to sustain the needs of their children. Their harvest is intended for the family consumption, and what is left over is sold to rice traders in their village. The farm is what Ruby depends on to feed, clothe and educate her family.

She is requesting a loan from CEVI which she will use to buy fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will greatly help Ruby improve her harvest and make it easier to pay for her family's daily needs.

CEVI continues to help people start and have their own business. They provide their clients not just credit assistance but trainings about business and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo solidario Pio XII, conformado por las señoras Zoila Luz, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Nacatamales, la otra integrante es la señora Melenciana quien vende tortillas y fritos sobre la carretera a su comunidad y refrescos naturales y jugos enlatados, y la señora Leda María quien vende nacatamales y sopas los días Lunes . Estas mujeres son originarias de la originarias de la comarca Pio XII que pertenece a la ciudad de Masaya, ubicada al sur de la nuestra ciudad capital, estas mujeres son muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras, responsables, y semi-analfabetas, pero con muchos deseos de superación. Estas señoras abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores.


Doña Zoila Luz R., es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de Nacatamales los fines de semana, ella vende en su casa, pero la mayoría va a venderlos al Mercado Oriental, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, con el crédito ha logrado abaratar sus costos porque los insumos de los productos los compra al por mayor, es conocida como persona muy responsable en su comunidad y además por la actividad que realiza. Trabajan con Adim porque una de las clientas le animó que se integrará en un grupo solidario, así ella conformó su grupo con dos amigas cercanas y obtuvo el préstamo. Están contentas porque sienten que la institución confía en ellas y expresan que se proponen a quedar bien en los pagos.
texts.en:
This is the group Pio XII made up of Zoila Luz who sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales), Melenciana who sells tortillas, fried foods, natural juices and canned juices along the highway to her community, and Leda María who sells nacatamales and soups on Mondays. These women are natives of the Pio XII region in the city of Masaya, located South of the capital city. These women are hard-workers, responsible entrepreneurs, and are semi-literate, but with many wishes to overcome. These women make payments every Monday, which is the best day to make payments after the higher weekend sales. Doña Zoila Luz Robelto is a 49-year-old woman, married, and mother of three children, all whom are older. Her business is in the production and sales of nacatamales on the weekends. She sells from her home, but the majority goes to sell at the Mercado Oriental market. She has worked in this for many years. With credit, she has been able to reduce her costs because she can buy consumables in bulk. She is known as a responsible person in her community and her business. They work with ADIM, because another client encouraged her to form an integrated group. She formed her group with two close friends and obtained a loan. They are happy because they feel that the institution trusts them, and they set out to stay on top of the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital, investment to satisfy customer demand

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.en:
Ngọc Thái (62981270) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen.  She is married and has 2 infant children.  To making a living, Ngọc works in a family member's business venture in the services sector.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members.  Ngọc has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities.

In 1998, Ngọc joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ngọc has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Ngọc is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided.  This loan will be the 10th she has taken out from TYM Fund.  Ngọc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials used in repair business

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Фахриддин Рачабов по национальности киргиз, родился в 1965 году,получил среднее образование. Женат на Мастуре Раджабовой, имеет 8-х детей. Вместе с семьей проживает в  Шахристанском районе 
 Дома имеет 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, откормом которых он занимается уже 15 лет.
 Фахриддин нуждается в  займе 1600 сомони, сроком на 6 месяцев, для откорма скота с последующей его продажей.
 Дополнительный семейный доход он получает от сельского хозяйства и переработки молока.
texts.en:
Fahriddin R. is an ethnic Kyrgyz, who was born in 1965 and graduated from high school. He is married to Mastura Rajabova and has eight children. He and his family live together in the Shahristan region. At home Fahriddin has seven head of large-horned cattle, and he has been raising cattle for 15 years. Fahriddin needs a six-month loan of 1600 somoni for cattle feed, after which he will sell them. He earns additional family income from farming and selling dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 3 años en casa de sus suegros. Debido a la demanda por el uso del Internet, hace 2 años decidió implementar un negocio de servicio de cabinas públicas para el uso de Internet, para ello acondicionó un espacio que le cedieron sus suegros en su casa. Soledad atiende todos los días para poder generar los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, alquilando sus computadoras por horas. Su negocio hasta el momento ha dado buenos frutos, por ser la única con este servicio en su localidad, eso la ánima a progresar y mejorar sus maquinas para ofrecer un mejor y más rápido servicio. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y su primera experiencia en un banco comunal, sin embargo Soledad tiene muchos deseos de emprender un trabajo solidario con todos sus compañeros. El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar memorias para sus computadoras y repotenciar la capacidad de almacenaje de información que poseen.
texts.en:
Soledad is 32 years old and lives with her husband and small 3-year old daughter in her in-laws’ house. Because of the demand for Internet access, she decided 2 years ago to start a business providing public Internet booths. For this, she outfitted some space that her in-laws provided inside their home. Soledad tends to her business each and every day in order to generate the necessary income for the household, renting her computers out on an hourly basis. Her business has been fruitful so far, as it is the only such service in her area. This motivates her to continue to progress and upgrade her machines so she can offer a better and faster service. This is her first loan with MFP, and her first experience in a cooperative bank. Regardless, Soledad has a great desire to work in a team environment with all of her colleagues. The funds she is requesting are for buying memory for her computers, to expand the amount of information they can store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the memory on her computers.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1044071616), a 25 year-woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc, is married and has one school-aged child.  To making a living, for the past two years H. has raised pigs for sale, earning approximately 2000000 VND a month. 

In 2005, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Having fully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be her fifth from TYM Fund, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja David y sus 3 hijos; Joseline, Alison y Cielo en su casa propia. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy carismática y cordial, he ahí el secreto de su negocio, ella se dedica a vender carteras, chalinas, gorritos y otros accesorios en el mercado del distrito de Puente Piedra en la ciudad de Lima. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las cosas que les quedan bien, distrayéndose mucho a lo largo del día. Además ya tiene 4 años de experiencia en esta labor, lo cual hace que se le facilite el trabajo, pero no por esto podemos decir que sea fácil, puesto que debe dedicarle prácticamente todo el día. Karina atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche los días Lunes, Miércoles y Viernes, ya que los días Martes y Jueves lo hace en uno de los mercados más cercanos a su casa. Para el futuro le gustaría tener su propia tienda de ropa exclusivamente para niños, ya que los niños le gustan mucho; además piensa que este mercado es mucho más rentable porque hay más variedad de colores y diseños y no tendría competencia, puesto que no hay tiendas por su zona dedicadas a este rubro. Este es su primer préstamo individual con Microfinanzas PRISMA, teniendo anteriores experiencias en bancos comunales, pero por falta de tiempo para asistir a las reuniones de grupo, optó por esta modalidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más novedosas carteras para aumentar sus ventas y acercar a la realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Karina is 32 years old lives with her spouse, David, and their three children: Joseline, Alison, and Cielo, in their own home. She has always characterized herself as being a very charismatic and cordial woman, which is the secret to her business. She is dedicated to selling wallets, purses, caps, and other accessories in the market of the district of Puente Piedra in the city of Lima.

Her job gives her lots of pleasure, because she can make recommendations to her clients about what goes well with them, and it keeps her busy through the long day. Although she has four years experience in this work, which makes her able to do her job, we cannot say that it is easy, because she dedicates practically her whole day to it. Karina works from eight in the morning until nine at night on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, since on Tuesdays and Thursdays she does her job at a market closer to her home.

In the future she would like to have her own clothing store exclusively for kids, because she loves kids a lot. Furthermore, she thinks that this market will be more profitable, because there is more variety in colors and designs and she wouldn't have competition because there are no stores in her area dedicated to this market. This is her first individual loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, having previous experience in community banks, but due to lack of time to attend group meetings, she has opted for this choice. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more novel wallets and purses to increase her sales and come closer to realizing her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 70 years old; she is married and the mother of ten children. Currently all her children are on their own doing their individual work. She is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She gets her stock of cow meat from the surrounding villages and supplies it to her customers. She started her business ten years ago to help her dear husband who is not actively working.

Martha depends on her limited capital to buy a little meat; she is worried because she is not able to pick up enough to sell. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory. And she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of smoked meat.

loans.name: Nancy Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Nancy tiene 52 años, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos mayores, ya con sus propias familias. Tiene 12 nietos: 10 niños y 2 niñas. Ella tiene varios negocios pequeños: trabaja como costurera, vende queso, y compra y vende ropa y artículos para el hogar (baldes, tinas, sábanas, etc.). Trabaja en Jipijapa y también en Guayaquil; es costurera para una fábrica de plásticos industriales en Guayaquil, y confecciona ropa para muñecas. Tiene la facilidad de hacer el trabajo de dónde quiera, entonces por lo general trabaja desde su casa en Jipijapa, donde tiene varias máquinas de coser y viaja a Guayaquil para entregar los trabajos. Ya lleva 18 años trabajando en eso, y dice que le encanta la costura. También hace trabajos para particulares, más que nada ternos y vestidos para mujeres. Las ventas de queso hace de la siguiente forma: compra unos 50-70 libras de queso a la vez a $1.30 la libra, después lo divide en paquetes de 1 libra y lo revende a $1.80. 

Está pidiendo un crédito  para comprar más mercadería, sobre todo artículos para el hogar, como sábanas por docenas. Vende su mercadería a crédito. Su meta para el futuro es comprarse un terreno en Guayaquil y hacerse una casita para poder quedarse allá. 

La señora es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes, el cual se reúne cada 2 semanas en Jipijapa, Manabí, cerca de la costa ecuatoriana. Es un grupo grande que ya tiene bastante tiempo trabajando con la fundación, las socias se llevan muy bien entre ellas. Sra. Nancy lleva 3 ciclos con el banco comunal; había sido socia antiguamente, y decidió reingresar porque le habían robado una máquina de coser y quiso comprarse otra. Le gustó haber vuelto al banco comunal, y piensa quedarse como socia por un buen tiempo. Nunca ha tenido problemas serios para pagar sus deudas; a veces se ha atrasado un poco pero siempre paga el 100% de su préstamo al fin del ciclo.
texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old, she is married, and has 5 adult children who have their own families. She has 12 grandchildren: 10 boys and 2 girls. She has several small businesses: she works as a seamstress, sells cheese, and buys and sells clothing and household items (buckets, washtubs, sheets, etc.). She works in Jipijapa and also in Guayaquil; she works as a seamstress for a plastics factory in Guayaquil and makes clothes for dolls. She can do the work wherever she likes, so she generally works from her house in Jipijapa, where she has several sewing machines. She travels to Guayaquil to deliver her work. She has been doing this for 18 years and she says she loves to sew. She also does work by request, mostly suits and dresses for women. She sells cheese in the following way: she buys around 50 to 70 pounds of cheese at once, at $1.30 per pound, and then divides it into one-pound packages which she re-sells at $1.80. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, especially household items such as sheets by the dozen. She sells her merchandise on credit. Her goal for the future is buy a piece of land in Guayaquil and build a house so she can live there. Nancy is a member of the “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons) communal bank, which meets every 2 weeks in Jipijapa, Manabí, near the Ecuadorian coast. It is a big group because it has been working with the foundation for a long time. The members get along together very well. Nancy has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles; she had been a member previously, and she decided to participate again because someone stole one of her sewing machines and she wanted to buy another one. She is glad she came back to the communal bank and she plans to remain a member for a long time. She has never had serious problems in repaying her debts; a few times she has gotten a little behind, but she always pays 100% of her loan by the end of the loan cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of more merchandise, especially household items, such as sheets by the dozen.

loans.name: Mwinda Plus Group

texts.fr:
Mbeli I. 60 ans, est dirigeante d’un groupe dénommé « Mwinda Plus » qui veut dire « Light » en anglais, qui est composé de 27 membres micro-entrepreneurs tous unis solidairement pour recevoir des prêts de Kiva dans le but de développer leurs activités.
Mbeli est vendeuse des boissons et des courges devant sa maison dans la partie du sud-ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2004 avec un capital initial de $60. Elle est depuis 2008, cliente fidèle de l’Institution de Micro-Finance HOPE RDC (IMF HOPE RDC) et a déjà reçu 6 fois les crédits qu’elle a remboursés correctement. Elle compte avec le prochain prêt renforcer le stock en achetant des boissons et courges pour répondre à la demande de ses clients et ainsi accroitre le revenu. Son rêve est d’ouvrir un dépôt des boissons. Son affaire lui génère en ce jour un bénéfice de $15 par semaine. Mbeli est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 18 et 38 ans. Un seul des enfants est scolarisé. Elle est déterminée à développer son activité à travers ces prêts.
texts.en:
60 year old Mbeli I. is the director of a group called "Mwinda Plus", which means "Light" in English. The group is comprised of 27 members; micro-entrepreneurs are all united to receive loans from Kiva together, with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mbeli sells drinks and squash (the vegetable) in front of her house in the southwest part of the city of Kinshasa. She started her business in 2004 with an initial capital investment of $60. Since 2008 she has been a faithful client of The Micro-Finance Institution HOPE RDC (IMF HOPE RDC) and so far she has received 6 loans, all of which she has properly repaid.

She is counting on the next loan in order to strengthen her stock and to purchase drinks and squash, in order to respond to the demands of her clientele and therefore grow her revenues. Her dream is to open a beverage warehouse. Today her business generates profits of $15 each week.

Mbeli is married and the mother of 7 children whose ages range from 18 to 38 years old. One of the children attends school. She is determined to develop her business through this loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and squash to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca S. is a 62-year-old widow and a mother of two children, ages 19 and 21. Ever since she joined ASHI eleven years ago, she has been selling rice and dried fish. Francisca also has another venture: selling balut, a boiled egg with a three-day-old chick inside. Balut sells every night, as it’s a huge Filipino favorite. Francisca profits nicely in her balut business, a great help in augmenting her rice and dried fish income.

Before her children entered college, Francisca sustained her enterprises through loans available through ASHI with all profits going to her children’s support. Now, however, with the greater expenses of college, Francisca must work harder to increase her profits, especially since she is widowed and with no other source of income. She has determined that once her children have finished their studies, she will save her income for both family emergencies and her businesses.

For now, she is requesting from ASHI a loan for additional business capital so she can buy larger volumes of rice and dried fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice and dried fish to sell and to sustain her balut venture

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es: “Kantutas”, es el nombre de la asociación comunal que reúne a un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras, la mayoría con responsabilidades familiares, esta situación las ha obligado a buscar una fuente de ingreso para cubrir  los gastos de sus hogares, como ser la alimentación, estudios y necesidades de los hijos. Actualmente este grupo tiene actividades distintas, por ejemplo Feliza se dedica a la venta de papa y chuño, Alicia confecciona calzados, Lidia vende cosméticos, Celia vende carne de res, Elsa vende leche, Productos que comercian en distintas ferias de su zona, o en las principales feria del Alto. Ellas precisan capital para comprar de mercadería, con esta adquisición  generaran  los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la difícil situación económica por la que afirman, están atravesando.
texts.en:
“Kantutas” is the name of the community association that brings together a group of women entrepreneurs, most of whom have family responsibilities. Their situations have forced them to seek sources of income to cover their living expenses such as food, education, and other needs for their children.

The group is currently involved in distinct activities. For example, Feliza sells potatoes (fresh & freeze-dried), Alicia sells shoes, Lidia sells cosmetics, Celia sells beef, and Elsa sells milk. They sell their products at various fairs throughout the area or at the main fair in El Alto. They need capital to buy more merchandise, and with this acquisition, will be able to generate sufficient income to cope with the difficult economic situations they are experiencing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
“In every sacrifice there’s a price,” says Imelda, a businesswoman who resides in La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She has three school-aged children and her husband works as a farmer in their village. The couple hopes that, through their determination to succeed, they will be able to provide a better life for their family.      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Imelda has run a village store in their house since 1990. She uses some of her income to buy more groceries for her store. She just hopes to have more capital to further expand her business so it will become more profitable. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more items to fill in her store. She hopes to have the chance to be more productive for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda V. R. is from the village of Green Hills Suarez, Iligan City. She is 59 years old. Florinda is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Florinda owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of products such as pillowcases, blankets, rice and more in the local community. Florinda has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: So

texts.en: So Y., 42 years old, is a widow and mother of five children. Four of the children are married and live away from the family home, while otherchild, a single daughter, helps the family by working in the garment factory. So Y. is currently working on the farm and is planting a rice crop. Recently, her house has required frequent repairs and this has had an effect on her living situation. Therefore, So Y. needs to borrow a loan to purchase materials to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her house

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en: Buenafe A. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran. She is 57 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Buenafe owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-two years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Buenafe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Buenafe is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Mong

texts.en: Mrs. T. is a vegetable farmer living in the rural area of Siem Reap province. T. is a young mother blessed with two kids, who are already enrolled in primary school. T. is looking for a loan to buy a vehicle (motorbike) for her husband to ride to his work at the construction site.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle (motorbike)

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario S. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old, is widowed, and has seven adult children. Rosario owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling eggs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is fifty-one years old. She is married and has five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Comfort works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Comfort runs a grocery store by the roadside in their community. She buys her goods from Accra and nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Rayos Del Sol Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “RAYOS DEL SOL” está ubicado en un lugar denominado la  Pampa, todas las socias  son del Barrio, es un grupo muy organizado, ya van por el 2º ciclo son personas dedicadas a trabajar, Katherina es la Presidenta, Bárbara es la Secretaria, y Laura es la Tesorera. Todas las socias del Banco Comunal tienen negocio, como ser: Venta D. regalos, Venta D. ropa interior, Venta D. bordados en vestidos. En detalle podemos mencionar lo siguiente: Katherina	como indicamos anteriormente es la presidenta y ella tiene un bazar surtido donD. ofrece una variedad D. regalos para distintas edades y eventos esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 3 años atrás, Yoisy se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 2 años, Maria cristina venD. ropa desD. hace 3 años, Angelica se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 1 año, Jessica venD. desayunos en un puesto en el mercado desD. hace 2 años atrás, Cinthia se dedica a la venta D. ropa desD. hace 7 años atrás, Barbara se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 1 año, Claudia maria se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 5 años, Leopoldo es taxista y se desempeña como chofer desD. hace 8 años atrás, Laura Alejandra tiene un puesto donD. venD. ropa interior desD. hace 1 año, Silvana venD. ropa nueva que trae D. otra ciudad desD. hace 2 años y por último nuestra socia Cintia que se dedica al negocio D. las comidas desD. hace 1 año. Las socias indican D. que si tienen mucha competencia. Para algunas no les perjudica en nada pese a eso ellas siguen trabajando esto debido a que su antigüedad les permite tener experiencia en sus respectivos negocios y también ayuda porque la mayoría cuenta con clientela fija. El crédito por lo general lo utilizan para hacer crecer su negocio, aumentar su capital. En su mayoría trabajan con otras Instituciones microfinancieras y nuestra Instrucción pero ellas muestran un antecedente crediticio bueno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rayos del Sol” (Rays of Sun) is located in a place called La Pampa. All of the members are from this neighborhood. They are an organized group of working people who are starting their second loan cycle. Katherina is the President, Bárbara is the Secretary, and Laura is the Treasurer. All of the members have retail businesses selling products such as gifts, undergarments, and embroidered dresses. The specific details are as follows:

As stated before, Katherina is the President. She manages a bazaar where she offers a variety of gifts for different ages and occasions. Her business has been in existence for three years.

Yoisy has been selling food for two years.

Maria Cristina has been selling clothing for three years.

Angelica has been selling food for one year.

Jessica has been selling breakfasts from a stall at the market for over two years.

Cinthia has been selling clothing for seven years.

Barbara has been selling food for one year.

Claudia Maria has been selling food for five years.

Leopold is a taxi driver and has been offering transportation services for eight years.

Laura Alejandra has a vending location where she has been selling undergarments for one year.

Silvana sells new clothing that she brings in from another city. She has been doing this for two years.

Finally, Cynthia has been in the food business for one year.

The members have indicated that they face stiff competition. For some, the competition does not bother them because they continue to work as a result of their experience. Many of them already have an established customer base. This loan will be used to grow their businesses by increasing their operating capital. Most of the members have worked with other microfinance institutions and developed good credit histories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a wife and mother of four children in Beit Sahour\ Beth Lehem district and runs, together with her husband, a Shawerma (sandwich-like wrap of shaved grilled lamb and chicken) food stall. Three of her sons are married while her daughter is still living with her parents. 

One of the three sons, his wife and two children live with Nadia and her husband; this son is employed and helps his family financially.

Nadia is taking a US$ 3000 loan from FATEN to buy a new Shawerma-making device they need to improve their food stall. They dream of increasing its size and improving it.

Nadia, who appears in the picture above, is one of our long-term committed borrowers.

loans.use: Purchasing a Shawerma-making device

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann C. is a quiet type of person. She is a 39-year-old mother and has three children whose ages range from five to 11 years old. With the support of her husband, she joined ASHI and has requested for a loan to start up her own business. Since their town is far and is less accessible to transportation, public market and other services, Mary Ann plans to retail gasoline in their own small house. 

Potential costumers of her business are the tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar/Filipino version of rickshaw) and motorcycle drivers.  The proceeds of this business will be her source to ease the struggle of her husband in providing them money for their needs everyday especially of their children. Mary Ann really hopes that someday her business would grow wherein she can afford the franchise of a gasoline station for a stable economy and to be able to graduate her children from college.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline for retail.

loans.name: Lucrecia Eduviges

texts.es:
La Señora Lucrecia Eduviges C. C., es comerciante desde hace 19 años tiene su negocio en su casa es repartidora de electrodomésticos para el hogar su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 5,000.00 que fueron aporte de su esposo   tiene dos hijos pero ninguno a su cargo su hija le ayuda a colocar productos con los compañeros de trabajo de ella.
El crédito lo solicito para comprar unas licuadoras que le habían encargado y así ella aprovechar comprar el producto al contado para aprovechar descuentos.
La señora Lucrecia C. tiene 6 años de trabajar con ceprodel en los cuales los créditos los ha invertido para comprar mercaderia y colocarlos en sus clientes les ha sacado ganancia y de estas a podido ir mejorando su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Lucrecia has been in business for 19 years. She runs a home appliance business out of her home. She started her business with C$5,000 which she got from her husband. She has two children but neither of them require her support. Her daughter, along with her co-workers, helps her put up products. She used the money from this loan to buy some blenders that were requested of her. In this way she can take advantage of being able to pay for her products in cash and get them at a discount. Lucrecia has been working with CEPRODEL for six years and she has used the money to invest in merchandise that she has resold to her customers for a profit. This has allowed her to better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small appliances for resale

loans.name: Blanca Marisol

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Marisol O. Y., quien reside en Sector la Cuchilla, Aldea Nahualate Uno, San 	Antonio, Suchitepéquez, quien es de estado civil soltera, que tiene una familia que se integra de dos hijos, esta persona es una de las que han podido superar a través de los créditos otorgados por diferentes Asociaciones, ya que anteriormente vivía en condiciones económicas muy bajas debido a que   el negocio con el que contaba  era la venta de productos de belleza y no le generaba los ingresos necesarios que necesitaba para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, ya que su inversión en estos productos de belleza era muy poco debido a que no contaba con suficiente capital para hacer una inversión más grande que le pudiera generar un mayor ingreso. Por lo que a través del crédito a  otorgar por la Asociación ASDIR podrá comprar más productos y así variar su mercadería. Esto ha llamara la atención del cliente, s ya que sus ventas  mejoraran, gracias al apoyo a brindar de parte de la Asociación mejorará sus ingreso y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca Marisol O. Y. lives in the Cuchilla sector, Nahualate Uno village, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. She is single and has two children. She is a person who has managed to succeed thanks to loans from various asociations because she used to live in very low economic conditions because her cosmetics sales were insufficient to cover all household expenses. This was due to the fact that her investment in stock was small so her income was equally small. Through financing from Asociación ASDIR she will be able to buy more product thus varying her stock. This will attract more customers and her sales will improve. Thanks to support from the Association, her income and living conditions will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad,  nuestra socia trabaja en la municipalidad de limpieza y vende comida, la socia también vende ropa de manera ambulatoria ella trae de Lima y de Juliaca y vende casa por casa a sus amigas y conocidos, la socia da en dos partes la facilidad de pago, ella también lava ropa los fines de semana va a las casa que solicita su servicio y lava la ropa, Nuestra socia es una mujer independiente y sumamente trabajadora, Ella solicita el préstamo para viajar a traer más ropa de temporada otoño e invierno.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Cirila belongs to the “Las Amistosas” communal bank. She is a native of the Urcos district in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. This is about one hour from the city of Cusco. Cirila is 29 years old, lives with a partner, and has two children, 4 and 2 years of age. She works as a cleaning person for the city, and also sells food. She also travels to Lima and Juliacea to buy clothing that she sells door-to-door to her friends and acquaintances. She also offers laundry service in people’s homes on weekends. She is an independent and very hardworking woman. Cirila will use this loan to travel to purchase more clothing to sell for the fall and winter seasons. She appreciates and values this loan and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer L., 33 years old, is a mother of 14 children. She is a farmer and is tilling a small rice field. The income she makes on the farm really helps her family buy food, clothing and other basic needs. She started her business in 2009. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer. She joined CEVI in 2009 and she is staying in the program because she likes its services.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Mariquita

texts.en:
Mariquita J. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, Mariquita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. She earns her income by planting rice and selling her harvest at the market. She is thankful for her business because she said it provides for her family's needs and also sustains her children's education.

Mariquita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariquita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mariquita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Mariquita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Raem

texts.en: Mrs. Raem P., who is living in Chres village in Prey Veng Province, was born 37 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Rat Roeurng  (shown in the photo with her) are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land upon which they grow cane to sell to support their family. Although this couple tries to work hard they earn only a small income to support the family, so  Raem is requesting a loan to buy a plow to start a new business. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the other is a student in local public school.

loans.use: To buy a plow to start a new business

loans.name: Wazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Wazeeran lives in Borewala, a city of shrines in Pakistan, with her family of six members. Her husband has a business selling paint while one son is a bus conductor and another does embroidery and has a shop in the market. Wazeeran is a housewife and takes care of her two little daughters who are getting their education. 

Earlier she helped her son in establishing his embroidery business by receiving a loan from Asasah; this time she wants to help her husband who will buy paint for his business and meet the orders of his customers. 

Wazeeran is hopeful that her husband’s business will be in a better position after making this investment and she will be able to help her daughters in finishing their education.

loans.use: Purchase paint tins for resale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio A. Jr. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 36 years old and single. To make a living, Antonio owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from peddling native delicacies or snacks in the local community. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Antonio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Antonio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: San Crispin Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “SAN CRISPIN” (el santo de los zapateros), esta solicitando  crédito por primera vez, es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch.

Compuesta por nueve personas, un varón y ocho socias mujeres, se particulariza por que las y el socio, tienen negocios relacionados a la elaboración y venta de calzados.  Más del 50% producen zapatos para “cholita”, zapatos de suela que son ajustados en la planta con estaquillas (clavos de madera) y el resto produce zapatos normales.

La señora Sonía Q., presidenta de la asociación, tiene un negocio de zapatería.  Hace siete años que aprendió de este negocio a través de la cuñada.  Este primer crédito de Bs. 2000.-  le da la oportunidad de comprar material para elaborar zapatos. Actualmente comparte con el esposo este trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank St. Crispin (patron saint of shoemakers), part of the regional hub of Germain Busch, is requesting a loan for the first time. With nine members, one male and eight female, its particularity is that all of them own business related to shoe-making and shoe-selling. Over 50% of the members make"cholita" shoes, which are soled and built using wooden studs, and the rest produce ordinary shoes. Sonia Q., president of the association, owns a shoe-making business. Seven years ago he learned the ropes of the business through her sister-in-law. This first loan of Bs 2000 will give her the opportunity to buy materials to make shoes. She currently shares the work with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic grains, cooking oil, toilet paper, Asistin (a brand of floor cleaning liquid), Natura's brand tomato sauce, coffee, sardines.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora Ana María T. es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su la belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, los jóvenes salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejores oportunidades de trabajo y muchos han migrado a diferentes partes del mundo para mejorar la economía de su hogar.
 
Doña Ana María tiene de 62 años, es viuda hace 10 años y  tiene 10 hijos todos mayores de edad,  8 de ellos son casados y viven  independientemente, sus dos hijos solteros viven en su casa, ellos trabajan y estudian por la noche; Gracias a su trabajo tiene  casa propia.

La Señora. Ana María se dedica a la cría de animales, actividad que la realiza hace varios años, cría chanchos y vacas, la leche que obtiene de ellas la vende en su comunidad, también tiene una pequeña tienda en la que labora de 9 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 12 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de más chanchos y  víveres para su tienda. Su meta es crecer en su negocio de animales.
texts.en:
Ana Maria T. is a member of the communal bank "Los Talvos." She lives in the community of San Miguel in the del Valle parish. This parish is known for its natural beauty, and its people work in agriculture and livestock production. The youths leave the city to look for better work opportunities; many have migrated to different parts of the world to improve the economic situation of their families. Ana Maria, 62, has been a widow for 10 years. She has 10 grown children, 8 of whom are married and live independently. Her two single children live in her house; they work and study at night. Thanks to her job she has her own house. Ana Maria raises animals, an activity that she has been doing for a number of years. She raises pigs and cows, and she sells the milk that she gets from them in her community. In addition, she has a small store where she works from 9am until 6pm. Ana Maria has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years; she will use her new loan to buy more pigs and to buy groceries for her store. Her goal is to make her business selling animals grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and also groceries for her store

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: Mauwa M. est  présidente  groupe Zamiri, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants, son mari est  gardien. Son fils ainé a 17 ans et le cadet a 3 ans et tous étudient, sauf le cadet.  Il y a 17 ans qu’elle exerce le petit commerce général. Elle a commence avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari environ 100$. Elle vend de sucre, Omo, riz, etc.  Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché central de Virunga. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter  son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  10 sacs de Riz, 5 sacs d’Omo, etc. Le grand obstacle est  qu’elle vend en monnaie nationale (franc congolais). Cependant cette monnaie congolaise n’est pas stable, elle subit de plus à plus l’inflation, ce qui entraine de perte de change avec la devise (les dollars), comme tous les congolais craignent le franc congolais, pour garder leurs économies en dollars. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants et y construire. La cliente Mauwa M. remercie  Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres citoyens exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Zamiri est composé de 15 membres.
texts.en:
Mauwa M. is the president of the Zamiri Group. She is 38 years old, has eight children, and her husband is a security guard. Her eldest son is 17 years old, the youngest is three, and all but the youngest are in school. She has been running her business for 17 years. She began with about $100 that she received from her husband. She sells sugar, Omo soap, rice, etc. She displays her merchandise in the central market of Virunga. This loan will allow her to increase her turnover by purchasing ten bags of rice, five bags of Omo soap, etc. The biggest challenge is that she sells in the national currency (Congolese francs). Because this Congolese currency is not stable, she is subjected to more and more inflation, which leads to a loss in exchange with foreign currency (dollars). She is like many Congolese who fear the Congolese franc and instead keep their savings in dollars. She would like to buy a small plot of land on which to build for her children. As a client, Mauwa M. thanks Hekima for its actions to help the poor citizens who are excluded from traditional banks. One should note that the Zamiri Group has 15 members.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz A. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 49 years old. Beatriz is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Beatriz raises pigs for breeding. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Beatriz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Melsie

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Melsie. She is married, and has 1 child, aged 15. In 2008, Melsie established her provisions, drinks and food business.  She began her business in an effort to become independent. Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, Melsie earns about SLL 1,356,800 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000.  

Melsie has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional oil, tomatoes, sweet milk and sugar.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 271,360. In the future, Melsie plans to build a house and educate her child up to university level. Melsie also hopes to eventually become a supplier of provisional goods.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy provisions.

loans.name: Fidelite Group

texts.fr: Kabene K. est  présidente du groupe Fidelite, âgée de 32 ans, veuve, mère de 5  enfants.  Son mari est  décédé depuis 2006. Tous ses enfants étudient. Elle  commença son business  avec son fond propre. Elle vend des poissons frais Tompson du fleuve et de l’océan.  Son adresse d’affaire est imprécise, elle fait le porte à porte pour intéresser les clients (activité ambulante).  Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ vers les années 2007. Avant cette activité de vente poissons, elle vendait des souliers usagers. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner de 3 cartons de poissons Tompson  vers Kinsasa. La cliente Kabene K.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Fidélité est  composé de 14 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en: Kabene K. is the leader of the Fidelity group. She is 32 years old, a widow, and the mother of five. Her husband passed away in 2006. All her children are in school. She launched her business with her own funds. She sells fresh Thompson’s’ surgeonfish and freshwater and ocean fish. She had a loan of $50,- from IMF Hekima around 2007. Before going into fish sales, she used to sell used shoes. This new loan will allow her to purchase three boxes of Thompson’s surgeonfish in Kinshasa. As a Hekima client, Kabene K. is appreciative of its activities to support the poor who don’t have access to traditional banking. It needs to be mentioned that the Fidelity group has 14 members, mostly women.

loans.use: Three boxes of Thompson's surgeonfish

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y no tiene hijos, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Ella viene trabajando con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 meses, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para  incrementar el capital de su negocio venta de quesos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando productos para la elaboración de quesos.

Su sueño es tener una pollería. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the Communal Bank “Azangarinas Valientes”, which is located in the District and Province of Azángaro, Department of Puno. She is 21 years old and in a common law marriage, but does not have children. Roxana completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for four months. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and used to increase her business capital for selling cheese.

Sra. Roxana is requesting a new loan in the amount of 800 PEN to invest in products used for making cheese. Her dream is to open a poultry shop. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making cheese

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James G. is from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old and is married. James owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, James joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for his business. He is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; La socia es conviviente y tiene  2 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, la socia prepara diferentes platos de comidas y las vende en forma ambulatoria, ella elabora sus platos típicos caseros y los lleva envolviendo el recipiente que en este caso es una olla con varias telas de yute grueso para mantener el calor y sobre una silla vende en sus platos descartables y le renta muy bien algunos fines de semana, la socia elabora sus platos muy temprano por la mañana y junto a sus menores hijos los lleva a vender; La socia desea a futuro poner un restaurante y tener a alguien que le apoye con la cocina y la atención de las mezas y poder ahorrarse todo el trajín de llevar las ollas en sus espalda y sus sillas de plástico, los utensilios a vender todos los días. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para elaborar sus comiditas caseras y continuar de este modo incrementando sus ganancias.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Sr. De Tayancan".  The community bank is located in the Ocongate district of the Quispicanchis province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Isabel, she lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She makes a living selling food.  She prepares various food dishes and sells them as a street vendor.  She makes her homemade, typical dishes and takes them, covering the pot with various cloths of thick burlap to maintain them hot, and sells them from a chair in disposable containers. Some weekends she does very well.  She makes her dishes very early in the morning and takes them to sell with the help of her children.  In the future she would like to open a restaurant and have help with the cooking and waiting on tables, and save herself the wear on her back of carrying her pots, plastic chairs and utensils every day.  The member is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for the making of her homemade meals and in this way to be able to continue to increasing her income.

The member is thankful and appreciates the loan granted through this process and promises to comply with the payments in accordance with the agreed upon schedule.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old, married and has four children.  Currently, all four of her children go to school.  Josephine sells soft drinks like sodas and tea, which she has been doing for 10 years and her husband is a TV technician.  

Josephine will use the loan to increase the capacity of her business.  With the new profits from her growing business, Josephine plans to reinvest in her soft drink sales to continue to grow her revenue.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en: Erdenebileg B. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter attends university while the two youngest ones attend a local high school. His wife operates a clothing retail business while Erdenebileg drives a taxi in the local community. At first, he began his own business in 1998 by operating a clothes trading business. After many years of operation, he was able to start operating a taxi service to supplement his earnings. His wife is now responsible for the clothes retail business. For the future, he plans to expand his business and buy one more shipping container so they can sell a variety of clothing items. Erdenebileg is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more winter clothes and to start providing a car repair service.

loans.use: to purchase more winter clothes and to start providing a car repair service

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. Magdalena tiene como actividad la de peinadora, tiene su salón de belleza donde realiza todo tipo de cortes de cabello y tratamientos de belleza, de esta manera ya trabaja 12 años continuos manteniendo su hogar con esta actividad, la Sra. es una persona muy trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, su hogar esta conformado por ella y sus dos hijos, esta oportunidad solicita crédito para la compra de insumos de peluquería por mayor ( tintes, líquidos Champo, cremas, etc.) y para pagar la matriculación y pensiones del primer semestre de la universidad de su hijo mayor, ya que pronto empezara sus clases, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Magdalena is a stylist and she has a beauty salon where she does all types of haircuts and beauty treatments.  She has been doing this for 12 years and it has supported her household.  She is a very hard-working and good-natured person.  Her household is made up of her and her two children.  She is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale hairdressing supplies (dyes, shampoo, cream, etc) and also, to pay the registration and room and board fees for her son's first semester at the university as he will be starting his classes soon.  She is a very hard-working, responsible person and she is grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale products for her beauty salon and also, to pay her son's university fees

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich S. has been in the farming business for many years. She learned this skill from her grandparents back when she was single. Pich S. has two children; one is single and the other one is married. The two of them work at jobs and have a proper salary per month.

 Pich S. always cultivates rice crops, both in the rainy season and the dry season, and she has had great success growing her crops. Her husband currently is a bed seller in  Kompong Tom province, and the daily income which he can earn from his business is about $3.50 per day. In order to improve the business, Pich S.’s husband wants to buy more wood to make beds to sell. This is the reason why Pich S. is seeking a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make beds to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 47-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children in Nablus. Mahmoud owns his own vegetable and fruit shop. He is now hoping that through this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To increase the size of his store

loans.name: Odinakhon's Group

texts.en:
Odinakhon M., 20, is a leader of this group. Despite her young age, she managed to run the business for several years now. She found out about the loan from Kiva and was happy to tell her fellows about it. Odinakhon is single and lives with her parents, brother and a sister-in-law. Her mother is actively involved in agriculture, her father is a construction worker and her sister-in-law is a kindergarten teacher. Odinakhon says she inherited a strong and persistent personality from her mother. At the age of 17 she already knew best techniques for cultivating land and ways to get a rich harvest. At this moment Odinakhon is preparing the small piece of land that her family owns for sowing. She really hopes on good weather this year, because last year’s long winters and late spring destroyed most of her cultivation. The outcomes led to a poor harvest in fall, which raised only small amount of funds. She’s learned her lesson, and this year she will try to be more careful and follow the weather predictions. The history of the land goes far back to a period of fall of the Soviet Union back in 1991. During privatization, the family was given this land, which has become a major source of income for the entire family. This year she plans to sow seeds of cotton. Therefore she gathered her fellows and applied for this loan. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of cotton

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced. She lives in Melitopol with two daughters and a son. Irina sells footwear, slippers, and bags in the central marketplace of her home town. She has been in the market for 12 years. She has already invested about 20,000 Grivnyas in her turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Irina is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for her vending kiosk and boost her sales, thus generating additional income this spring season. Eventually, Irina would like to use some of her profits to meet a few specific needs for her family. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Irina as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Irlanda Del Pilar

texts.es:
Irlanda de 22 años, es una joven emprendedora  que puso un pequeño negocio para sus estudios y apoyar a su familia en lo económico.

En la actualidad tiene su negocio pero la ayuda su familia en las mañana y por las tarde ella lo atiende. Con  el préstamo ella v a comprar más mercadería para su tienda para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere terminar la universidad y de esa manera abrir otro negocio en otro sector del país.
texts.en:
Irlanda, 22, is a young entrepreneur who opened her small business to pay for her schooling and to help her family economically.

Currently, she has her store but her family helps her during the morning and in the afternoon she tends to it.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for the store in order to increase profits.  In the future she’d like to complete her university and open another business in a different sector of the country.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and water.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia T., from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, is 58 years old, married, and has four grown children. To make a living, Ignacia has owned and operated sari-sari store for more than five years, earning approximately 8,000 PHP a month. She and her husband also receive a monthly pension. 

In the year 2011, Ignacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase products for her retail store.she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a products for her retail store

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha S. is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokoeurn Oeorn is 29 years old. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been there since 2005 and just have one young son.

Sokha and his wife sell mangoes and jicama. They buy them under contract from their fellow villagers and transport them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sokha is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional mangoes for resale.

Photo: Mr. Sokha S. and his wife

loans.use: to purchase additional mangoes under contract for resale

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander es joven trabajador de 23 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Chiclayo, su casa está ubicada en una comunidad  urbana en vías de crecimiento.

Alexander se dedica, desde hace 2 años,  a la venta de productos textiles que realiza en un local alquilado ubicado en una calle de comerciantes de la ciudad. Alexander goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de  1500 nuevos soles con los que desea comprar una moto para poder movilizarse sin gastar tanto. Alexander desea ahorrar dinero para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. También tiene pensado utilizar su moto, como herramienta de trabajo, para llevar pedidos a domicilio y así tener un mejor servicio. 

Alexander es un joven con muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Alexander is a hard-working young man of 23 who lives in his parents' home in Chiclayo district.  Their home is located in a developing urban community.

Alexander has been selling textile products for two years.  He carries out his business in rented premises which are located in a commercial street in the city.  Alexander has good personal and work references.

Alexander is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he would like to use to buy a motorcycle so that he can get around without it costing so much.  Alexander would like to save some money so that he can help his parents with their household expenses.  He is also planning to use the motorcycle as a work tool, to provide home deliveries, thereby offering his customers a better service.

Alexander is a young man who has a great desire to improve himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
José es padre de familia de 50 años, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa e hija, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en una zona rural del distrito de la Florida que pertenece al distrito de San Miguel a unas 4 horas aproximadamente del departamento de Cajamarca.  Zonas que su principal actividad es la minería, ganadería y agricultura.
Desde hace 10 años José se dedica a la compra y venta de guyaquil (es una planta parecida al bambú, es un tallo largo y flexible que se utiliza para la construcción de casas y puentes en zonas rurales), el negocio es muy próspero por las diversas utilidades que tiene, lo pude vender a un buen precio, además cuenta con su propia clientela que le hace pedidos periódicamente y los ingresos que pueda generar sus ventas ayudará para cubrir las obligaciones familiares.
Ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de guayaquil para su posterior venta  a su clientela y poder tener mayores ganancias para poder pagar el crédito adquirido y brindarle a su familia mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
José es padre de familia de 50 años, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa e hija, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en una zona rural del distrito de la Florida que pertenece al distrito de San Miguel a unas 4 horas aproximadamente del departamento de Cajamarca.  Zonas que su principal actividad es la minería, ganadería y agricultura.
Desde hace 10 años José se dedica a la compra y venta de guyaquil (es una planta parecida al bambú, es un tallo largo y flexible que se utiliza para la construcción de casas y puentes en zonas rurales), el negocio es muy próspero por las diversas utilidades que tiene, lo pude vender a un buen precio, además cuenta con su propia clientela que le hace pedidos periódicamente y los ingresos que pueda generar sus ventas ayudará para cubrir las obligaciones familiares.
Ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de guayaquil para su posterior venta  a su clientela y poder tener mayores ganancias para poder pagar el crédito adquirido y brindarle a su familia mejores oportunidades en la vida.

loans.use: Compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima (guayaquil)

loans.name: Serchmaa

texts.en: Serchmaa is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son, age 22, and daughter, age 15, are students.
