She manages an used clothing trading business with the help of her husband in her town. She started her business in 2003 and gained much experience and knowledge. They collect orders from their customers and bring the products to their homes. Besides their trading business they conduct a transportation business in their town. Now they have many regular customers whom are happy with the services they provide. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I want my children to be educated and have a better life. Also I would like to have my own apartment or house someday." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods in order to increase her business sales.

loans.use: purchase more goods for resale in her used clothing business.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 47 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with 10 children.  Zosima works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

She has requested 7,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.  Zosima has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Zosima hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 24 years old and lives in Kakata, a town to the north of Monrovia.  She is married and her husband is a businessman.  They have 1 child, age 6, who lives at home and goes to school.  She attended school herself reaching seventh grade.

She has a small business selling plastic dishes which she has run for 3 years.  The main obstacle to her business is looking after her child when she is sick.  She started the business with money from her husband.

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more stock for the business and use the profits to help with school fees.  In the future, she hopes to buy some land and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the business

loans.name: Heu

texts.en: With the responsibility as of head of his family, Heu always thinks about the strategy to gain more money for his family. Now, 48 years old, he is living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who has lots of experience with this business. Due to talent and being clever, Heu also takes time to do another business of driving a motorbike so that he can earn suitable money to give to his wife everyday. He and his wife have given birth to two kids. This, they feel, shows prosperity in family, as richness is family. Heu wishes to borrow some funds in the amount of $1,100 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her storefront.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 50, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Obed, her business partner, and she is mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. Yolanda earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, beverages and other products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Yolanda hopes to grow her business and give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 38 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos en la primaria que dependen de la señora Aurora. Ella tiene un negocio de renta de trajes para caballeros y tiene con este negocio desde hace 7 años, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo y vende pan en las tardes, en la tienda de ropa donde rentan los trajes para caballero su suegra es la que le ayuda a atenderlo mientras ella en la mañana sale a vender sus productos por catalogo y a las 3 de la tarde va a una panadería y compra conchas y las vende en su colonia. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de trajes, camisas, corbatas, moños en diferentes colores, corbatines, chalecos de diferentes colores para eventos de quinceañeras, y también para invertir en el pan ya que es un muy buen negocio que le deja buenas ganancias. La meta que tiene Aurora es salir adelante con sus pequeños hijos y darles una buena educación, además ella quisiera poner una panadería estable en su casa.
texts.en:
Aurora, 38, is married and has three children in elementary school who depend on her.

For seven years she has had a business renting men's suits.  She also sells beauty products from a catalog and sells bread in the afternoon.  In the clothing store where they rent the men's suits, her mother-in-law helps her in the morning while Aurora goes out to do her catalog sales.  At 3 in the afternoon, Aurora goes to a bakery and buys "conchas" (sweet rolls shaped like shells) to sell in her neighborhood.

Aurora is requesting a loan to buy suits, shirts, ties, bows in different colors, bow ties, and vests in different colors for "quinceañeras" (galas for girls' 15th birthdays), and also to invest in the bread since it's a very good business that produces good earnings for her.

Aurora's goal is to get ahead with her young children and give them a good upbringing.  She also would like to put a stable bakery in her house.

loans.use: to rent suits for events.

loans.name: Souwebatou

texts.fr:
Souwebatou est une femme de 53 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 03enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le premier 25 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.  
Souwebatou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales (maïs, blé, sorgho) et d’ignames depuis 16 ans. Elle vend à toute personne au marché d’Agoé. 
Souwebatou a requis son deuxième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames et des céréales. 
Elle veut stocker des céréales.
Dans les prochaines années, Souwebatou voudrait agrandir  l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut assurer l’épanouissement de  sa famille.
texts.en:
Souwebatou is a 53-year-old woman who is married to a retailer. She has three children who are all in school; the first-born is 25 years, and the last is 15. Souwebatou has been working as a retailer of grains (corn, wheat, and sorghum) and yams for sixteen years. She sells to anyone at the Agoé market. 

Souwebatou has requested her second loan cycle with WAGES in order to buy some yams and grain. She wants to stock grains. In the next few years, she would like to expand her business. With the profits, she says she wants to ensure that her family thrives.

loans.use: to buy grains and yams

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. Her husband is a dog trainer and they have two children age 13 and 3, to whom they hope to give good educations to the university level. 

Her business is located at Imara Daima in Nairobi. She owns a clothing sales business and she has been running it for three years now. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business. She is a very hardworking, humble and down-to-earth lady.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Akylbu's Group

texts.en:
Akylbu is the leader of this group. She is 46 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Both sons work in Bishkek and the daughter studies at school. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms,  Akylbu purchased cattle and since that time she is engaged in cattle breeding. She sells milk products and in this way she earns about 2000 soms per month to meet their daily needs. With money received from the loan Akylbu wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding. In the future she wishes to build a new house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas, la socia vende ropa para varones, mujeres y niños, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, polos y blusas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” Community Bank located in the district of Cuzco, province and city of Cuzco.  Her name is Juana.  She is 53 years old, single, and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling clothing.  She sells pants, sweaters, t-shirts, and blouses.  She sells men's, women's, and children's clothing.  She sells the clothing on the streets and this business has allowed her help her children get ahead.  She wants to expand and improve her business selling clothing.  She is asking for a loan to buy clothing, such as pants, t-shirts, and blouses in bulk.  She is happy for the loan and committed to repaying it.

loans.use: buy clothing, like pants, shirts, and blouses in bulk.

loans.name: Nassif

texts.en:
Nassif is from Iraq. He is 42 years old and married with three children.

Nassif is a tailor.  He has owned a workshop since 2000 and professionally makes, repairs, and alters clothing including suits, coats and trousers for both women and men. He has more than ten years of experience in the field and a deep understanding of the needs of his local customers. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Nassif decided to apply for a loan of $2,400 in order to purchase a sewing machine and a generator. He aims to increase his profits and improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and three sons in his own house in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His eldest son works for a private company in Ulaanbaatar, while the other sons attend college and school. His wife is unemployed; however, she helps her husband with his business. He had been working as either a driver or a welder for 20 years. He has been running his welding business successfully since 2005 and wants to expand it. He is a hardworking man who wishes to educate his children. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy iron for his business.

loans.use: To buy iron

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly, 34, is a married woman who lives with her husband and 3 single children in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city. She is in the business of selling fresh fish and dry fish in Dépo market, from which she is able to earn a profit of $7.00 per day. Her husband also works in the same business but in mobile places. She is taking out this loan from Kiva's partner, HKL, to build a small room made of bricks with a metal gate. In the future, she wishes to expand and sustain her fish selling business.

loans.use: to build a small room made of bricks with a metal gate.

loans.name: Nancy Rebeca

texts.es:
Nancy Rebeca tiene 24 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 6, 5 y 3 años de edad  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Nancy  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 7 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para seguir sembrando  y comprar insumos agrícolas. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar los insumos. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.  
El sueño es tener terreno propio.

En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar la natación.
texts.en:
Nancy Rebeca is 24, married, and has three children. She lives with her husband and their children, ages six, five, and three, in the Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province. 

She is a member of the "San Juan" communal bank, located in San Francisco, which is part of the San Juan parish. She is a farmer, and has been growing corn for seven years. She does her buying and selling in Ventanas. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy agricultural supplies so that she can continue planting. The loan will be a great help to her in buying supplies.  She hasn't had any problems. Her dream is to have her own land. In her free time she likes to go swimming.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, so that she can continue planting.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres al Poder  nace mediante la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,, quienes  tiene como objetivo principal ayudara a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
La Sra. Adolfina, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, y nos cuenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y su trabajo ha logrado ir creciendo, ya que desde siempre ha trabajado. Ella desea que por medio de su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, pues se acerca la época de fiestas y quiere estar preparada para la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le está dando.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres al Poder' community bank was created by a group of neighbors and friends from the town of San Lorenzo.  Their main goal was to help their families through their joint work.

Adolfina is one of the members of this group.  Her business is selling drinks.  She tells us that, thanks to her efforts and work, she has managed to grow her business.  She would like, through her business, to continue growing in her business and helping her family.

Adolfina is requesting this loan to buy drinks.  The holiday period is approaching and she would like to be prepared to meet her customers' demands.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 32 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad. Su esposo es artesano trabaja con tagua.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días de la semana por las mañanas ya que es más fresco y en las noches ya que a esa hora encuentra a sus clientes que trabajan durante el dia y además porque a esa hora su esposo se hace cargo de cuidar a su pequeño hijo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva 7 años dedicada a esta labor.

Ella está repitiendo su crédito con la institución ya que desde que recibe los créditos su situación ha mejorado mucho tanto en lo económico como en su vida familiar ya que los causantes de los problemas familiares es muchas veces la falta de recursos económicos. Nos cuenta que su negocio ha estado bastante bien y muchos más en este mes que es cuando las personas compran muchos regalos. En cuanto a sus pagos todos los realizo al día  y ahora está por recibir un nuevo crédito para seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida personal, de salud gracias a Dios está muy bien también, ella espera seguir contando con la ayuda de la institución y de Kiva.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la fiscal de pagos del banquito y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución.
 
Sus metas son tener un carro y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its great diversity of traditional products. These include toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), which are famous both inside and outside the country. The members of the Mi Banquito communal bank in that city meet every 15 days. 

Here we meet Mrs. Gloria, 32, who is married and has a five-year-old son.  Her husband is a craftman who works with ivory palm.

She sells Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) by catalogue.  She works three days a week during the cool morning hours and in the evening when her customers are home from work.  This way her husband can take care of their son.  She sells door-to-door on an order basis, issuing credit and collecting payment weekly.  For seven years she has been in business.

She is taking out another loan through the institution because the support has helped her family economic situation.  Many times a lack of resources can cause family problems.  Her business has done well, especially this month when people are buying gifts.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  With the new loan she will be able to advance in her business and personal life.  She is thankful for her health and hopes to be able to continue depending on the institution and Kiva.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams. 

Her goal is to have a car and fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy perfume, jewellery, cosmetics and creams

loans.name: Kelly Samanta

texts.es:
Kelly , sigue vendiendo productos Yambal, le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas tanto asi que ha podido comprar a credito productos para su venta.  

Empezó a vender productos de uso personal desde que salió del colegio. Actualmente trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, shampoo a un precio muy económico. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos como perfumes, cremas para seguir obteniendo dinero para mejorar su estilo de vida y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Kelly, 21, sells Yanbal brand products (a company that offers enterprising women opportunities for independent sales).  She lives in Playas canton, one of the tourist areas of Ecuador with a diversity of seafood. 

She started to sell personal care products when she left school.  She gradually increased her customer base and set up a sales stand with glass display cases so that she could sell at a greater volume.  She works from very early in the morning, offering her products to her neighbors and friends.  She sells perfumes, creams, deodorants and shampoo at very reasonable prices.  Because of crime in the area where she has her stand, she put up bars for greater security (they appear in the photo).  

With this loan, she wants to buy products such as perfumes, creams and more glass display cases.  In the future, she wants to have her own house and study at the university.

loans.use: perfumes, cremas

loans.name: Jose Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Marcos de Colon en el barrio el Cafetal, ahi vive con su esposa quien lo apoya en su actividad, Jose es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicado en toda su plenitud a su familia y a su negocio propio que es la elabaracion y venta de ladrillos,  actividad que realiza desde hace dos años, todos los dias se levanta muy temparano para asi de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para salira adelente con su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para fabricar los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old and lives in the Cafetal neighbourhood of San Marcos de Colon. His lives with his wife, who also helps him run his business. Jose is hard-working and totally dedicated to his family and his business, which involves the production and sale of bricks. He has been running this business for 2 years; every day he rises very early in order to satisfy his customers' requirements.
He uses his much-needed income to provide for his family and give them a better quality of life.
He intends to use this loan to buy materials to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy cement, earth and straw.

loans.name: Efrain Guido

texts.es:
Efrain es un hombre de 31 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con sus padres, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Efrain no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Efrain trabaja en su pequeña librería, en la cual vende útiles de escritorio y escolares, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Efrain se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su negocio, como libros, cuaderno, loncheras y otros útiles escolares diversos, así pues Efrain seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y poco a poco dese salir adelante.
texts.en:
Efrain is a man of 31. He is single and lives in the city of Huarza with his parents. He is a very friendly person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who has a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to work since he was very young, Efrain was not able to study for a careen in law. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends, and sometimes he cooks a very delicious potato and tripe stew to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Efrain works in his little bookstore, where he sells stationery and school supplies. He works every day for approximately 12 hours, and he believes that it is going well for him because of the variety of products and the friendly treatment that he offers his customers.

Efrain is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered, he will be able to make the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise for his business, such as books, notebooks, lunchboxes, and other various school supplies. Thus Efrain will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having his own house, and little by little he wants to advance.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Audia

texts.en:
Audia is a customer of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited who has been with the institution for some time. She is married and has five children. She and her family live in Lyantonde, Uganda. 

Audia deals in cattle fattening and wants to buy more calves with this loan. In addition to selling cows, she also sells milk. Her major challenge is a lack of working capital. She would greatly appreciate having her loan funded.

loans.use: To buy calves to sell.

loans.name: Benkelema 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  29 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: l’arachide et le mais avec DJENEBA la 2ème personne de la gauche à la droite sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 180 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi resides in Savani, a remote village in the lush hills of Nandihills, in the Rift Valley of Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 11 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and crops. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is lack of funds. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that. 

Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. She plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Naomi’s life will take another turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family. You can help this smallholder farmer achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Agnès

texts.en:
Ms. Agnès A. is a young married mother of three (3) children. A hair stylist by profession, she has opened a salon which she manages efficiently and has a team of apprentices. Her husband, a bike mechanic, is not financially able to adequately cover the family’s expenses. Quite the entrepreneur, Ms. A. has now expanded her styling business to include the sale of beauty products. The additional revenue allows her to provide for the needs of her household. Her excellent level of service has resulted in a marked increase in the demand for her salon. She would like to implement a plan to improve the speed and sophistication of her work. For this purpose she needs modern and more efficient materials. For this reason, Ms. A. is asking for a loan of $850 to better equip the salon and meet her clients’ expectations.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Agnès est une jeune femme mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a ouvert un salon qu’elle gère avec efficacité et dispose des apprenties. Son mari, un mécanicien à 2 roues n’a pas une situation financière lui permettant d’assumer convenablement les charges de la famille. Très entreprenante, Madame A. joint aujourd’hui à son métier de coiffure, le commerce des produits de beauté. Ce qui lui procure des revenus complémentaires pour subvenir aux besoins de son foyer. Cette bonne prestation de services a entraîné une forte augmentation de la demande dans son salon. Elle souhaite mettre en place un dispositif pour un travail plus rapide et plus raffiné. Pour cela, il lui faut du matériel moderne et plus performant. C’est dans ce sens que Madame A. sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $850 pour pouvoir mieux équiper le salon et répondre à l’attente de ses clientes.

loans.use: Beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Rufet

texts.en: Rufet M. owns a small audio cassette and CD shop in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Rufet wants to invest in a larger inventory for his store so that he can fill up his new displays that he has recently acquired. He also wants to purchase CD players to sell in order to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase CD players to sell and to increase his inventory of music.

loans.name: Karen Suyapa

texts.es:
My name is Karen O. and I am dedicated to the sales of new clothing for women, men, and children such as t-shirts, blouses, sandals, shorts, jeans, and socks. I have had my business for 2 years. My clients are very good since I have been located near the common market. My goal is to increase my inventory and to have good earnings and with them to be able to feed my two small children since I am a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Karen O. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños como ser camisetas, blusas, zandalias, shorts, jeans, calcetines, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada cerca del mercado comunal, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y tener buenas ganancias y con ellas poder alimentar mis dos pequeñas hijas ya que soy madre soltera.

loans.use: purchase of clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs Seng C. L. is a widow, aged 42 years, and lives with her single son in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a street vendor selling different kinds of fruits and can make about $5/day in revenue. Her son is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, whose income is potential for supplementing his household. This loan will be used by C. L. to purchase a motorcycle to help in operating her son's business.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her son to operate a business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: The Kamilov family lives in Seyidlar village, in the Khachmaz region. Svetlana has 3 children who she supports. Svetlana has raised calves and cows for 5 years. This 57-year-old woman needs a loan of $725 to purchase a cow to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun P., 29, is married with two school-aged children and works on her piece of land raising pigs. She earns about $2 per day in revenue.

Her husband works for a private company as a truck driver making up to $10 a day in revenue. Mrs. Thoeun P. hopes to use this loan to increase her livestock by adding more pigs to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to expand her livestock.

loans.name: Davlatbeck

texts.en: Davlatbeck K.  lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2006 when he applied to MicroInvest for a business development loan. The loan has helped him to improve his business situation markedly. Mr.K. is engaged in the home business of the raising and selling livestock. In addition, he  bakes and sells  “lepeshky” (the national bread). It is the family business that brings the general family income. Now Mr.K. requests the loan of 1700 STJ for the purchase of mixed fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: For the purchase of mixed fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes in bulk for a small business

loans.name: Halima's Mazingia E Group

texts.en:
Halima S., aged 39, is married and has four children (ages 19, 15, 13 and 5). She has two butcheries which she started 3 years ago. She works from 7.30am to 7pm daily and has been able to make a monthly profit of about $259.

In the past Halima has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She now hopes for a new loan to buy roofing sheets and to increase her business. Halima will share this loan with her subgroup members dealing in selling clothes, food, tailoring and shops.

In the picture Halima is second from right in the yellow blouse.

loans.use: To buy roofing sheets and increase the size of her business

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Señora Modesta Pastrana is from the municipality of Somotillo and makes a living by selling cheese out of her home. It's very important to point out that she has been very well-known in her community for being a very hard-working woman who strives every day to offer her family a better quality of life.

To continue will her cheese-making business, señora Pastrana has the obligation to invest in the purchase of raw materials. This is why she has sought the support of CEPRODEL, looking for a way to obtain credits that allow her to earn a living for the benefit of herself and her family. Currently she is a loyal client of CEPRODEL and has a credit record of two credits with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Modesta Pastrana es originaria del municipio de Somotillo y se dedica a la venta de queso en su casa de habitación. Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella ha sido muy conocida en su comunidad por ser una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día se esfuerza para brindar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.

Para continuar con el negocio de la elaboración de queso, la señora Pastrana tiene la obligación de invertir en la compra de la materia prima. Es por ello que ha buscado apoyo en CEPRODEL buscando la manera de conseguir créditos que le permitan llevar el sustento a su mesa para beneficio de ella y su familia. Actualmente es una fiel cliente de Ceprodel teniendo un record crediticio de dos créditos con la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 47 years old and originally from Mozambique's capital city, Maputo. Alfredo is married with 3 children, who all live and study in Xai-Xai, in the Gaza Province. On top of supporting his wife and children, Alfredo helps his mother, in-laws and also a few other members of the family.

Alfredo completed secondary school and has been a teacher since 1985. He currently teaches at the Instituto Pedagogico of Boane daily from 7:00am to 10:30pm and earns a monthly salary of MTn 5,000. His salary will be increased by 11% next month due to the government's annual salary adjustment. Alfredo is an endless learner and dreams of attaining a master degree one day. He is currently in his second year at the University of Maputo, pursuing a Biology degree. Alfredo studies from 12:30pm to 5:20pm daily and takes a public transport of 40min to Maputo (30Km away from Boane). Alfredo explained that the university fees are dependent on the person’s capacity to pay and profession. With Alfredo’s base salary and teacher’s diploma he pays only MTn 100 per subject at university. This semester Alfredo is taking 5 different subjects.

As the government provides housing for teachers, Alfredo has always lived in the school at which he teaches. He has been living at the Instituto for more than 10 years now. Alfredo’s dream is to build his own house and provide comfort for his family. He is almost there. With this first loan of MTn 18,500 Alfredo will buy aluminum-roofing, cement to finish the floor and install some missing windows. Alfredo estimates that one or two more loans will be necessary to finish the house and move in. He heard about Hluvuku during a conversation with some colleagues who advised him to approach the institution after hearing him complain about the slow progress of his house’s construction.

In the future Alfredo would like to build a small henhouse in his backyard where he will be able to raise chickens and have a steady business, already planning for retirement when the day comes.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Mukama Mwesigwa Women's Group

texts.en:
Rose M., a 46-year-old woman, is the treasurer of the Mukama Mwesigwa women’s group in Busega. She is a widow with 5 children, 2 of whom are still in school. In addition, she helps to look after her late brother’s child. As a result, she incurs expenses to care for her late brother's child on top of what it costs to pay for her own children's school fees.

She is a poultry farmer, has a piggery, and keeps cows at home. She is seeking a loan to be able to buy more chicks and to thereafter start a taxi business to generate even greater income.

In the photo, she is seated with Elizabeth E. and Mary K., both members of her group. She is thankful for the group’s previous loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Djekafo (Soyons Ensemble Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Djekafo group are married with an average age of 19 years and have 2 children amongst themselves. They live in traditional families with their husbands, their parents-in-law, and their children in the village of Sikouna 1 in the sous-prefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro Region of Mali. The women have specialized in the business of consumer products such as soap, peanuts, fresh milk, and plastic cooking utensils (buckets, kettles, plates), etc. Having ties to one another due to proximity, alliances, and friendship, the women in the group have taken out their first united loan (group loan) with Soro Yiriwaso. They get their stock from various towns (Bamako, Ségou, etc.) by buying from wholesalers. They sell their goods in Sikouna 1 at home as well as in the markets of surrounding villages. The client base is made up of women from the villages and a few men. In the future, they hope to become wholesalers and serve the neighboring villages.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Les membres du groupe Djekafo sont mariées avec une moyenne d’age de 19 ans et 2 enfants .Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, les beaux parents et les enfants dans le village de Sikouna 1 sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Elles se sont spécialisées dans le commerce des articles de consommation courante comme le savon, l’arachide, le lait frais et les ustensiles de cuisine en plastiques (seaux bouilloires assiettes) etc. Liées par des relations de voisinage, d’alliances et d’amitié, les femmes du groupe sont à leur premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles s’approvisionnement dans diverses localités (Bamako, Ségou etc…) auprès de grossistes. Les ventes sont effectuées sur place à Sikouna 1 à domicile et dans les marchés des villages environnants. La clientèle est composée de femmes venant des villages et quelques hommes. Dans le futur, elles envisagent devenir des grossistes et servir l’ensemble des villages voisins.

loans.use: Purchase of buckets, plastic cups, and other various items

loans.name: Emeldina

texts.es:
Emeldina is 34 years old and lives in the neighborhood Villa Venezuela. She is single and has no kids yet. She sells herbal medicine in the area where she lives and the people there demand these products a lot; some because of their beliefs as they think it cures faster than conventional medicine. She will invest the solicited credit in buying products for the herbal medicines to satisfy her clients demands.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Emeldina tiene 34 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales naturales, hace 8 años en conjunto con su hermana inició el negocio de la venta de medicina natural, en el barrio donde ella habita la gente demanda mucho esos productos ya que por creencia de algunos de ellos, creen que curan más rápido que la medicina convencional. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos medicinales naturales para así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy natural products/Compra de productos naturales

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein C. is married and has 4 children. He 56 years old and lives in a small village close to the Lebanese town of Baalback in the Bekaa Valley. Hussein is a farmer and has been a client of Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) for 6 years. He has recently asked for a loan of $1,200 to help build a new home for his family. Hussein has a great history with Al Majmoua, and has always repaid his loans in full and on time.

loans.use: To help build a new home for his family

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
B. Munira is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has 2 adorable children. Eight years ago, Munira decided to start her own business. She was working in a garment factory near her home and knew a lot about sewing designs of the national carpet. So with some savings, she opened a small seamstress shop in her house, which helps her husband support the family. In time, she gained customers and a good reputation for her work. Her elder daughter also helps her with the business. Munira’s children are all studying at school, and next year her daughter is planning to enter University. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business.

Munira is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) that she plans to invest in buying new, modern designs. She commits to paying back the loan in 12 months. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Munira’s business. They will sincerely thank you for your generosity.

loans.use: Purchase new, modern designs for sewing the national carpet

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 47 años y 1 hijo de 9 años. Que  está en  la escuela.  
Mercedes tiene su negocio de venta de productos de belleza,  cosméticos Ebel, empezó hace 1 año apoyando a una señora a vender . Mercedes solo trabaja con los productos de Ebel.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticas Ebel para tener un stock.  
Mercedes sueña con tener un buen negocio propio y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the San Gabriel Community Bank. She is married, 47 years old and the mother of a 9-year-old daughter, who is in school. She sells brand-name beauty products and cosmetics. She started a year ago helping a woman sell her products. Mercedes only works with Ebel brand products. She is requesting a loan of $150, which she will invest in the purchase of Ebel cosmetics to increase her stock. Mercedes' dream is to have her own prosperous business and for her daughter to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Ebel brand cosmetics to increase her stock

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma O., thirty years old. She is a married woman with two children who are in the high school. Emma lives with her family in Teshie in Ghana. She runs a small grocery kiosk in her neighbourhood. She also sells food items such as macaroni, tomatoes, etc on a table top in front of her kiosk. She has been in business for five years. She buys her goods from wholesalers in the city market and retail to her customers. Emma wants a bigger working capital. She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city market in order to save her the problem of frequent trips. She is a member of the community group called “Do Good”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan support one another in handling repayment. She was in a meeting with her group members when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries like assorted drinks, sugar, bottled mineral water, and biscuits etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida P. G. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” de la provincia de Carhuaz.

Zenaida tiene 44 años, tiene cuatro hijos con su conviviente, Zenaida comenta que ha tenido problemas difíciles que no desea recordar, menciona que su mas grande logro ha sido superarse, apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y mejorar su casa, ella se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores y productos de temporada que compra en las zonas rurales del distrito de Tinco y los vende en la feria de Carhuaz actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, ella comenta que ha crecido su negocio tal es así que ahora ya no compra solo cuyes y gallinas también compra cerdos.
 
Con este préstamo de s/.1000.00, que pagará en seis cuotas invertirá en la compra de cerdos para crianza.
 
Zenaida desea recibir talleres de capacitación para mejorar su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Zenaida P. G. is part of the “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” community bank in the province of Carhuaz. Zenaida is 44 years old and has 4 children with her partner. Zenaida says that she has had difficult problems which she does not wish to remember and mentions that her greatest accomplishments have been to improve her life, support her children in their studies and make improvements to her home. She sells small animals and seasonal products which she buys in rural areas of Tinco and then sells in the Carhuaz market. She has been active in this business for the past 10 years. She tells us that she has been able to build her business to a point where she can now buy not only guinea pigs and chickens, but pigs as well. With this 1,000.00 soles loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy pigs to raise. Zenaida wishes to receive training workshops to improve her business as well as her home life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 32 años, es madre de 2 hijos, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catálogo de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, estos productos los lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de Pucallpa de puerta en puerta y a sus amistades y vecinos, dejándolos al contado y al crédito. María trabaja solo por las tardes y le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que por medio del mismo conoce mucha gente y se relaciona más, además es rentable porque cuenta con sus clientes que le comprar desde que se inició. Pero su negocio también tiene un riesgo, que es cuando las personas incumplen con su pago, pero María ya tomado experiencia para manejar estas situaciones. Ella se considera una mujer decidida y luchadora, pues lo que se propone lo cumple y esto está poniendo en práctica en su negocio y con su record de ventas. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, con el dinero solicitado va a comprar más productos y una vitrina para exhibición y seguridad de estos.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old, is the mother of two children and lives with her husband in their own home. For three years she has dedicated herself to selling a nationally recognized line of beauty products by catalog. She sells these products - cash or credit - door-to-door in various places in Pucallpa and to her friends and neighbors. Maria only works in the evenings and she enjoys her work very much as it allows her to meet a lot of people. Her business is also profitable since she relies on clients that have been with her since she started her business. Her business also has some risk which is when people do not pay what they owe but Maria has experience in dealing with these situations. Maria considers herself a dedicated and hardworking woman since she accomplishes what she sets out to do. She practices this in her business and this shows in her sales. This is Maria's second loan with MFP. She will use this loan to purchase more products and a display cabinet to display and protect her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and a display case.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señorita Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (primero de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06  meses, su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado (engorde) y artesanías (tejido a punto); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir materiales para sus tejidos 
Con este préstamo de S/ 900.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá aumentar su capital y comprarse mas toros para engorde y luego venderlos en las ferias de Ilave y Pilcuyo, su anhelo es ser mayorista en tejidos artesanales (compra y venta) en los diferentes lugares turísticos de la región y del País, para lo cual viene ahorrando sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia con buena calidad de vida para toda su familia. 
Ella esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Miss Elsa is a member of the “Ciudad Blanca” Communal Bank in the township of Chijichaya, Ilave District, Province of Collao, Department of Puno. She is 28 years old and single. She does not have children and holds an incomplete degree in secondary education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 months. Her business is the purchase and sale of fattened livestock and handicrafts such as knitting. Her first loan was for 500 soles, with which she purchased materials for knitting.

With this loan of 900 soles, which she is committed to paying back in 3 payments, she will be able to increase her capital and buy more livestock, fatten them and sell them at the Ilave and Pilcuyo fairs.

Miss Elsa’s greatest wish is to become a wholesaler in knitted handicrafts in the different tourists areas of the region and of the country. For this she continues to save her earnings and helps her entire family to sustain a good quality of life. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the help.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital of livestock

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario A., 43 years old, is married to Angelito A. and blessed with 5 children; she lives in Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province in Southern Philippines. Three of her children are in school. She is engaged in running a sari - sari (variety) store. Every day, she works hard to earn an income for the family but unfortunately it is not enough.

The store cannot provide enough money for their living; that's why she wants to add some stock to her store by applying for a loan with HSPFI. This will be her 1st loan and she needs the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase grocery items. If granted, this will be a big help to them to have a better living.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Francis Lisbeth

texts.es:
La señora Francis se ha destacado por ser una persona que vende productos lácteos en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León habiendo desarrollado su negocio y obtenido varios clientes.

Actualmente ha realizado 14 créditos en Ceprodel ya que este ha sido el pilar en el desarrollo de su negocio. El motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel una vez mas es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los lácteos para ofertarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Francis stands out as a person who sells dairy products in the market "La Terminal" in the city of Leon, having developed her business and obtained various clients. At the moment she has completed 14 loans in Ceprodel and this has been essential to the development of her business. Her reason for coming to Ceprodel once again is to obtain credit for the purchase of raw materials with which to create dairy products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Абдулкосим занимается оптовой торговлей мандаринов и яблок. Товар покупает в г. Худжанде (100 км.) и привозит в г. Исфару. Здесь у него есть постоянные клиенты, которые берут у него товар под реализацию. Получив от них ниличные деньги от товара сданного 2-3 назад он едет обратно за товаром. Абдулкосиму 36 лет, женат, имеет 2 детей.  Кроме этой деятельности Абдулкосим также таксует на своей собственной машине. Эти 2 вида деятельности приносят ему его основной доход. Заявку которую он подает, собирается использовать под расширение своего бизнеса и погасит в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdulkosim is a wholesale seller of tangerines and apples. He purchases his products in Khujand (100km) and brings it to Isfara. Here he has regular customers who take products from him to sell. After getting cash from them for products that he gave them 2-3 ago he travels again to purchase products. Abdulkosim is 36 years old; he is married and has 2 children. In addition to this business, Abdulkosim is also a taxi driver in his personal vehicle. These two businesses bring him his main earnings. He plans to use his loan in order to grow his business and will pay it back over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Tin

texts.en: Mr. Tin K. lives in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Ream Mom, owns a poultry business. Since her ducks are growing bigger and bigger, she can not support them. Thus, Mr. Tin K. decided to request a loan to buy duck food for his wife’s poultry business. He is 43 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy duck food for his wife’s poultry business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
" I dream that someday my sari-sari store business will turn to something bigger where I could display more goods and earn bigger sales of my products. My experience in selling somehow taught me how to deal with people and situations, especially when there are only few sales", says Gina B., 39-year old mother of five children. 

She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000. The loan will be used in buying additional merchandise for her sari-sari store business. 

Through CEVI, Mrs. B. has ready access to credit to support her business. She also received leadership trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchjandise for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocking and selling cereals

loans.name: Mca Primary School, Massesebeh Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of the MCA Primary school of Masesebeh village, about three miles from Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. MCA Primary school is the only school in Massegbeh village. The school was established in 2004 by the Missionary Church of Africa. Currently, it has ten staff and a total of 182 pupils. 

These teachers, like many of their counterparts in Magburaka and other parts of the country, have applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva in order to invest in something meaningful. And gradually, out of their monthly salaries, their school bursar repays SMT on a monthly basis on behalf of the teachers.

As teachers’ salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, needless to say that SMT/Kiva loans are of a great importance to these teachers. Some of them will use this loan to either purchase a piece of land in order to build a house, or complete a house building project they have started. Some will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture, like a bed, chairs etc.  Some will use theirs to pay school fees either for themselves pursue further studies or for their children. While others will use theirs to invest in businesses in order to supplement their meager monthly salaries.

Abdul K. (back row second from left) is the head master at the school. Abdul is 47 years of age. He was born in Yoni village, about 40 miles from Massesebeh village. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children. One of their children is in Senior Secondary School III (SSS III), the other in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), one in class six and the other in class one. Mr. K. has been a teacher for twenty-three years now. With this loan, he will invest it in business. He sells items like cigarette, sugar, soaps and so on.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 04 hijos.  Tiene estudios de primaria incompleta  (4to grado) y vive en la Parcialidad de Cosipiri.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor como ovinos para engorde.

Su deseo es comprarse una casa en Ilave.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Manuela de Hoy Communal Bank which is located in the Llave district, El Collao Province, Puno Department. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She completed 4th grade of elementary school and lives in the Cosipiri neighborhood. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 3 years her initial 300 new soles loan being used to raise livestock. Her goal is to buy her own house in Llave. She enjoys the savings and the meetings between the Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase young livestock.

loans.name: Dos

texts.en:
Dos P., age 38, is a widow who lives with her 15-year-old child in Kampong Cham Province. Her child is a mechanic with an income of around US $8.33 per day. To make a living, she produces baskets. Cambodian hand-made crafts require hard work and time to produce best output for competitive prices in the market. Typically, she is able to earn an income of US $2 per day. 

In light of the country's economic difficulties, which result from the financial crisis, P. is seeking to increase her income. P. is asking for a loan of $1000 to invest in her child's business. She will give this money to her child to buy spare parts for his customer's cars. She believes that this will help raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a 56-year-old widow with six sons, all of whom are in school. Abena works very hard to provide for her family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa, in the Central region of Ghana. Abena trades in smoked fish. She buys her goods all the way from the Eastern region, which she says is cost effective. She sells on a table top at the market square in her community. Abena has been in business for over 30 years and is requesting a loan to buy smoked fish in bulk so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Chhengkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhengkea H., 46, and her husband, Mr. Lieng Hun, 44, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometres from Phnom Penh City.  They married in 1990 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. One of the sons assists his father in the business and the others are in local schools.

Chhengkea has been raising pigs for over 10 years. In addition, she is a silk weaver as well. Her husband has been a wooden house builder for more than three years. She has requested a loan from Kiva through Maxima one time already. She is now requesting her second loan of $800 in order to add to her own money to build a staircase for her house.

loans.use: To build a staircase for her house.

loans.name: Rafaela Herrera Ii Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo llamado Grupo Solidario Rafaela Herrera II, está conformado por Zaida del Socorro García M. y Emeteria R. E.. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras, las  dos tienen sus propios negocios. Zaida se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y Emeteria se dedica a la venta de ropa, a pesar de tener una niña que esta enferma con mucha mas razon ella tiene todos los sacrificios por salir adelante y apoyar en lo necesario a su hija que lo necesita. Por lo que ambas tienen mucho tiempo en las diferentes actividades económicas. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para materia prima que es necesaria para sus negocios. Ambas luchan por proporcionarles a sus familias estabilidad económica de sus humildes actividades.
texts.en:
This is the Rafaela Herrera II Solidarity Group, whose members are Zaida del Socorro García M. and Emeteria R. E.. They are very hardworking women, and both have their own businesses. Zaida sells general merchandise and Emeteria has a business selling clothing, despite having to care for her disabled daughter. This gives her even more reason to make sacrifices to get ahead and to provide the necessary support for all of her daughter's needs. Both Zaida and Emeteria have spent a lot of time on their different business activities. They are requesting a loan for working capital to invest in supplies for their businesses. Both struggle to provide a stable financial situation for their families with the earnings from their humble businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa owns a general store in her village. She started her business just this year and it gets stronger over time. She hopes to have additional capital to further expand her business. She needs a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more commodities so that she can become more competent and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to get the chance to further improve her business. 

"Higher capital means higher income”, said Narcisa, when asked why she joined ASKI. She hopes to have more income through the help of lenders. She aspires to improve their poor living condition, so she is very eager to earn more income. “These are all for the benefit of my family”, she adds.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam P., 58, is married and lives with her husband and five of her children in Phnom Penh. She sells vegetables at the local market to earn a living and is able to make about US$3 of profit every day. Her husband is too old to operate a business so he stays at home take cares of his children. Four of the children are cleaners and are able to make US$2 each a day. Sam P. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon S., 43, is married and lives with four of her children in Siem Reap province. She and her husband are fish sellers who typically make about US$ 5 each day and are supported by one child working on a construction site.

Huon S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase fish for sale. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: buying fish to sell

loans.name: Turdihol

texts.ru: Каршиева Турдихол проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 43 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж вместе с сыном, занимаются производством кирпичей. Сама Турдихол занимается выращиванием риса. Она выращивает в основном для продажи, торгует рядом с домом. Кредит просит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
K. Turdihol lives in the Shahrituz region. She's forty-three years old, married and has three children. Her husband and son manufacture bricks. Turdihol grows rice for a living, selling most of it near her house. She is asking for a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jaypee

texts.en:
Jaypee L. is from the village of Tamucco Sto. Niño Cagayan. He is 20 years old. Jaypee is single. To make a living, Jaypee sells agricultural equipment and farm supplies to local farmers. Jaypee has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2008, Jaypee joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and give him the ability to engage in business activities. Jaypee is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase general agricultural supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jaypee from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general agricultural supplies & equipment

loans.name: Gemma's Group

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the village of Sta. Rosa, Gamu,Isabela. She is 56 years old. Gemma is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Gemma is married and has adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and street foods in the local community. With her vending business, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 47 years old and married with eight children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old. Her children all go to school and are still dependent on her. To make a living, Eunice sells cellophane bags in Benin City, Edo State. She loves her business because it is highly profitable. Her customers are mostly friends and local residents. She hopes to expand her business in the future and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cellophane bags to sell. Eunice was about to go to the market when we visited her. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Las Campanitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Campanitas” esta representado por la señora Carolina y conformada por 10 miembros que van cursando su primer ciclo con bastantes expectativas para hacer crecer sus negocios y poder tener una institución que confíe en su capacidad y en sus esfuerzo por crecer y salir adelante. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como ropa, pescados, verduras, desayunos, papa y menudencias, por ejemplo la presidenta se dedica a al venta D. frutas y esta la mayoría del tiempo en su puesto D. venta en el mercado Bolívar por lo que se ve en la necesidad D. descuidar un poco a sus hijos que si no tiene con quien dejarlos debe llevarlos a su puesto para que pasen un tiempo con ella su mayor expectativa es poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos para que puedan tener un mejor futuro y es por esta razón que la señora Carolina se esfuerza tanto todos los días para poder sustentar a los pequeños y mantener sus hogares. En cuanto al ámbito competitivo se pueD. mencionar que siempre esta presenta pero las socias deben tener productos D. mejor calidad para ofrecer a sus clientes es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para incrementar su capital D. trabajo e incrementar su mercadería con productos mas competitivos, otros D. los socios desean invertir en la refacción D. sus puestos D. venta para darles mayor comodidad a sus clientes como las vendedoras D. desayunos y el resto solo desea estocar sus productos o diversificar los para una mayor ganancia.   En cuanto a la competencia muchas D. las socias tuvieron que dejar D. vender algunos productos por la competencia pero a su esfuerzo y dedicación saben como salir adelante para llevar el pan D. cada día a sus familias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina is the head of the group “Las Campanitas” (The Little Bells). This group has ten members. They are beginning their first loan cycle. They have a lot of hope to grow their businesses since an institution that has confidence in their capacity and their desire to expand and move forward backs them. The majority of the members sell products such as clothes, fish, vegetables, breakfast, potatoes and prepared food. For example, the president sells fruit. She is in her stall in the Bolivar Market most of her time. Some of the time she is also caring for her children in her stall, as she doesn’t have anyone else to care for them. She hopes to proviD. her children with a good education so that they can have a good future. It is because of this that Mrs. Carolina works so hard each day. She has to support her young ones and maintain her home. In the competitive sense, she would like to mention that the members ought to have good quality products to offer to their customers. For this reason they are asking for a loan to increase their working capital and increase their inventory with competitive products. Other members would like to invest in the repair of their stalls in order to give their customers a more comfortable experience. These members sell breakfast. The remaining members want to offer a greater variety of products in order to increase their earnings. Because of the competition, many members have had to stop selling certain products. With effort and dedication the members know how to move forward and bring the bread home each day to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Hands And Minds Group

texts.en:
Anna D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Hands and Minds'. She is 59 years old and is married, with 8 children aged 20 -38 years old. Their educational levels are high school graduates-university graduates. She also cares for 7 orphans. She is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to poverty.

Anna and her family live and work in the Cotton Tree community in Harbel, Margibi county, Liberia. Her business is the sale of fish. She buys from fishermen wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community in Harbel. She has been running this business for more than 20 years and hopes to re-establish her cold storage business that got destroyed during the Liberia Civil crisis.

Anna started by selling doughnuts, then she later got into used clothes sales, and finally decided to sell fish. She determines the kinds of fish customers like to buy and brings more of that in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Anna needs this loan to purchase more fish for resale to improve her business. She dreams of her children continuing to the highest level of education in the future. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Anna is the lady standing in the right side of the photo.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale to improve business.

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Hoy H., age 31, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She has a business selling fish and vegetables at a local market in the province, earning an income of US $5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially those for her children’s education. She has been doing this job since 2001. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of US $2 per day. H. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more fish for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Comercita

texts.en:
Comercita D. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Comercita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Comercita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Comercita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Comercita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Comercita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Manuel T. es padre de dos hijas a las que mantiene y proporciona las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. El caballero José Manuel ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda con el fin de proporcionarle a sus pequeñas hijas las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen y tengan un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
José Manuel T. is married and has two children. He works as an aid to general services in Ceprodel. He has received five loans, which have helped his family’s well-being. He has used them to make improvements to his house. “I am grateful for the support that Ceprodel has given me during these five years.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Leonilda es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Leonilda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas, golosinas.
Leonilda necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza.
Los sueños de Leonilda son educar a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonilda is a member of the Totorilla communal bank. Leonilda, 40, lives with her life partner and their two children; she has a store in her house where she sells beverages and snacks. Leonilda needs a 1500 sol loan to buy beer. Her dreams are to educate her children and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith G., 55 years old, is a rice grower and a sari-sari storeowner. She wishes to avail a loan. She wants to grow her harvest by buying all the farm supplies. She has two children. She is quite happy with the income she earns from her rice farm.  She hopes to receive a loan of PHP 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to resell. Aside from the loan they are providing, CEVI also enrolls all their clients into an insurance program.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban Y., 57, is married and resides with her husband and a school-aged child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a tailor at home for an income of about $5 per day. Her husband is a soldier in the city, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses.
