Y. is requesting a loan of $500 to repair her house. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to repair the house

loans.name: Sam-Onn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-onn S. (pictured here), aged 40 years old, is a widow with one son and two daughters. She lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
 
Sam-onn has been a primary school teacher for 20 years. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to renovate the house where she lives. She will use part of her loan to buy silk materials for her sister’s weaving business.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives and to buy silk materials for her sister’s weaving business.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng C. is 53 years old and she lives in Pou Ta Mok village in Takeo province. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local public school, another one is helping her to farm, and the other one sells groceries. Her husband, Mr. Gnem Sor, is a pig breeder who is able to earn some money from selling pigs to support his family. He is shown in the photo with her.

Mrs. Kheng C. is a farmer who owns two hectares (5 acres) of land where she grows a crop to sell to support her family.

Now Mrs. Kheng C. has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will buy gasoline and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan B. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 24 years old. Jonathan is single. To make a living, Jonathan owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of bananas in the local community. Jonathan has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jonathan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jonathan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials: stone, cement, sand, concrete blocks

loans.name: Antony-Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Antony-Tamemsu” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Rugiatu K. who is pictured on the left. She was born in Makeni and is age forty. She is married to a businessman and they have four children who are attending school.

For many years now, Rugiatu has been selling market food – rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), onions, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more rice, palm-oil, Margi, onions, etc., to sell

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita Q. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Carmencita owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Carmencita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Carmencita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Carmencita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en: Cosmas is 26 years old and married to a teacher. He is blessed with one child. He offers transport using his handcart (mkokoteni). He also does farming to get extra cash. Being a businessman, he joined Pamoja group of Faulu Kenya where he saves his money. He has been guaranteed a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings by the group. With the loan, he will buy five handcarts. He hopes to buy a canter in the future so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy five handcarts

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou B. is from the village of Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Marylou is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marylou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marylou is just starting this business.

In 2010, Marylou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marylou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marylou is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marylou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Diamond Group

texts.en:
Alja K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Diamond Group. She is 30 years old, married, and has one child who is seven years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial difficulty. 
 
For 8 years she has been selling lappas ( a traditional dress for women) in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of lappa. 

She describes herself as a very hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of lappa (traditional dresses)

loans.name: Faina

texts.en:
Faina is 28 years old, married with two children; the first one is 4 years old and the younger one is one year old. Faina is a businesswoman however her husband is a mason. This family works hard for the purpose of progressing quickly in their activities.  In particular, Faina owns a business selling various styles of clothes and she has an experience of 10 years in her business. In that period, she has employed one person  from her community as a helper.

Faina is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more bales of clothes.  With this loan she will be able to attract more customers which is the best way of earning more profits.

loans.use: Purchasing additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new machine for his taxi

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda A. is from the village of Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Esmeralda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Esmeralda owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esmeralda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esmeralda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA ELTRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marisol; ella tiene 41 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de adornos de navidad, la socia viaja hasta Juliaca  y Puno para comprar su mercadería para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que se encuentran en el Molino. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Marisol is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for the Triumph), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Marisol divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling Christmas decorations. She travels to Juliaca and Puno to acquire her merchandise and then sells it to her customers in Molino. Marisol is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

She is grateful to those who helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Janet; ella tiene 27 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de peluquería ella realiza todo tipo de corte de cabello, tanto para mujeres y varones también realiza tientes, manicure y pedicura entre otros servicios más, la socia está muy contenta con su negocio ya que trabaja en lo que le gusta y así tiene tiempo para estar con su hijo para verlo y estar con él.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su peluquería.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Janet is a member of the 'Siempre Adelante' (Always Moving Forward) community bank which is located Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Janet is 27 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her hairdressing business.  Janet provides different styles of haircut, for both women and men.  She also colors hair and provides manicures, pedicures and other services.  She is very happy with her business since she is working in a job she likes and she also has time to spend with her son, to see him and be with him.

Janet is requesting this loan to keep her hairdressing salon running.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep her hairdressing salon running

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in the farming business for thirty-five years. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces milk, maize, bananas, tomatoes and sugarcane, all of which are sold locally. He is also employed as a civil servant and serves as an assistant chief in his town. 

He has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. His family will therefore be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this investment will help pay school fees for his children. 

His biggest challenges have been diseases and lack of market for his products. He would like to open a big retail shop in future.

Daniel is 49 years old and married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Ines es una pequeña comerciante, que ha venido creciendo gracias a su empeño al trabajo de lograr mejores utilidades. Su negocio es una pulpería que inicio hace años con fondos propios.
Y que gracias a la institución de Afodenic logro aumentar su inventario con préstamos que ha otorgado por medio de financiamiento a plazos, en donde ha logrado la variedad de productos en su pulpería así como invertir en cosméticos para vender más.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara granos básicos, en arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, bidón de aceite, caja de jabón, golosinas y parte en cosméticos como: perfumenes, crema de piel, pinturas de labios, vanidad, entre otros. Con el objetivo de poder cubrir sus gastos básicos como personales estando ah altos costos, a si como cumplir con sus compromisos de pago para seguir optando a los cerditos.
texts.en:
Inés is a small merchant whose business has grown thanks to her commitment to work and achieve higher profits. Her business is a local store that she started years ago with her own funds. And thanks to the loans repayable in installments granted by the microfinance institution Afodenic, she was able to increase the size and variety of her inventory. She invested also in cosmetics to sell more.

With this new loan Inés wants to buy staple food, rice, beans, corn, sugar, oil, soap, candy, and also some cosmetics, such as perfume, skin cream, lipsticks and vanity cosmetics, among others. She will use her profits to cover her basic personal needs and repay the loan installments on schedule, so that she remains eligible for further loans.

loans.use: To invest in staple food and cosmetics, thus increasing her turnover

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Francisco, who is 63 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps with his wife’s business activities. They have six children who are between 27 to 43 years old. Juliana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juliana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

This time, for her sixteenth loan, Juliana is borrowing 15,000 PHP to buy product items for her store and to save for the future. Juliana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase basic products for general store

loans.name: Naema

texts.en:
Naema is a young housewife and the mother of one son. Her son is one year old. Naema's husband has a mobile stall. He travels about the city of Qalqilia selling various items such as kitchen items, cleaning materials, etc. Naema took out a loan from FATEN so that her husband could purchase goods to add to the variety of the items he sells and attract more customers.

Naema's husband and her one-year-old son appear in the picture here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in a mobile stall

loans.name: Sarsembai

texts.ru:
Сарсембай Казыбеков родился в селе Акбашат (Жайылский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). Женат и проживает с младшим сыном, снохой и внучкой.
Сарсембай родился в 1953 году, в простой и многодетной (5 сыновей) семье фермера. Отец занимался полеводством и животноводством, а мать была домохозяйкой. После окончания 10 классов Сарсембай поступил в училище на шофера грузовых автомашин и тракторов. Закончив учебу, устроился в родном колхозе на работу в качестве водителя. В 1973 году в возрасте 20 лет Сарсембай пошел служить в армию и, вернувшись, снова стал работать в родном колхозе. В 1977 году Сарсембай женился, а год спустя у него родилась дочь. Первое время Сарсембай с женой и дочкой жили у его родителей с братьями. Спустя некоторое время, колхоз, в котором он работал, выделил ему участок земли в родном селе под строительство дома, где со временем Сарсембай построил дом и все необходимые постройки. В 1980 году у него родилась еще одна дочь, пять лет спустя сын и еще через два года дочка. Семья росла, Сарсембай продолжал работать водителем,  а также, параллельно, он содержал скот и занимался полеводством. В 2006 году Сарсембаю удалось собрать немного денег и купить грузовую автомашину ЗИЛ, на которой он перевозит сельхоз продукцию и в свободное время предоставляет односельчанам услуги по перевозке грузов. К тому же, он ежегодно арендует около 10 гектаров земли, на которых выращивает сахарную свеклу, ячмень и клевер. Эта деятельность помогла Сарсембаю дать хорошее приданное для трех дочерей и женить сына. В данный момент, благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Сарсембая в хозяйстве имеется 2 дойных коровы, 1 бычок, 8 овец, а также грузовая автомашина ЗИЛ. Сарсембай планирует использовать кредит в 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки удобрений и семян для посева.
В будущем, Сарсембай мечтает купить дом для сына, недалеко от своего дома. 
About Bai-Tushum and Partners Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.
texts.en:
Sarsembai K. was born in the village of Akbashat in the Jayilskiy region of the Chuyskaya province in Kyrgyzstan. He is married and lives with his youngest son, daughter in law and granddaughter.

Sarsembai was born in 1953 in a simple family of a farmer with many children (five sons). His father was doing agriculture and animal husbandry and his mother was a homemaker. After finishing the tenth grade Sarsembai enrolled in college to become a driver of trucks and tractors. After finishing his studies he got a job in his hometown's collective farm as a driver. In 1973 being twenty years of age Sarsembai went to serve in the army and continued working in the collective farm after he returned. In 1977 Sarsembai got married and a year later his daughter was born. At first Sarsembai and his wife and daughter lived with his parents and brothers. But some time later the collective farm where he worked had provided him with a plot of land in his home village for building a house where in time Sarsembai has built his home and all the necessary annexes. In 1980 his second daughter was born and five years later his son was born and then another daughter two years after that. His family was growing and Sarsembai continued working as a driver as well as breeding cattle and doing agriculture. In 2006 Sarsembai was able to save some money and buy a truck ZIL which he uses to transport agriculture products and in free time provide services to his neighbors by transporting freights. Additionally he annually rents out about ten hectares of land where he grows sugar beets, barley and clover. This business helped Sarsembai give good dоwry to his three daughters and wed his son. At this time because of his persistence and industry Sarsembai has two milk cows, one calf, eight sheep and a ZIL truck. Sarsembai plans to use the loan of 70,000 som to buy fertilizer and seeds for sowing.

In the future Sarsembai dreams to buy a house for his son not far from his house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Quimey Group

texts.es:
Jorge forma parte D. banco comunal “Quimey” conformado por 22 emprendedores, que se desempeñan en los rubros de artesanía, repostería, confección de tarjetas de visita, peluquería y comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, joyas y perfumes. Pertenecientes a la ciudad de Villarrica.
Jorge quién en la foto aparece en segunda fila, al lado izquierdo, se encuentra de pie y viste polera blanca. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para niños, mujeres y varones. Él trabaja en el garaje de su casa desde hace 2 años y vende sus artículos tres veces a la semana correspondientes a los días jueves, viernes y sábados. Los días restantes de la semana, se dedica a reparar muebles, vender bolsos y está preparando un nuevo negocio que es la Picaduría de leña. Durante la temporada de verano Jorge arrienda su casa a turistas, por dos meses (enero y febrero), ya que recibe más ingresos que su mismo negocio, Villarrica es una zona turística, lo que es favorable. Con éste préstamo comprará ropa usada de casa en la ciudad de Santiago, específicamente; sábanas y cortinas.
Jorge trabajó durante 20 años en el rubro D. comercio teniendo a su poder una distribuidora, pero lamentablemente su negocio quebró, sin embargo a pesar de ésta mala experiencia, su sueño es volver a tener una distribuidora de confites, que le permitan mantener una estabilidad laboral. Por ende sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio, ya que de esta manera obtendría mayores ingresos que le permitirían tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Jorge vive con su esposa y su hija de 22 años.
El está muy agradecido de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, sobretodo porque él es presidente y líder D. grupo de emprendedores, los apoya y aconseja.
En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, éste será un gran aporte para su negocio, ya que con este podrá invertir más y aumentar sus ingresos.
Villarrica es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios D. área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Pucón. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of the communal bank “Quimey,” which is made up of 22 entrepreneurs.  They work in the areas of handicrafts, confections, making business cards, hair dressing and trade, specifically selling clothing, jewlery and perfumes.  They all live in the city of Villarrica.
In the photo, Jorge is on the left side of the second row.  He is standing and wearing a white t-shirt.  He makes his living selling second-hand men's women's and children's clothing.  For the last two years he has worked out of this garage.  He sells his merchandise three days a week, on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays.  During the rest of the week, he repairs furniture, sells handbags and is preparing to start a new business chopping firewood.  Because Villarica is a tourist area, which is favorable, Jorge rents his house to toursits during the two months of the summer season (January and February).  He makes more money from the rental than from his businesses.  With this loan, Jorge will purchase second-hand household linens in the city of Santiago, specifically sheets and curtains.
Jorge worked for 20 years in commerce, running a distribution company.  Regretably, his business went bankrupt.  Nevertheless, in spite of that bad experience, his dream is to once again have a confections distribution company, which would afford him job stability.  Consequently, he is motivated to continue with his businesses, since that is the way to obtain the greatest earnings and have a better quality of life.
Jorge lives with his wife and his 22 year-old daughter.
He is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza.  He really enjoys participating in the meetings, especially because he is the president of the communal bank and the leader of the entrepreneurs, who he supports and advises.
With regard to the financing he is receiving from Fondo Esperanza, it will be a great support to his business.  He will be able to invest more and increase his earnings.
Villarrica is a city in the south of Chile located in the Araucanía Region.  It is a small city but offers all the basic and tourist services.  It is one of the principal service centers in the mountain area and a prinicpal tourist center of the region, along with Pucón. During the summer months, there are numerous activities and cultural, artistic and sporting events.  In addition, there are countless options for Eco-tourism, Adventure Tourism and Ethno-tourism.

loans.use: to purchase sheets and curtains.

loans.name: Las Cruces Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre las cruces, los integrantes decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama el municipio en donde viven, esta historia es acerca de la señora Socorro C. T., es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, Ariana, Andrea y Yamileth, de las cuales solo dos estudian la mayor está cursando el tercer año de primaria y la otra esta en tercero de preescolar, ya que la menor apenas tiene 1 año de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pescados.
Doña socorro decidió iniciar este negocio por que no contaba con la solvencia económica suficiente, para la educación de sus hijas, ella decidió invertir el crédito en la compra de más pescados y un poco de refrescos, y así continuar con sus ventas.
Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para poder convertirlo en una marisquería, ya que así tendrá más variedad de productos, para mejorar e incrementar sus ventas y ganancias para así seguir apoyando a sus pequeños hijos con sus estudios y en un futuro puedan terminar una muy buena carrera profesional.
Platica que todos sus compañeros, son personas responsables y pagadoras puesto que todas se conocen y no tienen ningún problema entre ellos.
Dice que esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con FRAC, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, asi poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Las personas que integran el grupo de las cruces y las distintas actividades que realizan son las siguientes: socorro-venta de pescados, honoria-venta de pan, Juana-abarrotes, audith-venta de maíz, rogelia-abarrotes, ehilen-venta de colchas, oralia-venta de tamales, baudelia-abarrotes, Florencio-venta de agua y Juan-compra de ganado
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Cruces.”  The members decided to call it that because that’s the name of the town they live in.

This story is about Mrs. Socorro C. T..  She is a single mother of three children:  Ariana, Andrea and Yamileth.  Two of them are in school.  The oldest is in third grade and the other is in third year of preschool.  The youngest is barely a year old.  Socorro is a fish merchant.

Socorro decided to go into this business because she did not have enough economic solvency to pay for her daughters’ education.  She decided to use the loan money to buy more fish and a few soft drinks to continue with her sales.  She wants to continue reinvesting in her business to turn it into a seafood market to have a wider variety of products and to increase and improve sales and profits to continue supporting her young children’s education so that they will finish professional careers in the future.

She relates that all her fellow members are responsible people who pay their installments; they all know each other and have no problems among themselves.

She says that she’s very grateful to Kiva lenders and to FRAC because thanks to them she’s getting ahead and has been able to have a business of her own and support her daughters’ schooling.

The members of the Las Cruces group and the activities they carry out are:

Socorro – fish sales
Honoria – bread sales
Juana – groceries
Audith – corn sales
Rogelia – groceries
Ehilen – bedspread sales
Oralia – tamale sales
Baudelia – groceries
Florencio – water sales
Juan – livestock sales

loans.use: to buy more fish and a few soft drinks.

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munhtsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her son and other relatives in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. She manages a clothes-trading business with the help of her younger sister. Munhtsetseg started her business in 2000 with 250,000 MNT at a rented stall in a local market. Since then, she has been able to expand her business and she recently began renting an additional stall. Now, Munhtsetseg’s working capital exceeds 2,500,000 MNT. 

Munhtsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from China. She is planning to have her own container where she can conduct her business independently. Munhtsetseg is an open-minded and polite woman who says, “I am planning to expand my business in the future.”

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Tsolmonbaatar

texts.en:
Tsolmonbaatar is a 28-year-old man living with his wife and two daughters in a ger, which is a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His older daughter attends kindergarten, while his younger one, who is 5 months old, stays home with her mother.

To earn a living, he manages a photo studio business in his town. Based on teaching and instruction from his brother, he started his business in 2008. At first, it was quite hard to manage his photo studio. But, through hard work, he managed to stabilize his business and to build a strong customer base. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a diligent man who says, "I am doing my best in order to feed my family."

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 MNT ($2,400) to buy new photo equipment for his studio.

loans.use: To purchase new photo equipment for his studio

loans.name: Maria Cleotilde

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cleotilde tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la colonia Maria Pastora Rodriguez de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos. sus comidas las vende en el mercado de San Marcos de Colon. Maria todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar sus alimentos y asi poder cubrir con todos los pedidos que le hacen diariamente sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, arroz, frijoles, manteca, aceite, chorizos, mortadela, verduras, tortillas, refrescos, cafe, jugos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Cleotilde is 49 years old.  She lives in Maria Pastora Rodriguez district, in the city of Choluteca and her business is selling sweet treats, breakfasts and lunches.  She sells her meals in San Marcos de Colon market.  Every day, Maria gets up at 5.00am to prepare her food so that she can cover all the orders that her customers make each day.

Maria will use her loan to buy beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, butter, oil, chorizo, bologna, vegetables, tortillas, soft drinks, coffee and juice.  She needs the profits from her business to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, butter, oil, chorizo, bologna, vegetables, tortillas, soft drinks, coffee and juice

loans.name: Duo Luz De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
DUO LUZ D. VILLA NUEVA

HORTENCIA D. 49 AÑOS D. EDAD TIENE 3 HIJOS MAYORES D. EDAD, LA MAS PEQUEÑA TRABAJA Y  VIVE CON ELLA,  HORTENCIA A TRABAJADO DESD. MUY PEQUEÑA EN NEGOCIOS, DURANTE 20 AÑOS VENDIO  PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA, ROPA Y ZAPATOS   D. MANERA AMBULANTE CON EL PASO DEL TIEMPO DESIDIO ABRIR UN LOCAL EN SU DOMICILIO DOND. VEND.    SU MERCADERIA  Y LOGRO AGREGAR A SU VENTA PRODUCTOS POR CATALOGO, PELUCHES, ADORNOS, ETC. EL CREDITO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO ES PARA INVERTIR EN CALZADO Y ROPA NUEVA. EL SUEÑO D. ELLA ES AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y ABRIR UN NUEVO LOCAL Y QUE SUS HIJOS EN UN FUTURO TAMBIEN  CUENTEN CON UN NEGOCIO PROPIO PARA TENER UN MEJOR FUTURO  POR OTRA PARTE  BROWSON  TIENE  29 AÑOS D. EDAD TIENE  2 HIJOS  PEQUEÑOS , BROWSON A TRABAJADO DURANTE 5 AÑOS  HACIENDO VIAJES CORTOS EN TRICICLO EN LA COMUNIDAD DOND. EL VIVE  ACTUELMENTE TIENE 3 TRICICLOS Y HACE 2 AÑOS HABRIO UNA PANADERIA , EL CREDITO QUE EL SOLICITA ES PARA INVERTIR EN SU PANADERIA , EL SUEÑO D. EL ES PODER ABRIR OTRA PANADERIA  Y QUE SUS HIJOS ESTUDIEN Y SEAN PERSONAS D. BIEN.
texts.en:
Luz D. Villa Nueva group

Hortencia is 49 years old and has three grown-up children.  Her youngest [daughter] works and lives with her.  Hortencia has in businesses since she was very young.  For 20 years, she sold beauty products, clothes and shoes as an itinerant street vendor.  Over time, she decided to open premises in her home where she would sell her merchandise.  She then added to her sales inventory and started selling products from catalogs, stuffed toys, decorations, etc.

Hortencia is requesting this loan to invest in footwear and new clothes.  Her dream is to expand her business and open new premises.  She hopes that, in the future, her children will also own their own businesses so that they can enjoy a better future.

Browson is 29 years old and has two young children.  He has been working for five years making short trips in a three-wheeled vehicle, in his community.  He currently has 3 three-wheeled vehicles and two years ago he opened a bakery.  He is requesting this loan to invest in his bakery.  Browson's dream is to be able to open another bakery and for his children to study and become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy flour for making bread and to buy footwear and new clothes to sell

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is in the business of raising hogs. She has a piggery in her backyard. Geneva sells her pigs at her town's market. She also tills a small parcel of land where she grows rice.

Geneva plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. She hopes to have a stable income so she could continue supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
H. is a 57-year-old married man, father of three children, living in Saida. H. has worked by trading in generators since 1990. He's well known in the region for selling good quality engines and providing the best customer service. He works hard to improve his business, which is very much requested in the region because of the electricity problems from which they suffer.
 
H. has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles. All of his loans were invested in his business as will be the case this time. His loan will increase the number of engines that he has so he can increase his capital and increase his income. His previous loans had a big impact on his business and on his family's social and financial situation. Most of his customers are businessmen and constructors, in addition to people who work hard at having electricity 24/7.

loans.use: to buy generators to increase his trade

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina  es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Sabina  nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 55 años de edad y tiene su pareja y con ella tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Sabina vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Sabina se dedica a la ganadería pues tiene varias vacas lecheras quienes producen leche. Ella pertenece a una asociación productores de leche “Tambo Lac”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más ganado mejorado y para el mantenimiento del establo.
texts.en:
Sabina is a hardworking and responsible person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the Communal Bank “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

Sabina says she was born in the community of Tambo Real in Anta Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 55 years old, in a relationship with her partner, and has two children. Sabina currently lives in the same community where she was born and has developed her business activities. She raises cattle and has several dairy cows that produce milk. Sabina is a member of the “Tambo Lac” Association of Milk Producers. She has been in business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Sabina is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy better cattle and pay for the maintenance of her stable.

loans.use: to buy better cattle and to pay for the maintenance of her stable.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 37-year-old lady, married to Bernadus. They have been blessed with two lovely children, namely: Irma, a 14 year old girl, in the 2nd grade of junior high school and Doni, a 9 year old boy, in the 4th grade of elementary school.

Yuliana sells betel vine and areca nuts (a kind of plant and fruit that can be chewed both dried and fresh with lime) in the market. Yuliana has been engaged this business for five years since they returned from Irian Jaya – another province in Indonesia. She is interested in running the business as there are many people, particularly those who come from the remote places that still consume betel vine and areca nuts. The betel vine and areca nuts also still become one of the requirements in wedding tradition when the groom proposes the bride. 

Yuliana initiated the business using her money. She decided to run the business as she wants to help her husband in generating more income. Moreover, their children are growing up so Yuliana needs more money to cover their living and educational cost as well. Yuliana is a kind-hearted mother; she is willing to work hard for her children’s future. She hopes that they will have better life than she has now. Yuliana would like to expand her business by selling garlic and onion. She is optimistic that these products will be sold out quickly as they are the main ingredients in cooking. Therefore, Yuliana is seeking a loan that can help her in improving her business.

She heard information about TLM that it usually assists the small entrepreneurs who have the passion and willingness to improve their businesses. She is  requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. She plans to purchase garlic and onion in large quantity and to add more betel vine and areca nuts stocks.

loans.use: to purchase garlic and onion in large quantity and to add more betel vine and areca nuts stocks

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a hard-working, 22-year-old mother of two. She had her first child at 15 years old and her second child two years later. Her greatest struggle is working to provide her seven-year-old daughter Tatiana with a bright future; Tatiana is severely handicapped and was born with paralysis. Alexandra lives with her children, her 55-year-old mother Elva, and her 30-year-old husband Richard. 

Alexandra lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants, but you'd never guess the size of the city from its tranquil pace of life and easy-going inhabitants. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets, and its trade in livestock--the largest in the country.

This is Alexandra's first Kiva loan. She will use it to buy more chickens and feed. Alexandra works eight hours a day, with help from her mother Elva, and she uses her spare time to sell other products.

Her dream is to own her own home, and for one day to see her daughter walk. She hopes her Kiva loan will help her increase her income, so she can gain access to more expensive medical treatments for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and lives in Blancia Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has 7 children. 

Elizabeth operates a barbeque stand, earning a monthly income of about PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pork and sauce ingredients for her barbecue business. In the future, Elizabeth hopes that she can earn more money from her business so that she can provide for her family's financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase pork and sauce ingredients for her barbecue business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy apples, watermelons, red mombins , pipianes, chayotes, pumpkins and cassava.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он арендует помещение, где занимается ремонтом телефонов и dvd. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки запасных частей.
texts.en: Ismoil lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 46 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Ismoil leases a space, where he repairs telephones and DVD players.  He has been involved in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahraa is a 21-year-old married woman living with her husband and one young child. She is from Lebanon. In 2008, she started running her own business working as a beautician receiving clients at her home. Her income is very important; she is supportive for her husband. Zahraa's story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges the Lebanese women are facing in running a business and at the same time raising children and taking care of their houses. Today, she is requesting to borrow 1,500 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laser machine for hair removal. In the future, Zahraa is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a laser machine for hair removal

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janet is 34 years old. Two of her children are in school.

Janet has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Janet requested a 19,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Janet has been in this business for five years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gonzalo; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes y también el socio trabaja como ayudante de una empresa de transporte, el socio el negocio de venta de juguetes lo realiza en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes y mejorar en su trabajo de la empresa de transporte.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes como muñecas y carros al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sr. Gonzalo.  He is 32 years old and single.  He spends his days working in his business selling toys.  He also works as an assistant for a transportation company.  Sr. Gonzalo sells his toys from a street stand, and from that income he is able to help his children get ahead.  He wants to expand his toy selling business and to improve in his work at the transportation company.  He is requesting the loan in order to purchase wholesale toys, such as dolls and toy cars.

Sr. Gonzalo is happy about the loan and promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale toys, such as dolls and toy cars.

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Naby est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de quinze de femmes qui habitent le même quartier,elles sont voisines.Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Boury est âgée de 41 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants ; elle mène une activité de restauration, elle a une bonne expérience de plus de trois ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou orange-vert avec un châle vert et a levé la main droite.

Elle s'approvisionne au marché central et revend sur place où elle a un restaurant.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter du riz, huile,sucre, lait, des condiments et autres produits pour le petit déjeuner en grande quantité afin de se faire plus de revenus à la vente.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille pour la scolarité, la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The Sop Naby group was created August 28, 2009. It is made up of fifteen women who live in the same neighborhood; they are neighbors. Small trade is their main activity.

The leader, Mrs. Boury, is a 41-year-old mother of five. She is in food service, in which she has more than three years of experience. She is standing at the right of the picture wearing an orange-green boubou with a green shawl and raising her right hand. 

She stocks up at the central market and resells at her restaurant.

She would like to use her loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, condiments, and other products for breakfast in bulk in order to be able to make more money when she sells it.

She plans to use her earnings to help her husband with the family expenses, including for school, health expenses, and food.

loans.use: to buy food products for food service

loans.name: Ibeth

texts.es: La señorita Ibeth vive en casa de sus padres los cuales tienen un anticrético en la zona de Villa Israel;  Ibeth se dedica a la venta de artículos para bebes,  la misma vende hace 2 años en el mismo puesto ubicado en un lugar estratégico, toda su familia se dedica al mismo negocio, en distintas tiendas, ella vende para poder estudiar en el futuro, ya que lo su sueño es terminar una carrera universitaria y poder ejercer su profesión, este dinero lo necesita para poder incrementar capital de trabajo con la compra de artículos para bebes al por mayor por las fiestas de fin de año, Ibeth es una persona joven con ganas de superación, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ibeth lives with her parents, who have an anticrético (pre-paid rental contract) house in the Villa Israel area. Ibeth sells products for babies, and she has been doing this for two years in a strategic location. Her whole family works in the same business at several stores.

Ibeth sells these products so she can study in the future, since her dream is to finish a university degree and have a career. She needs the money to increase her working capital by buying products for babies wholesale during the end of the year celebrations.

Ibeth is a young person who dreams of excelling. She is grateful for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: to purchase baby products wholesale.

loans.name: Zarina Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Zarina ramzan is a 36 year-old female. She is married and has 3 children who are 10, 7 and 2 years old. To make a living, Zarina performs the duty of a health worker in her community. She gives health awareness to ladies and solves their health problems.   
Her husband owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop. He sells chicken meat specifically to his clients. His fresh quality meat and good in weight helps attracting more clientage to his shop. Although, he hasn’t enough experience in his business but his dedication and hard working skills enable him to make good place among his clients and market. 

Zarina is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah which will be used to invest in expanding her husband’s business by purchasing chickens in bulk. 

Zarina is hopeful that the increased numbers of chickens will help her husband completing the orders on time and generates more revenue.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zarina ramzan”.

loans.use: To buy chickens for chicken meat selling business

loans.name: Alicia Felipa

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca”  ubicado en la provincia de Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. La señora estudió educación secundaria.

La señora Alicia es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio de venta de ají.
Con este dinero comprará un quintal de ají, el cual lo vende molido y entero.  Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo se dedica a la venta de ceviche (plato típico de Perú).

La señora desea tener una empresa de venta al por mayor de ají molido.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kapia Marca” which is located in Yunguyo Province in the Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Sra. Alicia received her high school education.

She is a new member who recently joined Manuela Ramos. Alicia is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN and will use the money to increase her business capital for selling “ají” peppers. With this money, she plans to buy a “quintal” (1 quintal = 46 kg) of ají peppers, which she will sell ground and whole. Alicia works alone in her business. Her husband sells “ceviche” (a traditional Peruvian seafood dish).

Sra. Alicia wants to have a business where she can sell ground ají peppers in bulk. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to buy ají peppers.

loans.name: Mas Que Vencedores Group

texts.es:
La señora SONIA FLOR de 46 años de edad madre soltera con 03 hijo el  menor de edad  de 15 años en etapa escolar mujer emprendedora y  luchadora, con ánimos de salir adelante.  Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Mas Que Vencedores”.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de Calzados para niño y adultos a base de materia prima de cuero su stand está localizado en el mercado de la localidad. El préstamo solicito para la compra de calzados y botines de material de cuero para niños y adultos. 
Desea en el futuro comprar otra galería comercial para la venta de calzados. Viste con polo color blanco y casaca color negro ubicada la primera persona lado derecha.
texts.en:
Sonia Flor, 46, is a single mother with three children.  The youngest is 15 years old and in school.  She is an enterprising woman, a fighter with the goal of getting ahead.  She is a member of Más Que Vencedores Communal Bank.  Currently she works selling shoes in her shopping center.

She requested the loan to buy leather shoes and boots for children and adults.  In this way she can invest in her business and save.  She wants to buy another shopping mall in the future for shoe sales.

She is wearing a white polo shirt and black jacket, the first person on the right side.

loans.use: to sell leather shoes and boots.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La señora Angélica es una mujer muy trabajadora que como toda la gente comienza desde abajo para poder vivir cómodamente,  cuenta que hace años trabajaba para una farmacia recibiendo un salario mínimo y que algunas ocasiones se quedaba sin su salario con tal de pagar el terreno de su casa y para construirla realizaba tandas. Para poder tener un ingreso más alto a pesar de que no tenía la preparación académica llego hacer coordinadora de una empresa que ofrece sus artículos por catalogó aproximadamente unos 20 años. Para Angélica este trabajo fue muy pesado pero le gustaba realizarlo con entusiasmo, en este momento dejo trabajar para alguien para iniciar su propio proyecto de vida y coloco una tienda de abarrotes y librería en su misma casa; donde ella pudiera atenderla y ser dueña. Este negocio será su fuente de ingresos por que comenta que ya no tiene la juventud y energía que tenía hace años, por tal motivo quiere comprar abarrotes, lácteos, tortillas, refrescos, biblias, casetes para que su negocio se encuentre abastecido de mercancía.
texts.en:
Angélica is a very hard-working woman who, like all people, worked her way up towards being able to live comfortably.  She says that, years ago, she used to work in a pharmacy, receiving the minimum wage and that sometimes she didn't receive her salary.  In order to buy land and build her house, she worked shifts.  In order to make better income, in spite of the fact that she didn't have the necessary education, she became a coordinator for a company that sells catalog products.  This was approximately 20 years ago.  That work was very difficult for Angélica but she liked to do it with enthusiasm.

Angélica stopped working for other people and decided to start her own life project.  She set up a grocery store and bookstore in her own home where she would be able to work and own her own business.  This business is her source of income as she says that she no longer has the youth and energy that she used to have years ago.  She would like to buy groceries, dairy products, tortillas, soft drinks, Bibles and cassettes so that her business is stocked with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy goods, Bibles, etc.

loans.name: Geremias

texts.es: Geremias tiene 31 años, convive con flor de 30 años, fruto de este amor nacieron flor de 9 años y Kenji de 5 años de edad. Juntos habitan en el distrito de Pichari. Geremias, es un hombre trabajador que día a día se  sacrifica en el campo con el deseo de salir adelante, ver a sus hijos surgir para que mañana sean buenos profesionales y útil a la sociedad. Casi todo el tiempo siempre a trabajado en la agricultura, cultivando y extrayendo café. Pero como es un trabajo que requier de manos, necesariamente debe contratar peones para la temporada de cosecha así como de siembra. Una vez cosechado los granos de café, Geremias sin dificultad los acopia por sacos y esperar a que vengan los compradores que en su mayoría son colectores mayorista. Geremias está feliz con esta labor que realiza por que gracias a ello construyó su vivienda donde ahora vive feliz junto a su adorada esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles realizará la limpieza de maleza de sus sembríos de café, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Geremias is 31 years old and lives with Flor, aged 30. The fruits of their love are Flor, aged 9, and Kenji, aged 5. They live together in the district of Pichari. Geremias is a hard-working man who day in, day out toils in the field with the desire to succeed and see his children progress and in the future become good professionals and useful members of society.

Geremias has nearly always been working in agriculture, cultivating and harvesting coffee. Since this is a labor-intensive activity, he must necessarily hire farm workers for the harvesting and planting season. Once the coffee beans are harvested, Geremias stockpiles them in sacks and waits until buyers, mostly wholesalers, turn up. Geremias is happy with this work. It enabled him to build his dwelling where he lives now with his beloved wife and their two young children.

This is his first loan with the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma. He promises to pay it off according to the repayment schedule. He will use the 1500 new soles to hire laborers to weed his coffee field.

loans.use: to hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Marjory

texts.es: Marjory, de 28 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 7 años. Juntas viven en casa de sus padres, junto a ellos. Trabaja mucho para así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Marjory consiste en el corte y confección de prendas intimas, específicamente de lencería fina, además de tener este negocio, también trabaja en una ONG en donde ejerce su profesión de administradora. En tanto su trabajo de costura lo hace en su casa y solo trabaja a pedidos, asimismo su madre la apoya en esta actividad. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues significa para ella un ingreso adicional y así puede tener mucho mejor a su hija. Lleva realizando su trabajo en costura desde hace tres años, aprendió desde muy joven, pues su madre quien es la que le guía todos los días en su negocio, ahora esta preparándose para armar su campaña escolar y necesita materiales para poder tener todo listo el siguiente mes. Este será el préstamo número 16 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, además ella se compromete a ser puntual, ya que no desea quedar mal con el lindo grupo al que pertenece y al cual desea pertenecer por mucho mas tiempo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su costura, además de dar mantenimiento a algunas maquinas que necesitan ser refaccionadas.
texts.en:
Marjory, 28, is a friendly, good and very hardworking woman. She is a single mother and has a seven-year-old daughter. Together they live with her parents in her parents' home. She works hard to be able to give her daughter a better quality of life. Marjory's work consists of cutting and assembling intimate apparel, specifically fine lingerie. In addition to having this business she also works at an NGO where she fulfills her professional duties as administrator. With regards to her work making apparel she does it at home and only does special orders; her mother supports her in this business. She enjoys her work a lot since it means additional income for her and thus she can do a lot better by her daughter. She has been making apparel for three years and learned it at a very early age, since her mother is the one who guides her every day in her business. Now she is getting ready to begin her school career and needs materials in order to have everything ready for the coming month. 

This will be her 16th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing she has financial support, since it helps her feel more confident about advancing in her business. She also promises to be punctual since she does not wish to end up on bad terms with the lovely group to which she belongs and to which she hopes to belong for a long time. 

With the requested sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will purchase materials to continue making lingerie, in addition to doing maintenance on some machines which need refurbishing.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and fix her sewing machines.

loans.name: Grecia Gabrielle

texts.es:
Grecia es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, en la cual se encuentra playas hermosas, sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, entre otros.  Desde muy pequeña aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tenía la necesidad de apoyarlos; debido a ello Grecia solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Grecia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y lencería para damas, caballeros y niños, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos a precios cómodos y de buena calidad.

Grecia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como polos, ropa interior, entre otros para poder abastecer su negocio para la temporada de verano, así podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y podrá mejorar su ingresos; lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Grecia, 20, is a young woman who lives in the city of Camaná, a place with beautiful beaches and a main occupation of farming, especially of crops such as rice, beans and others.  From a very early age, Grecia learned to work hard to earn a living because her parents had scarce resources and she wanted to help them.  She could only study as far as the fifth level of secondary school, but would have liked to go to the university.

Every day Grecia works selling women's, men's and children's clothing and underwear, spending about ten hours a day attending to up to some 20 customers.  She believes business is going well because she is kind to her customers and, mainly, offers low prices and good quality.

Grecia is very grateful to Kiva lenders who have helped her buy merchandise for her business, such as polo shirts, underwear and other items for the summer season.  This will allow her to offer a wider variety of products and increase her income, giving her continued work so she can reach her goal:  "To have her own shop".

loans.use: To buy clothing for the summer season.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo-Krobo Bukom Group

texts.en:
Eunice, 37 years old, is single parent and has four children. She lives with her children in the Teshi township.

Eunice dedicates her time to household the sale of kenkey and it production, but she also runs a small store of maize,cooking oil and fried fish, which she attends to every day. Thanks to her store, she has been able to help with her household expenses and taking care of her children.

Eunice needs this loan in order to buy corn, cooking oil, firewood and other ingredient for kenkey production to sell. Her dreams are to open a good business and to have her own family well establish.
 She is the group leader of the 'Ekome feemo-krobo bukom Group' of three members.
With her hardworking member they all thank kiva lender for their love and support to their business.

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, firewood and other ingredient for kenkey production to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
A married mother of four children, Ms. Rita A.’s business consists of roadside sales of foodstuffs. Determined in all that she does, she contributes a large amount of the household income because the money her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver, earns is largely insufficient to feed, clothe, educate and take care of their children. Recognizing the seriousness of the situation, Ms. A. dedicates all of her energy to serving her family. She is a tireless woman who works day and night to pull her family out of poverty. To increase her income, she would like to further build her business in order to be able to meet the growing demand for her products.

For this, she is requesting a loan of $600, which will allow her to increase the range of products that she sells. The amount requested will thus serve as the capital to buy and resell her goods. This project deserves to be supported, as it will allow a very poor family to improve its living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame A. Rita a comme activité la vente des denrées alimentaires dans les abords des routes. Déterminée dans tout ce qu’elle fait, elle participe énormément à la gestion du ménage car le revenu de son mari, conducteur de taxi moto, est très insuffisant pour nourrir, habiller, soigner et scolariser les enfants. Consciente de la gravité de la situation, Madame A. met toute son énergie au service de sa famille. Femme infatigable, elle travaille de jour comme de nuit pour réduire la misère dans sa famille. Pour améliorer son revenu, elle souhaite élargir davantage son commerce afin de pouvoir répondre à une plus grande demande qui se présente à elle.

Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de $600 qui va lui permettre d’élargir la gamme de ses produits. Le montant sollicité constituera donc un fonds de commerce pour l’achat, et la revente de ses marchandises. Ce projet mérite d’être soutenu car il permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie d’une famille démunie.

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She was educated to a basic level. She deals in the sale of used clothes and has been in that trade for over 8 years. She sells her wares in the outlaying villages and in her community. Her objective is to buy bales direct from the wholesalers from Accra. This she hopes would impact positively on her business and family life with the KIVA loan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Concepcion Rosario

texts.en:
My name is Concepción Álvarez and I sell groceries. I've been in this business for four years now, and my children help me with my store. People prefer to shop at my store because I have fine quality products at a very good price. My goal is to purchase more products so that I can stock a greater variety and make more sales. With the earnings I want to be able to feed my family and remodel my store.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Concepcion A. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, actividad que realizo hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para atender mi negocio, la gente prefiere comprarme a mi porque tengo muy buenos precios en mis productos ademas que son de buena calidad, mi meta es poder tener mas variedad de productos y asi tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y remodelar mi negocio.

loans.use: purchase lard, rice,oil, bread, margarine, beans, sugar, cheese, butter, fruits, etc...

loans.name: Anye Lawrence

texts.en:
Born in 1972, Anye Lawrence is divorced from his former wife. He had to provide for his three children which was difficult because he had no vocational training and little formal education. This motivated him to become a member of GHAPE where he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, he has taken out and repaid loans. This has allowed him to pay for school fees for his children and buy food for his family.

Given a loan of $600, he plans sell firewood, which is the most common source of energy, and earn money to continue paying for his children’s school fees and to improve his business. He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. His first loan repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and pay for transportation

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is 28 years old and has 3 children. They live on Avenue Buenos Aires in the zone called Tembladerani in the city of La Paz, in the house of her parents. Blanca works selling hats, as well as gifts, in the entrances to the neighborhoods. In addition to this activity, she began to sell flowers in the Rodrigues market. She will use the loan to increase her capital and buy more flowers for this new business.

With her previous history with Impro, (she has been a client since 2005), and her history of making payments, Blanca qualifies for a new loan.

Blanca tiene 28 años de edad y tiene tres hijos con quienes vive en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. Blanca se dedica a la venta de gorras y también vende regalos en las puertas de los locales; además de esta actividad empezó con la venta de flores en el mercado Rodríguez y el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y asi comprar mas flores y mejorar su nuevo negocio. Por su antecedente histórico con Impro (ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005) y su historial de pagos, Blanca puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She will this loan to buy more merchandise and build her business.

loans.name: Flor Rosmery

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor Rosmery is 36 years old and lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, which is in the province of Trujuillo and region of La Libertad. She only studied up to junior year in high school. She has 2 daughers who are dependent on her.

She has a grocery store in her own home but apart from that, she sells hair pins, earrings and accessories at schools nearby her home. Flor, her sister-in-law, and other neighbors formed a group called "La Pérbola". With her first loan of $100, she bought corn, sugar, salt, noodles, hygiene products and other basic goods to assemble her little store.

The recent loan of $200 from Manuela Ramos will be paid off in 4 months. It will be used to buy merchandise for the store inventory as well as cosmetics to sell together with her accessories. Flor dreams of having a larger store to move forward in life with her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flor Rosmery tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad. Estudió solo hasta el tercer año de secundaria; tiene 2 hijas los cuales aun dependen de ella. Tiene un negocio de abarrotes en su propia casa, pero a parte vende ganchos para cabello y aretes (accesorios) en las puertas de los colegios cerca de su casa. La señora Flor, junto con su cuñada y otras vecinas, formaron el Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Pérbola”. Con el primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/ 300 soles ($100) compró arroz, azúcar, sal, fideos, papel higiénico y otros productos de primera necesidad para armar una pequeña bodega. El Reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.600.00 (aproximadamente $200) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, le servirá para invertir en la compra de abarrotes y también cosméticos que quiere empezar a vender junto con los ganchos y aretes. La señora Flor sueña con tener un negocio más grande para poder sacar adelante a sus hijas.

loans.use: To buy a variety of grocery products as well as cosmetics and accessories for women

loans.name: Nhek

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Nhek, 44, is a widow with one son, Mr. Soung Phois (age 25, shown photo with his mother). Nhek and her son live in a small house about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of selling sweets in front of her house. She sells many kinds of Cambodian sweets and sells from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. Her son is growing rice and helping her make sweets for selling. She hopes to save some money from her profit for her son to raise pigs and produce rice wine for selling.

Nhek is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan for expanding her business of selling sweets.

loans.use: For expanding her sweets selling and for growing rice

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old and is married with 2 children (ages 22 and 19). She owns a shop where she sells general items. She began this business in 2003 and works there from 6am to 7pm daily. In a month, the shop brings her about $170 in profit.

Jane has taken a loan in the past to buy more stock for her shop. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She is a member of a loan group called Tujiheshimu.

loans.use: To buy items for shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana has dedicated herself to selling carbonated beverages for many years. At 67 years of age, she’s a strong and capable entrepreneurial woman. She is the mother of 5 children that are all professionals with their own families. Now she enjoys the company of her dear husband in their humble aboD.. Together they would like to get ahead and succeed selling carbonated beverages and expand their business to sell groceries. For Mrs. Juana everything is possible and this is the reason she’s asking for your help to start expanding her business soon. Juana needs the help of your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Juana se dedica a la venta D. bebidas gasificadas desD. hace mucho tiempo, ella a sus 67 años D. edad se muestra como una mujer fuerte y muy decidida en el ámbito comercial, es madre D. 05 hijos los mismos que ya son profesionales y han conformado sus propias familias, quedando sola gozando D. la compañía D. su querido esposo en su humilD. morada. Juntos quieren salir adelante y tener éxito con la venta D. bebidas gasificadas y también quieren implementar su negocio con la venta D. abarrotes.Para la señora Juana no todo es posible y por esa razón recurre en búsqueda D. tu ayuda para cumplir su propósito dentro D. poco tiempo.Juana necesita la ayuda desinteresada D. tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To start her business.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr:
A widow and mother of three children, Mrs. Alphonsine G. was born around 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been a retailer of fabric, purses, and shoes for the last five years. Reliable and of high moral standard, she is seeking her fourth loan. Her monthly sales are around 500,000 francs while customer demand is around 1,000,000 francs. She is seeking this loan to supplement her assets and stock in order to respond to customer demand.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve et mère de 3 enfants, dame G. Alphonsine est née vers les années 1979 à COTONOU, capitale économique du BENIN. Elle est une revendeuse de pagne, de sacs et de chaussures depuis plus de 5 ans. De bonne moralité, elle est à son quatrième crédit. Son chiffre d’affaire mensuel est estimé à environ 500 000 francs alors que la demande de sa clientèle est estimée à 1 000 000 de nos francs. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour compléter son avoir et s’approvisionner afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 15 bolts of fabric and 20 women's purses.

loans.name: Marianeri

texts.en:
Marianeri, mother of one son, is a young and budding entrepreneur who strives to improve her family’s living conditions. 
To make a living, she sells iron and other metals in the low-income Casabe community of Santo Domingo. Shortly after her child’s birth, Marianeri had to stop her studies in order to fend for her child. The entrepreneur explains that she’d like to continue her studies, and she says if her income increases in the next month, she’ll pay someone to look after her son in the afternoon so that she can go back to school.  With her loan, Marianeri will buy more metals in order to increase her sales volume, and thus her revenue.

loans.use: To buy metals to resell in her community.

loans.name: Darlyng Jeaneth

texts.es:
Mts. Darlyng is married, is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood Casimiro Sotelo, has three children of 11, 8,and 3 years of age. Her husband works as a security guard and provides the income of the home. Mrs. Darlyng works as a cashier in a restaurant and has three years of experience. She is requesting the loan to improve her home. She would like to build a wall in the front of the house for more security. The goals of her family are to provide for the education and support of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Darlyng es casada, tiene 33 años de edad y habita en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo, tiene tres hijos con 11,8 y 3 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como vigilante y aporta en la economía del hogar. La sra Darlyng trabaja como cajera en un restaurante y tiene cuatro años de experiencia. El préstamo lo solicita para mejoras de su vivienda quiere construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa para mayor seguridad. Los planes de su familia es proveer la educación y economía a sus hijos.

loans.use: Build a wall in the front of the house of residence.

loans.name: Gamza
