texts.en: Gamza (her husband is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  Gamza and her husband settled in Baku city, Bina settlement. She was born in 1965. Her husband has been in the taxi business for 18 years. Now they  need a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts for their taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for taxi.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two children. Five years ago she started her retail business selling clothing and footwear in one of the local markets in Berdyansk. High sales rates, loyal customers, and a convenient location for her vending kiosk all contributed to good performance. Natalya admits lending services from "Nadiya Ukraine" have benefited her a lot in this area of business. 

Today, Natalya has about $2400 of working capital. She has proven to be a hard-working, dedicated entrepreneur and runs her business with integrity and innovation. She doesn't hesitate when taking risks, which has helped her to succeed despite serious competition in the market. Natalya is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices to sell in her vending location. This loan will help her expand her business and will have a positive impact on her trade profitability, helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Shealan

texts.en: Shealan, 31 years old and single, lives in Baalbek, located in the Bekaa valley. Shealan is the owner of a pastry shop. He always looks for a way to improve his business and therefore has been able to grow a good base of loyal customers. The loan he is asking for, USD 1000, is to purchase raw materials and thereby diversify his inventory of goods. This is the first time that Shealan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to diversify the inventory of goods presented in the pastry shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a 55-year-old divorced mother of 5 children. She is really industrious and she works with the motivation of supporting her children's education to provide them with better life opportunities in the future. At the moment, 3 of her children have successfully completed senior high school.

She also sells plantains, beans, and yams in the community market. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and yams to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral to access loans and use peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more plantains, beans, and yams

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim J.. Ibrahim is 27 years of age, married with one child who is in primary school. Ibrahim was born in a village called Doguliya about a mile from Kabala. His wife is a business woman who sells cooked rice. Ibrahim has been in the cattle business for the past 3 years now.

This is the first loan Ibrahim is seeking from SMT. He is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00 to enable him to buy more cattle. He buys the cattle from Doguliya and other villages surrounding Kabala. The price per cattle varies depending on the size of the cattle. Prices range from Le 70,000.00 to 100,000.00. He then sells cattle in Kabala for prices ranging from Le 80,000 to 110,000.00. Ibrahim's immediate goal is to build a house, manage his resources well, and invest in the education of his children.

loans.use: Ibrahim would like to buy more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Habitante du village de Téné, les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames dans la préfecture de San(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des relations de parenté, de voisinage et professionnel, ces femmes font à majorité l’achat et la vente de céréales. Une seule fait le métier de tailleur en plus de son commerce de céréales.
Les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100.000 FCFA pour le quatrième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de céréales (fonio haricot, petit mil, maïs etc.)dans les différentes foires des villages environnants auprès des producteurs et quelques fois sur place à Téné. Elles revendent ces produits aux commerçants venant des grandes villes telles que San, Koutiala, Bla, Ségou et Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) généralement au comptant, en détail, en gros et à crédit. 
En raison de la rotation rapide et de la marge bénéficiaire importante, les femmes comptent réaliser en moyenne 100 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Residents of the village of Téné, the members of the group Benkadi are married women averaging 42 years of age and five children. They live in polygamous families in San Prefecture (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by ties of kinship, community, and profession, these women mainly do buying and selling of grain. One of them is a seamstress by trade in addition to her commerce in grain. The group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. The loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 100,000 francs for the fourth loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The current loan will be used to buy sacks of grain (fonio, beans, pearl millet, corn, etc.) in different markets in surrounding villages from producers and sometimes locally in Téné. They sell these products to merchants from big cities, such as San, Koutiala, Bla, Ségou, and Bamako (capital of Mali), and generally in cash at the retail level and on credit at the wholesale level. Due to the high turnover and sizable profit margins, the women intent to realize an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per cycle that will serve to cover the loan interest and to cope with typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods to resell them

loans.name: Delia Patricia

texts.es:
Delia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. A pesar que su esposo trabaja en la Región Ancash, menciona que le hace falta el trabajo, porque junto a su esposo desean independizarse. Actualmente viven en la casa de los padres de ella, en la Av. Manco Cápac. 133, donde también es su lugar de venta. Vede ropa que trae desde la ciudad de Lima y Trujillo para distribuir a pedido a sus clientes. A pesar que menciona que su vida transcurre tranquilamente, comenta que su dificultad es que sus clientes a veces no pagan a tiempo o no le pagan los productos que ella les brinda a crédito.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir y para el viaje y fiesta de promoción de su hijo.
 
Delia comenta que le gustaría recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” communal bank, located in the district and province of Huaraz, in the department of Ancash. She is 42 years old, and is married with 3 children. Although her husband works in the Ancash area, she says that work has been slow, and that both she and her husband would like to become independent. The currently live in a house that belongs to Delia's parents, on Manco Capac avenue, number 133, where they also maintain their sales area. They offer clothing for sale, which they bring from the cities of Lima and Trujillo to sell on order to customers. Although she says they have a calm life, she mentions that the hardest thing is that sometimes customers do not pay on time, or they do not pay for products that she sells them on credit. With this 1,200 sol loan, which she will repay in 5 payments, Delia will invest in the purchase of clothing, and in payment for a trip and party for her son. Delia says that she enjoys receiving training to improve her business and personal life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing purchase

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
El señor Joaquín González Matinez vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
El señor Joaquín trabaja como costurero en su taller, elaborando buzos deportivos que comercializa a los comerciantes minoristas de La Paz.
Requiere el crédito para el incremento de capital ya que la compra de tela en poca cantidad le significa un costo mayor de producción y sus ganancias se minimizan.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Joaquín González Matinez lives with his son in his parents' house in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. Joaquin makes athletic clothing in his workshop, which he then sells to retailers in La Paz. Joaquin needs this loan for working capital, since when he buys fabric in small quantities his production costs increase and his profits decrease.

This is the fifth time Joaquin has requested a loan from IMPRO, and he has received a good credit score following a socioeconomic analysis, so he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric in bulk

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi H. est coiffeuse de profession et exerce son métier à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, agée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Pour rendre son activité plus professionnelle et rendre des services de qualité, Akuvi espère financer cette première. Elle souhaite acquérir 2 séchoirs et parallèlement à ceci acheter des mèches et des produits de beauté pour la revente
texts.en:
Akuvi H. is a hairdresser by trade and works in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two. To professionalize her work further and provide quality service, she is hoping for this initial financing and would like to acquire two hair dryers and, concurrently, to buy hair extensions and beauty products for resale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire two hair dryers

loans.name: Ernestina Lydia

texts.es:
La señora Lydia es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el barrio Porvenir – Miraflores, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 meses; se dedica a la venta de productos ocasionales (ollas, utensilios de cocina, verduras, pan, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual incremento su capital y pudo adquirir mercadería (ollas y verduras). 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1300.00 nuevos soles, monto que pagará en 5 cuotas por mes; podrá incrementar su capital aun mas, e invertir en la compra de accesorios de cocina y frutas (sandía, uvas y papayas), con las ganancias espera ayudar a sus hijos en su educación y poder construir su casa en la ciudad de Puno; para sus hijos.
Ella esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por brindarle este apoyo en bien de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lydia is a member of the "03 de Mayo” Communal Bank, in the Porvenir-Miraflores neighborhood, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the Puno area. She is 47-years-old and in a common law marriage. She has 6 children and finished three years of secondary school studies. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 months. She sells occasional products (pots, kitchen utensils, vegetables, bread, etc.). Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, with which she grew her capital and was able to acquire merchandise (pots and vegetables). With this loan of 1300 nuevos soles, she agrees that she will pay in 5 monthly payments. She will be able to increase her capital even more and invest in the purchase of kitchen accessories and fruits (watermelon, grapes and papayas). With the earnings, she hopes to help her children with their education and be able to build a house in the city of Puno for her children. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her support to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen accessories and fruits (watermelon, grapes and papayas), with the earnings she hopes to help her children with their education and be able to build her house in the city of Puno for her children.

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Ream R. is 29 years old and sells vegetables and fruits in the Battambang province. Her business has been around for about nine years and she makes $5 every day. Her husband is a promotions staff member and makes $3 per day.

Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to make two investments. She would like to both purchase a motorbike to transport fruits, and also put $500 into her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruits to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and a motorbike

loans.name: Grupo Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Arco Iris está compuesto por tres mujeres trabajadoras, originaria de la comarca Las Flores perteneciente al departamento de Masaya, empezaron a obtener crédito con Adim a través de referencias con clientas de la institución que les dijeron que se prestaba con fianza solidaria por no tener garantías.

Doña Flor de los Santos L. es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, vende en el mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, ella vende ambulante porque ofrece a los visitantes ropa menor y no muy cara, ejemplo: calcetines y ropa interior de mujer. Trabaja todos los días menos el día Domingo, este día lo comparte con su familia.
Tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos le ayuda algunos días a vender, le está enseñando el negocio para que tenga un oficio pero su deseo es que termine sus estudios y pueda tener una vida diferente a la de ella, es madre soltera y le ha tocado muy duro el criar a sus hijos sola..Una de sus metas es mejorar su casa, está convencida que esto lo logrará cuando su negocio crezca y le de mejores ganancias. Expresa que ha aprendido a controlar mejor su negocio y está clara que es una empresaria. Aún pretende algún día no tener que hacer los oficios domésticos y dedicarse más a su negocio y brindar un empleo a otra mujer.
texts.en:
The Arco Iris (Rainbow) group is made up of 3 working women from the Las Flores region in the Masaya department. The began taking loans through Adim through referrals from customers who told them that the could obtain a loan without collateral. Ms Flor de los Santos Lopez is the group coordinator. She has a business selling clothing in the Roberto Huembes de Managua market. She works as a roving vendor, selling customers affordable clothing, including stockings and women's undergarments. She works every day but Sunday, which is the day that she shares with her family. Flor has two children, one of whom helps her to sell from time to time. She is teaching him the business so that he can have a trade, but her desire is that he finish school so that he can have a life different than her own. As a single mother, she has raised her children with much hardship. One of her goals is to improve her home, and she is convinced that she can do it once her business grows and gives her greater profit. She has said that she has learned to better control her business, and that she is a business woman. She hopes to one day be able to leave behind the domestic chores in order to give more time to her business and offer work to another woman.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua W. is married with 2 children and works as a trader in Yamoransa near Cape Coast.  Since 2003 she has sold kenkey, gari and abode, a type of food made out of corn and sugar.  While Efua works as a trader, her husband is employed as a driver.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more maize which she will use to prepare kenkey and abodoe for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save more money and further increase her capital.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more maize which she will use to prepare kenkey and abodoe for sale.

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: Chioma is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. She sells kerosene, both wholesale and retail, to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 140,000 ($950 US) to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Edickson

texts.en:
Edickson operates a passenger tricycle in his village. He has been in business for two years and it provides family a good standard of living. He is again requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be used in the maintenance of his passenger tricycle and to invest in another livelihood. He hopes he can obtain the loan because his tricycle’s wheels need to be replaced. He also would like to obtain a permit for his motorcycle so that there would be no problem anymore when it comes to transportation laws. 

Edickson is 23 years old and is a resident of Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela. He has a family with two kids. Edilyn is his eldest child, he is two years old, his youngest child is Patricia and she is four months old. The mother of his children is Belinda La Puebla, they have been together since they had their first child. Unfortunately he has not been able to marry her yet due to financial problems. They have plan to get married when they have sufficient savings.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Julia Alejandra

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí.
Julia es soltera, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Julia tiene un puesto alquilado en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada. Además Julia vende artesanías por mayor a comerciantes en la ciudad de Lima, las piezas de artesanía lo compra de los productores.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de artesanías en piedra de Huamanga.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una casa propia, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal Capulí. Julia is single, 39 years old and has two children. Julia has a rented stand at the market called “The 12th of April” where she sells various types of clothes. Julia also sells handcrafts wholesale to vendors in the city of Lima. The handcrafts she buys directly from the makers. Julia needs a loan of 1400 Peruvian Soles that she will invest in stone handcrafts from Huamanga region of Peru. Julia dreams of owning her own home, improving her business and offering a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone handcrafts from Humanga, Peru.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es: Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Ivania del Carmen F. González, Antonia de los Santos
texts.en: Photo, left to right:  Ivania del Carmen F. González, Antonia de los Santos

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda tiene 45 años, vive con su pareja quien es profesor y sus 3 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos aún estudiantes y el mayor soltero y trabaja. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a confeccionar ropa sólo para niños y niñas, labor que realiza en su propia casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes regulares tienen mucha confianza hacia su buena labor y la recomiendan con otras personas, por lo que le es rentable. Adicionalmente y aprovechando que su vivienda se encuentra en una zona bastante transitada, por las noches vende comida en la parte de afuera de su casa, negocio con el cual también obtiene buenas ganancias. Posteriormente, Gilda quiere alquilar un local para implementar una tienda de ropa. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son cumplidos con sus cuotas y muy solidarios. Con el dinero que solicita comprará telas, hilos, cierres y demás material textil que le servirá para confeccionar ropa y llevarla a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona.
texts.en:
Gilda is 45. She lives with her significant other, a professor, and their three children. Two of them are students, and the oldest is single and works. She has been making clothes for boys and girls for eighteen years. She works in her own house. What she likes about her work is that her regular customers have a lot of confidence in her good work, and they recommend her to other people. That is very profitable. Also, she takes advantage of the fact that her house is in a well traveled area, and in the evenings she sells food in front of her house. She also gets good income from this business. Later, Gilda wants to rent a location to set up a clothing store. This is her eighth loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of her colleagues make their payments, and they are very unified. She will use the money she is asking for to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other textile materials to make clothes. She will take them to sell at different places in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Van, age 57, and her husband, Mr. Ban Om, age 64, have been married since 1976 and have two daughters and two sons. Three of their children are married and live outside the family house; the other one weaves silk at home. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

T. learned to weave silk from her parents in 1966 and started her silk production in the same year. She sells her finished product to a middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell at Phnom Penh market. Her husband grows rice and food crops in the village. Besides farming, he is a chef as well. They are in their late 50’s and 60‘s but still strong enough to work.

T. is asking for a loan of $400 in order to purchase silk materials for continuing her business and she hopes to use a part of her loan to help repair her daughter’s house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her business and to help repair her daughter’s house

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 41 year old trader. She is married with two children. One child is currently in school whiles her last born is still under breasting. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials and has been in this business for the last eight years. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to scale up the business. She has amazed lots of marketing experience and she very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials with variety to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide for her kids with quality education to make them more resourceful in future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Toshpulatova

texts.ru: Тошпулатова Обида проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 52 года. Вдова, имеет 3 детей. Сын также работает и помогает матери. Сама Обида более 8 лет  занимается торговлей, т.е. бизнесом. Она в основном торгует продуктами питания, которые закупает в городе а потом у себя продает подороже. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
O. Toshpulatova lives in the Tursun-zodf region. She is 52, a widow, and has 3 children. Her son also works and helps her. O. has been in sales for the past 8 years. Mainly, she sells food, which she purchases in the city and then resells at higher prices. She is asking for additional funding to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena D. is from the village of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Elena owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to expand the shelter for her pigs. Elena is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase medication for her pigs. This loan will be her 7th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medication for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Farming and the vending of vegetables is what Maria Elena is busy with. She is 37 years of age and married to Saturnino S.. They have been blessed with seven children: Ronald - 16 years old, who is a van driver's assistant; Roldan - 15 years old, a high school student; Romel - 13 years old who is in 2nd year high school; Romar - 12 years old, a grade six pupil; Reinz - 9 years old, who is in grade-III; Michelle - 7 years of age, a grade-II pupil; and Julius Andrie - 3 years old. Though she has a large number of family members, still she is thankful to our Almighty God for the continuous support to be able to provide for the needs for her family.

Maria Elena also manages a vegetable garden and she wants to maintain it to increase the vegetables that she harvests from her garden. Maria Elena is asking Kiva lenders for PHP 5,000 as additional capital. She is hoping that she will be able to obtain the loan so that she can buy some fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel L. is from the village of P-3, Pugaan, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Ritchel is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Ritchel sells a variety of products in the local community. Ritchel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In Oct. 2009, Ritchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritchel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ritchel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale

location.town: P-3, Pugaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
At the age of 40, Leticia has been engaged in a livestock business, specifically raising ducks, for almost two years. Wanting to expand her business into a hog raising business, she has decided to borrow a PHP 7,000 loan from KIVA lenders. She will use the funds to buy hogs, as well as additional ducks, to raise. Her net monthly income in the duck raising business is PHP 1,000, which is very essential for their daily needs. She wants to expand her business to produce more income. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan.

Leticia is married to Jimmy A., who works as a carpenter in their village. Their marriage had been blessed with two children: Jake Anthony, four years old, and Christian Jay, three years old. The family resides in the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural and plain area. She wants her children to have a better future, that's why Leticia and her husband work hard to support their family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her duck raising  and for business expansion.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 56 years old. Virginia is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana sells medicines, cosmetics and wine in her stall. She has been in this business for a long time. With this combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members. Juliana lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is happily married. She is 46 years old and has 6 children. Five of her children are in the university and colleges while the youngest child is in secondary school. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.  She is requesting for a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more medicines, cosmetics and wine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines, wine and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy S. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 26 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mary Joy owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mary Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. est une dame de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine  et de la vente de crème glacée. Ce prêt lui permettre d’augmenter son capital et de plus participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady D., age 52, is married and the mother of four children. She raises cattle and sells ice cream. This loan will enable her to bolster her working capital, and to help her improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her businesses (raising cattle and selling ice cream)

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La Sra.Violeta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y 02 hijos, que aun  depende de ella y están estudiando.

Violeta, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace varios años atrás, donde poco a poco fue implementando su negocio. Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños y seguir adelante la motivaron a establecer su negocio, ubicado en su misma casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, fideos en paquetes, galletas de diferentes sabores, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Violeta, se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando, está muy agradecida y a la vez contenta con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse como empresarias.
texts.en:
Senora Violeta belongs to the communal bank "Los Eucaliptos", district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín. She is married, 28, with 2 children in school. Violeta has been selling groceries for the last few years, and has been increasing her business little by little. Her character and her yearning to fulfill her dreams to get ahead have motivated her to establish this business located in her own home. With this loan of $350, she will buy cases of canned fish of various brands, noodles, various flavors of cookies, various household cleaning utensils, and personal hygiene products in order to continue to give her clients the best service. Violeta is strongly motivated to keep working. She is very grateful and happy with the Maunela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to develop as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish, noodles, cookies etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a printing machine

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en: Ngen S., age 39, is widowed and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has a 15-year-old child. She is ina business of selling Cambodian traditional cakes and rents part of her land to a mobile company to install satellite, earning an income of $5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially her child’s education. She has been with this job since 2005. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the agricultural products. This is her third loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. M. is an internal staff member in a ministry located in the middle of Phnom Penh, and she gets a suitable salary. By doing her job, she is able to cover all the needs of her family. She now has four children. One of them is married and the others are single and work in a garment factory. 

M. has a life partner in her husband, who appears in the picture above. He sells merchandise to students who learn different skills in Korean schools. M. wants a loan for her husband to use as capital in order to improve his trade. This action will provide the family with extra income and improve their standard of life.

loans.use: To improve his merchandise trade.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 58 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos menores hijas y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

El trabajo al que se dedica es el cultivo de papas, maíz y alverjas. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus chacras, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Ella vende sus cultivos en el mercado de la ciudad, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 28 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos la enfermen. Para más adelante, sembrará en todas sus tierras para incrementar su producción.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Lucia con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más insecticidas, ya que desea tener sus terrenos libres de plagas.
texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old and is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with her two younger daughters and what she wants most is to improve their quality of life.

Her business is cultivating potatoes, corn, and peas. Every day early in the morning, she works on her farms, since she knows that the money that she earns from her crop sales will depend greatly on the quality of her products. She sells her crops in the city market, where they pay her the best. What she likes most about her work is harvesting her lands, as she feels that then her months of work pay off. She has been in this business for 28 years and considers the most difficult part to be spraying her lands, as there is always the danger that the chemicals can make her sick. In the future, she will plant more on her lands to increase her production.

This is Lucia’s ninth loan with MFP and the loan money will help her greatly to progress in her work. She is very well-liked by her fellow communal members, as she is very supportive with them. With the 3,000 PEN requested, she will purchase more insecticides, as she wants her lands to be pest-free.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran is a wife of M. Y. and lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 
She is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The younger son is in 12th standard. 
Sardaran has been a seamstress for the past 5 years. She can sew designer and non-designer clothes easily. She has passed on her art to her daughters too and they both help her to finish the clothing orders on time. 
Her husband is a fruit seller. He sells fruit on his four wheel cart by announcing his products in a loud voice. He sells good quality fruits which attracts more customers towards his product. He has been doing this work for the past 25 years. Sardaran is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah, (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase seasonal fruits to expand her husband’s fruit selling business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah Ordillo, 30 years-old is a rice farmer. Her husband is also a farmer. The income she makes from her farm is really helpful in ensuring the supply of food for their family. 

Leah would like to increase her harvest but needs a small amount of money to buy farming necessities such as fertilizers and farm supplies. She is asking for a loan of Php 4,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will lead to an increased harvest.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro C. I. de 63 años de edad reside en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa, quien se dedica a viajar a Los Estado Unidos y traer ropa usada para vender. El señor Pedro se encarga de comercializar dicha ropa, la cual es traída del extranjero, y la cual comercializa en su casa de habitación, contando con la ventaja de que su hogar se encuentra ubicada en calle principal, esto es algo muy bueno sobre todo en los pueblos que son pocas las vía de acceso tanto para las personas como para los automóviles, lo que le da la ventaja de estar a la vista de casi todas las personas que ahí residen.  Pedro posee un negocio muy rentable, ya que ofrece ropa de muy buena calidad a muy buenos precios, así mismo que llama mucho más la atención ya que es traída del extranjero. Pedro solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para que su esposa pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes estilos y tallas. De esta manera tanto el como se esposa esperan mejorar su negocio y así contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Pedro C. I., 63, lives in Usulután department with his wife who travels to the United States to buy used clothing to sell. Pedro sells the aforementioned clothing which comes from abroad; he sells it from home taking advantage of his home’s location along a main street. This is a very good thing especially in towns that have few access roads for people and cars; his being easily accessible to almost all the town’s residents is a real advantage. Pedro has quite a profitable business because he offers high quality clothing at very good prices; it’s highly sought-after because it comes from abroad. Pedro is asking for funds so that he can have enough money so that his wife can buy larger amounts of clothes in a variety of styles and sizes. In this manner, both he and his wife expect to improve their business and have all they need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina O. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 22 years old, is married, and has two infant children.

Cristina owns and operates a business providing trisikad (pedicab) services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 40-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His wife is a subsistence farmer, meaning Charles is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family in terms of the other family requirements. 

Charles runs a retail shop which has been operational for the last six years. From the profit from the shop, Charles has been able to construct a small commercial house and also keep his family afloat. Charles would like to transform his retail shop into a wholesale business like many of his colleagues in the sector of retailing. 

This is his fifth loan from HOFOKAM and he is to use the loan funds to buy sugar, salt, soap, and other domestic items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: buying sugar, soap, and domestic items for resale

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina T. is from the village of San Isidro, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Albina is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Albina owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting and selling flowers in the local community. Albina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Albina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Albina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Albina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Albina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es viuda, vive a lado de sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia. Desde hace más de 25 años elabora bellos bordados artísticos para los trajes típicos de su zona. Trabaja en su misma casa, en ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan, ya que este trabajo demanda tiempo y dedicación. Asimismo cría vacas, a las que la extrae la leche y las vende diariamente, todas estas actividades son su fuente de ingresos  para el sostén familiar. Lo que disfruta en mayor medida es bordar sus trajes típicos, es muy creativa y sabe que puede hacer mucha, es por esta razón que continuará dedicándose a este oficio con miras a mejorar cada vez más su producción y venta. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque sabe que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de materiales para sus bordados.
texts.en:
María is a widow living with her 2 children in a house that she owns. Fro more than 25 years, she has been producing beautiful artistic embroideries for the typical costumes of her area. She works in her house, and sometimes her children help her, as this is a job that requires time and dedication. On top of this she breeds cows. she milks them everyday and then sells the milk. These activity all generate money she uses to face her family’s necessities. What she likes the most is to embroider her typical costumes: she is very creative and she know she is capable of producing man y of them, and for this reason she will keep ion engaging in this activity, aiming to constantly improving her production and her sales. This is her first credit with MFP, and she is very happy to know she can count on financial support; besides, she likes being a member of her communal bank because she knows that all the members are responsible and very caring people. She is also thankful to those people that will manage the loan she is requesting, as this will be very useful to help her make her activity grow. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for her embroideries.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 59 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Fortunata abrió una pequeña tienda en su domicilio, donD. venD. comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. Ya son  30 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La pueden encontrar en su tienda, los 7 días D. la semana, desD. las 5 D. la mañana hasta las 10 D. la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro del pan.   
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Fortunata espera recibir $1000 USD. Por el momento, tiene suficiente mercadería en su puesto. Le gustaría con el dinero del préstamo comprar más comestibles como por ejemplo bolsas D. azúcar, bolsas D. arroz y muchas cosas más para poder abastecer su tienda. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas D. San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos D. funcionamiento, pero Fortunata hace varios años atrás que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 59, lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and four children. Fortunata opened a small store in her home where she sells foodstuffs like: rice, sugar, pasta and many other items. She has been in this business for 30 years and does quite well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work. She can be found tending to her store seven days a week from 5am until 10pm or until her bread supply runs out. Fortunata expects to receive $1000 USD in her next loan. She currently has sufficient stock for her stand but would like to use the funds to buy more food items like sacks of sugar and sacks of rice and many other items with which to stock her store. The “Las Leonas D. San Jerónimo” (San Jerónimo Lionesses) communal bank has been in operation for 10 cycles; Fortunata has been participating for several years and does quite well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like: sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en: Lelita A. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Lelita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lelita operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Lelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is the coordinator of her group, Alfa y Omega 1 & 2 (Alfa and Omega). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to start doing business.

Mayra is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 8 years. She started with a savings of $70, selling vegetables and fruit from a small stall. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying some bags of rice, beans, flour and sugar. 

Her business is a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily meals. Normally those colmados are in the same neighborhood, a short walking distance from any home. She will use the profits to invest in her business, because she wants to have a large food market in the future.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to invest in her business, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity is the free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy bags of  rice, beans, flour and sugar

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy F. is a married woman who lives in Rizal Street, South Poblacio, Naga City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a food vending business, a sari-sari (general) store and an electronic-reloading business. Her husband Sotero F., who is 40 years old, works as an electrician to earn his living. They have five children who are 8 months to 15 years old. 

Analy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Analy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 75,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital to buy stock to sell to continue to save for her children's education and improve their standard of living. Analy F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en: Enhjargal B. is 23 years old and lives with her mother, sibling and husband in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent that belongs to her mother. Her husband attends university and during his summer holiday, he operates a taxi service in his town. Enhjargal started her own business by operating a computer and copying services in a rented space at the Shine Tushig trade center in 2009 after her mother in law received a loan from a bank. She has recently found success with her new business and with her earnings, she started selling a variety of cellphones and parts in 2010. She is a modest and well calculated person. Enhjargal is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase more cellphones for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cellphones

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while three have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and transport costs.

She operates an agrovet shop selling cattle farm products, neighbours and passersby being her potential customers. Loice faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build rental houses in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu because of low interest rates and diverse favorable products.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina Z. is from the village of Sumalag, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Magdalina is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys, raises and sells pigs. In the picture they are using a motorcycle to carry pigs, with her husband as the driver. Magdalina has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Magdalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Magdalina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies
